description:
Character and atmosphere, from the floor-to-ceiling wood, to the ironwork fixtures, to the black-and-white cheesy 30s comedy playing on the TV: Colibri stands as tall as the cactus on the bar among the crowded SF food scene.

An extravagant drink menu kicks things off, and Colibri is the master of the tequila, with plenty of alternatives of other varieties.

I normally would have ordered the guacamole, which is made fresh near your table, but being on Eastern time caused me to go straight to the entree. As I looked around, I might have been the only one not partaking in the guac, and it looked good. Next time!

The tri-salsa and tortilla appetizer was different and tasty, plus I felt all culture-y eating it, kind of like the old-town Mexican version of down-South bbq sauce and Wonder bread (yes my friends that's a thing).

It was time for the Especialidades. The word is justifiably long to match the special selection of diverse choices. Especialidades! I sound so cultured repeating it!

Pausing at the Mac-n-cheese ever so briefly, tempted, I remembered the wise advice I gave my wife (which she promptly ignored): "pick something in their zone". For instance, don't go to the oldest German restaurant in Boston and expect them to have good salmon, then commandeer your dinner-mate's schnitzel and have him eat the salmon (not that this ever happened).

So, I moved along to the filet. It also looked intriguing: goat cheese stuffed chile, mashed potatoes, sautéed spinach, chipotle chili sauce? Am I ignoring my own sage advice in ordering a filet at a turn-of-century Mexican establishment? 

Throw caution to the wind; they had beef back in the 1900s, and they probably served it this way, before anybody had attempted to put the words "gastro" and "fusion" together with hyphens. That's right: go for the beef!

It was a risk-and-reward experience, and I made out like a beef-eating bandit. Tastiness all around, with a little chipotle keeping it spicy. Okay I'll admit I only ate the goat cheese and not the whole chile, but we can say it was part-garnish right?

Mexican coffee looked super-tasty, but I need to sleep since this Easterner is probably waking up at 3, so next time (I could fill a grocery store with all those next times).

I'll stop by again, maybe just crush guac and mac, washed down with that coffee. You only go around once unless you come back, and I'll certainly try.
author: Paul V.

description:
Food was average and overpriced, except for the the churros that were actually good.

Waiter was nice, but the bar and kitchen were so slow. 30 minutes to get a drink and we only got it after complaining. After 30 min waiting for two margaritas (the excuse was that there was only one bartender there on a Friday night) we saw a group of 4 seating by the bar and the lonely bartender serving them right away.

Our fajitas, which were quite small for the price and quality, took 1 hour to be served. Thinking back we wish we had just left after seeing how bad the service was. While the waiter was polite and apologetic, the restaurant just doesn't work.
author: Giovanna R.

description:
Came here for brunch after volunteering with a group of friends at Project Open Hands (walking distance away!).

We started off getting bottomless mimosas & Bloody Maria's. I got the Bloody Maria, and it was soo good! The tequila actually complements the drink way better than the vodka in a typical Bloody Mary. 

The meal comes with fresh tortillas with three salsas (verde, mango, and red). The servers probably thought we were annoying asking for so many extra tortillas and ruining our appetite, but they come out hot and fluffy, and are addictive. 

We ordered the quest as an appetizer, which we ate with more tortillas (sooooo good).

When our meals finally came, we were pretty full but still able to appreciate how good it was. Next time I would recommend sharing a dish. 

I got the Desayuno Mexicano, which comes with delicious steak on tortilla, chorizo eggs, beans, and rice. Delicious!

My boyfriend got the pozole verde, which was a different take on pozole. He loved it!

Would definitely come back :)
author: Miranda N.

description: Really really good. If you are looking for authentic high quality Mexican, this is the place for you. I got the carnitas, and my wife got the prawns. Our group got the chips and salsa and guacamole and homemade tortillas for appetizers. VERY VERY good. Someone ordered chorizos for dessert, the best ever. It is a bit pricey, but worth it. Extensive drink list, with 7 different types of margaritas. Would definitely come back.
author: Brian B.

description:
My hotel recommended this restaurant.  The ambiance is good.  Didn't care about my seat in the corner.  Too squished with another table.  Ordered the pescado tacos for appetizer, it was good.  For main course ordered the lamb shank in banana leaves.  It was just ok.  Have had better.  
So overall a 3.5 star.  I give them a solid B+.  This may be the best Mexican near Union Square.  But there is so much choice in this area, that I'll not repeat.
author: M M.

description:
I did'nt make reservations for this place ahead of time, and lost a lot of time doing it on the spot, finally decided to take the high tables, since we were getting late for the play

The ambience was good, but the space was crowded, it seemed wired why we weren't given a table since I saw quiet a few of them empty on my way to the restroom

The service was slow

The food was great, but really less quantity for the price

Overall, if you only want to go for the food, and have enough time you could try this place
author: Amar P.

description:
Everything good 

Food good 

Drink good 

Guac good 

Beans good 

Service good 

Atmosphere good 

Bar tender good 

Tortillas good 

Salsa good 

Prices ok only
author: Miguel L.

description:
Came to this place because it was close to our hotel. Ordered guac and salsa for the appetizer. It was really good. 
Wife ordered pasole and i ordered filet mignon. Wife's pasole was very bland. Didn't eat much. My filet was cooked good. But was very small. 28$ for a steak and potatoes, and the steak was a little more than 1/2" thick and about 3" round. Service was slow. The bus boys were more helpful than the waitress. Took us more than 20mins to get our check after our plates were cleared...
90$ for my wife and i, 1 appetizer, 1 beer, 2 entrees.
Prob won't come back.
author: nate b.

description:
On our first night in San Francisco, we went to Colibri for dinner, as it was near our hotel.  The food was excellent, but pricey.  

We ordered tostadas de tinga for an appetizer, shared a filet mignon for an entree (not to save money, but because we knew we'd be too full if we each had an entree), rice and mushrooms as extra sides, and a pitcher of sangria. 

The food was delicious, and one entree between us was more than enough.  My favorite dish was the mushrooms -- button mushrooms cooked with chilis and lime.  

While I really enjoyed the food, there wasn't a lot on the menu that I could eat, as most dishes had pork or goat cheese in it, hence the three stars.  But if you're in the area and have a little extra cash for a fancy meal, I'd recommend Colibri.  

[Yelp collections: West Coast 2018]
author: Jasmine A.

description:
I did not expect to find authentic, delicious Mexican food in San Francisco and then along comes Colibri to change my mind! Although the reviews said it would be busy, thankfully it was very relaxed when we came in at 6.45pm on a Thursday evening.

Service was exceptionally quick and we had drinks within five minutes of being seated- my choice was the Basil and Strawberry Margarita and it was delicious!
We ordered Gucamole to share and it was super fresh and extremely tasty, our entrees were also fantastic! The seared Duck with Green Mole sauce was divine but the fish tacos were kind of gross, super fishy with not much other flavour so one star was taken off for that. 
Really enjoyed my dining experience here.
author: Leah M.

description:
I had to know what all the Hype was about! I have 
family and friends who love coming to Colibri. 

I came here on a Sunday with my boyfriend. We walked in around 3pm with no reservation and it was not needed. The menu has a lot going on so it was hard to choose.

From the moment we walked we were greeted, given a table. The few interactions we had with the server Luis were friendly. We decide to sit at the bar therefore sometimes servers tend to look the other way. "Since it's not their table"  

The bartender had an outgoing personality, and super helpful when it came to the knowledge of each drink, plus the drinks were truly delicious. Alejandro also recommended the guacamole, wings, and Chamorro. Which were all great recommendations. 

Drinks, service, and atmosphere - 5 stars 
Food - 4 stars some flavors were a little off but with more tasting before serving can be fixed. 

Overall, I was super happy we decided to try it out! Definitely will be back!
author: Diana V.

description:
We came here because we were craving Mexican food and Colibri had great reviews on Yelp.  Sadly, I did not have the same experience.  We had a group of four and the service was quite slow.

We started with the guacamole which was $16. It had so much lime in it it was almost inedible. When the waiter asked how we liked it and I started to mention that there was too much lime he asked if we would like a new one and prefaced it with it with something that sounded like this is a common complaint so I am not sure why they do not alter the recipe. 

The rest of the entrees were also mediocre. My wife's salad with shrimp was the favorite of the table, while the rest of us were disappointed. The carnitas plate was decent but nothing special and the Chile Rellenos were the most disappointing.  We tried the veggie and the carnitas and neither were worth it.
author: Danielle B.

description:
We stopped by to get a quick bite before our concert at August Hall. 

We order the mac and cheese with chorizo and the mole with chicken and both were fantastic. 

I would also recommend the home made guacamole. 

I would come back again and recommend to anyone who is looking for some tex mex food.
author: david b.

description:
I could not have been more surprised by this place. Colibri Mexican Bistro is the real deal. 

Came to Colibri after striking out at La Taqueria, which is closed on Monday's (highly annoying). Colibri gets excellent reviews but upon walking in it didn't really fit the bill for authentic Mexican cuisine that we were looking for and the place was literally empty so it wasn't looking good. 

Furthermore, we were looking for a taqueria, Colibri is not that so we were even more discouraged. They have tacos, but the menu is dominated by dishes and they're somewhat expensive. 

We got tacos. Every type they offer. They were AMAZING. Best corn tortillas I've had to date.
author: Nik G.

description:
Ambiance- check 
Customer service- check 
Tasty delicious food and drinks- check check check!!! ( emojis do not show up lol so had to write it out) 

Loved this place! It is def worth it!
author: Adelita V.

description:
I stepped into Colibri for a late lunch. While I would've enjoyed sampling some of their tequila, it just wasn't a good idea on such an empty stomach, so I stuck with water. I ordered the Tostito de Papa (vegetarian) and it was $20 for a relatively small fried potato on top of some steamed spinach. The potato was fine (not excellent but not bad) but $20‽ That seems rather disproportionate. The salsa served was ok (again, not excellent but not bad). 
Other than that, the place has a nice atmosphere and seems to have a pretty decent cocktail menu. But there's really no reason to pay that much for mediocre Mexican food when I could easily just go to the Mission and be much happier.
author: Najla A.

description:
This was my first visit here. I was staying at the nearby Hilton Hotel near Union Square on business. I was alone and in the mood for some Mexican dinner. Nearby Colibri was highly rated. I arrived here at around 6pm without a dinner reservation. I was seated at a nice table for two overlooking the bar area. I enjoyed my two margarita specials of Tres Generaciones for $12 each. I like spicy Mexican, therefore, Carlos recommended their Chile Relleno pork for $20, which I really enjoyed. It was served with two different choices of hot and mild sauces. I preferred the hot sauce. 

Carlos served my needs well. My total bill was $50 less gratuities. I will definitely return here.
author: Tony J.

description:
Met my friend and her sister here for their sunday brunch and since I haven't been to many places that serve bottomless mimosas, it's kinda hard for me to rate this place. Their bottomless mimosas were $18, which was a little pricey, but they did their job. They were pretty strong and definitely got me buzzed. 

They have a 2 hour limit and you can't just order their mimosas, you need to order an entree, as well. I ordered their steak omelet, which was $15. It wasn't bad, but it also wasn't extremely good..  I don't remember what my friend and her sister ordered, but they weren't raving about their food. Honestly, you can probably find cheaper options..

Overall, we had a good time, but will probably check out other places. Our total came out to be around $120, I assumed I was going to pay around $30, but I paid $45 including tip. So if you do end up coming here, make sure you bring money! It's not cheap!
author: Rosamond H.

description:
Ceviche = amazing
Camarones de Reboso = 
Carnitas son fuego
Definitely an awesome restaurant with cool ambiance. Service was attentive
author: Ryan C.

description: Fresh tortillas and salsas to start were the high point, its hard to beat a warm & tender tortilla and guajillo chili salsa. Ceviche was pretty satisfying, nice balance of acid and the seafood was just the right size and ratios of garnish. Tried the four tacos from Mexico City, bit of a let down as it was all pretty cold and tacos were overstuffed with meats that dodo not seem very fresh and vibrant. Flavors were muddled. For the price those tacos should be excellent, as well the service team was a bit disconnected and had to be asked what the food was with each course.
author: Gary FX L.

description:
I have to split the difference here and go with three stars.

The server was friendly. The food was great. The drinks were fantastic. The setting was beautiful. The prices were reasonable.

And then it took half an hour, and asking SIX TIMES until we got our check. We were both late to our next engagement. Super duper irritating. Six times may be a new record for us.
author: Sean B.

description:
My wife and I had the chance to have Colibrí this past weekend with my family. 

Location: nice location right near union Square near the Westin St Francis. 

Ambiance: casual for lunch at least with slight Mexican flair. 

Drinks: good margaritas and decent variety of both Mexican and non Mexican beers on tap. 

Food: LOVED their pozole verde which they make with chicken instead of pork; outstanding flavor and served traditionally with side of cabbage, radish, onion, avocado, and dried oregano. Queso fundido was also good with freshly made corn tortillas. 

Definitely a good spot in SF for if you get a Mexican food craving.
author: Brenton B.

description: For high-end Mexican, this place is pretty good. Service was good, drinks were good, food was good, etc. You can get the same food for half the price at any decent taqueria, so the big difference here is the atmosphere. And guess what ... it is good. Not great. But definitely better than a taqueria. I'd say it's worth the extra money if you want the higher level of service and a fun festive atmosphere.
author: Curt B.

description:
Really good restaurant! Our waiter, Armando, was really friendly and attentive!

We got the Guac (spiciest level, which had a great kick) and a few orders of the tostadas and tacos. Even though they're under appetizers, they're actually a good enough size to be a meal. The fish tacos are super fresh and tasty and the tostadas had a really good amount of chicken. 

If you like spicy, ask for extra hot sauce! They have their homemade habanero blend that's awesome!
author: Ali C.

description:
Had an awesome brunch!  Luis was prompt and nice.  Food was great and the drinks were stiff.  

Minus one star for the hostess, she was borderline condescending.  Ummmmm....yea not ok.

Paco the bartender makes the best bloody mary's!

Had the chilaquiles verdes and the pozole.  Highly recommend both!

I will most def be back.  Hopefully management will let the hostess know that she is the first impression to the facility so please smile and be courteous to customers.
author: Veronica A.

description: Colibri is a fantastic traditional Mexican restaurant and the service was excellent, especially our waiter Armando, who went out of his way to make sure that we had everything that we needed, y mas :-)
author: Tony C.

description: Excellent meal, drinks and appetizers. Great service despite being packed. Book ahead to get a table.
author: John R.

description:
TL;DR: Fantastic Mexican restaurant with a great ambience, staff, and even greater food.

I stopped by this place on an early Friday evening, and thankfully it wasn't too crowded and was very easy to get seated. The staff was incredibly nice and attentive, giving great recommendations and attention. 

I had the guacamole and chips to start, and it was definitely fantastic. Very generous helping of guacamole that had great flavor, and it also came accompanied with some great salsa that complemented the guacamole and chips very well. 

For my main dish, I had the mole poblano that looked as good as it tasted. Very rich flavor and the chicken was very well cooked. Ended with some churros, and that was the perfect way to finish off a tremendous meal. 

I highly recommend you check out this place if you can. A hidden gem in the city!
author: William T.

description: This exceeded my expectations. We made a reservation on open table and were seated right away, most restaurants in San Fran have a crazy long wait or won't seat you without one, and this place sat us as our party arrived. The drinks were delicious, a huge variety was offered on tequilas. The plates are small, but well executed. We got the guacamole, ceviche, mole poblano, filet mignon and camarones, everyone loved their food and the service was exceptional. Will have to come back before we leave!
author: Stephany C.

description:
I've lived in SF for 10 years and ashamed that this is my first time here. Definitely one of my top 3 favorite Mexican restaurants in the city. Margaritas are on point  

Make sure you get the churro dessert!
author: Allen K.

description:
Stumbled upon this place while walking and waiting for a shabu place nearby to open. Popped in here for a drink since we saw a bar inside and lots of stickers/Michelin recommended signs outside.  

We ended up staying for dinner also. While enjoying a margarita during happy hour, we were offered complimentary salsa with tortillas. The waitress said $2 more for chips. I had to ask her a few times to clarify after she said they automatically give you tortillas. I'm thinking how do you dip that in salsa? Anyway we tried it and glad we did. They're all homemade tortillas which make a huge difference! Loved all 3 salsas (a sweet mango one, a green spicy one, and a red salsa). Since happy hour goes from 5-7pm we decided to just order food off the menu. What's great is happy hour are their normal portions. I like that the portions came out decent and not like some places where they'll have a different portioned happy hour menu. 

Tried the sopes which were delicious! There's 3 of them, all different (chicken, meat, and vegetable). The meat and veggie ones were favorites. Paired with the salsa they gave and it was amazing. We also had this taco thing which was really good. 

I'd definitely go back!
author: Melissa L.

description:
I am a bit sad to write this but I hope management takes importance to train their staff for better Customer Service.
I came a few weeks ago for Happy Hour and both my friend and I work in hospitality.We loved the website and passion the chefs had but the service we encountered was terrible.
We sat down at a high table for about 10 minutes until a guy who was busy showing the bar tender videos on his phone noticed us. We ordered drinks and I saw the bar tender gal did them quick however they were sitting at the well waiting for our server to put down his phone and bring them our way.
I was annoyed and told him to please be more attentive and he said,"I am not your server ok."
Luckily anther nice guy came and took over but the other guy left a bitter taste from the lack of respect and service. I truly hope management enforces for better service but other than that our food was great.
author: Gardenia H.

description:
Pricey restaurant but excellent food. 

We went to this restaurant for a large family dinner because they took reservations for nine and had good reviews. We had no idea it was such a nice restaurant so it definitely took us by surprise. 

The table started off with margaritas, which everyone enjoyed, and the guacamole served with chips, salsa, and tortillas. Everything we had to start off was really good and the service was great. 

The menu was quite expansive, but not for vegetarian and vegan options. I ended up ordering off the side menu, getting beans, rice, and vegetables. I then used the tortillas from the guacamole appetizer to make tacos. Surprisingly it was a lot of food and it was all really good. I ended up sharing my sides with my boyfriend because he ordered the filet minion and it was a crazy small portion. He was able to fill up by using my tortillas and sides to make tacos with his steak. He did say the food was really good, but if you can't fill up on a $25 dinner plate I don't know if I can say it's worth it. 

The restaurant itself is really nice, the service was great and everyone enjoyed themselves. The only negatives I have to say are the portion sizes and for such a nice restaurant the bathroom was actually really disgusting. All in all, if you're feeling fancy and not too hungry give it a try.
author: Emily N.

description: I have been coming to this restaurant for a very long time. At least 10 years, prior to relocating to SF. As a local, I can attest that this is one of the best sit-down Mexican Restaurants in San Francisco. It's never a miss. Everything from the tequila offerings, fresh fruit margaritas and not to mention the food. I have tried everything on their brunch and dinner menus. You really can't go wrong. Impress your friends by ordering the following appetizers; queso fundido, guacamole made to order), sopes surtidos y tostadas de tinga. If you're lucky, Armando will be working and will give you the best service ever.
author: Dori M.

description: Hermando was the best person ever! Highly recommended for a late night churros spot in the city.
author: Adrianna T.

description: Colibrí is a place we always come visit when in SF. Location is great and easily found near Union Square, across from the Geary & Curran Theaters, and a short walk from the Powell BART station. The food is excellent and authentic. Aguas frescas are always delicious and not too sweet. The service makes the dining here even better. Attentive and thoughtful servers. Bathrooms could be a little cleaner.
author: Diana G.

description: Best meal I've had in a while and I eat out in SF all the time. I got the Mole Poblano, the plantains, and a glass of Ferrari Carano Siena. All 3 were really good!
author: Cameron A.

description:
Our best meal, by far, in SF.
We had just arrived after a long drive and Colibri was recommended by a friend who had been there. 
The atmosphere was relaxed. We loved the fact they were playing on the TV's old school Mexican 70's movies. 
We started out with a very strong and delicious spicy margarita. It took us no time to place an order of 3 Casa Tacos (steak, fish and chicken). All were amazing and fresh. In addition to the tacos we also had the carnitas with rice which were delicious! The best was indeed saved for last: Chorros with dolce de leche ice cream stuffed with cream. Holy sh*t it was out of this world. We still talk about it being top 3 desserts of all time...a very big feat indeed. 
Service was great. We went off peak and weren't rushed or felt out of place. 
Their prices are reasonable. 
Definitely worth a stop in SF. ENJOY!
author: Pasquale R.

description:
We had a great meal here. I tried the Chille Relleno with Corn on the Cob, and my friend had the Mole Poblano. We tried the Macho Margarita, Alma, Margatini, and even did some shots. 

All in all we loved the food, service, and ambiance. We're just here for the weekend and wish we could come back often! 

We got here early because we had no reservations. I'm glad we did because this place gets really packed later in the evening !
author: Ssisi Z.

description: This restaurants food deserves at least 4 stars...but there service is some of the worst. We sat for 45 minutes without anything, they then realized they "lost" are order ticket. There were literally 4 people in the restaurant at the time, so they weren't even busy. Pretty ridiculous how long we had to wait!!!
author: Tatum T.

description: One of the best, most authentic Mexican restaurants I've been to. Armando gave us exceptional service and the ambiance was perfect! Will definitely come back.
author: Noelle A.

description: This is going to be my go-to spot for Mexican food in San Francisco from now on. Luis, our server, was very attentive & his service was excellent. They serve fresh homemade tortillas with a fresh salsa trio to start. The pozole was very hearty & thick with the perfect amount of tangy flavor. The black bean puree was so flavorfull. The chorizo was delicious & the beef steak was tender. The dessert churros are to die for. Everything was amazing. I highly recommend this place.
author: Melanie P.

description:
We had Colibri for the first time yesterday and the food was amaaazzingg! It was my fiancés birthday and I was in a bind to try and find a place to take her...thank God we came here because she loved everything she tried. 

I would highly recommend their Ceviche, Churros, Guacamole...all are wonderful. 

Definitely will not be our last time coming here. Enjoy!
author: Kyle H.

description:
Good food, great service, and reasonable. We had a show at the Curran, and it was perfect. The hostess went out of her way to seat us without reservations, and our server was prompt and polite.  They didn't chit-chat, as it was busy - which was great.
There's a decent bar, good crowd.
We were in and out, with drinks , salad, dinner and dessert, in 45 minutes! 
Excellent job guys!
author: Clifford M.

description: Excellent service and food, warm ambiance and super reasonable prices. Thank you for a great evening!
author: Houshan A.

description: The food was decent, but overall I wasn't totally thrilled. Call ahead and check the wait time before you go too, because I had to sit at the bar due to it being so crowded. Service was slow, food was just okay. Not the best place in the area, I stopped here out of convenience and would probably not go back.
author: Brianna L.

description: Decent food but the service is lousy. I was ignored and when I asked for what I wanted a second time, they "forgot". Seriously?  I'm sitting at the bar? I'm right in front of you, how can you forget me?
author: Tim T.

description:
Took an Uber over from the other side of town for a late dinner.  Showed up at 9:40pm when the restaurant says they are accepting new diners until 10pm.

The restaurant was closing.  Not accepting new patrons.

The staff was nice about saying they didn't want our business but still sucks they don't honor their advertised hours.
author: Lane C.

description: Always enjoy coming here with friends from out of town. Breakfast is amazing. Don't pass up the chorizo or the mole!
author: David M.

description: Super slow service. Overpriced mediocre food with small portions. I went in because of the 4 star rating... check all the reviews that didn't post. All true...
author: Steph S.

description: Got there at 9:40pm and they said they are trying to close! Wouldn't seat nor serve us "we r trying to close early"! Bogus!
author: Anne W.

description: Stopped by on a Wednesday to a full house. The food was excellent as well as the atmosphere. Will return again with family! Authentic Mexican food indeed.
author: Ashlee M.

description: This was a cute restaurant that we tried out before heading to a concert. Made reservations, thought we were going to be late so we called to notify them, ended up being only 5 mins late and our table had been given away. Ended up being seated shortly after and we were well taken care of, had the chorizo macaroni and cheese along with trying the fresh guacamole. The owner (maybe) gave us a couple free shots and we were out. Sangria btw had great flavor.
author: Erika U.

description: Just had my birthday dinner at this place, very delicious Chile relleno! Loved that my large table was somewhere in the restaurant where we could still hear one another talk and it wasn't too hectic or crazy in there even though it was a weekend night. I felt at ease and the waiters were great! Only reason I'm giving it 4/5 Stars was that they got my reservation wrong by two and half hours. I got it fixed because I called to confirm the time but had I not we would have all showed up and not had a table. Really loved the ambience, the margaritas, and the staff was lovely!
author: Lily R.

description:
Hubby and I stopped her for a late lunch on a Sunday. We were seated right away. We came at around 2pm and were given the dinner menu.
The menu did not have the usual options and seem to have a variety which was good. There were 2 options for vegetarian entree: Chile Relleno and Tortita de Papas.
I opted for Tortita de Papas as it was recommended by our server and it looked different.
I would rate the dish 4 stars. It was a cheese potato patty, like a croquette with tomato sauce and served over sauteed spinach. 
We also ordered mexican corn on cob. That would be more like a 3 stars. I love mexican corn but this one did not match the expectations.
We loved the warm homemade tortillas with 3 types of salsa sauces which our server got us before the food arrived.  
The service was friendly and but a bit slow. The restaurant is a little pricey but that might be expected due to the location.
author: Priya A.

description: Prompt service, excellent food and beautiful mexican embiance. Definitely will be back for more of amazingly delicious tacos sempler, mouth watering guacamole and best margaritas ever. Yummmmm!
author: Gena F.

description: Arturo was amazing server and the food is delicious. I enjoyed coming here on my birthday!! The filet Mignon is delicious and everything on the menu is fresh.
author: Cynthia M.

description: Awesome place! Delicious food, would definitely return. They make the food on the spot so it's very fresh. Had the sopes as apps - great for 2 people and the carnitas as the entree. Really truly enjoyed it. Flavored margaritas were great to.
author: Yani G.

description:
Drinks were excellent. Check out the Mezcalito and the Herby Margarita. We got 2 rounds.

I ordered the shrimp which is wrapped in bacon and stuffed with cheese and smoothered in Chipotle sauce. Sounds delicious right? Unfortunately, there was no flavor really. My girlfriend thought the same for the Mole she ordered. No flavor and kind of dry. 

For the price and the location from our apartment, we are not going to return.
author: Günter L.

description: My boyfriend and I are visiting San Francisco, and are staying in Union Square. We found this place on yelp and it is amazing. We both ordered the pineapple tacos, corn, house margaritas + churros! We would highly recommend! Rosy was our server + she was extremely helpful, and let us know that the appetizer portions were enough for entree! This place won't disappoint!
author: Susy B.

description: This place is a good place for a Mexican style brunch. I recommend ordering the chilaquiles. They also bring you a trio of salsas and homemade tortillas! If you're up for a boozy brunch, they have bottomless mimosas. Definitely worth it!
author: Krystal D.

description:
Nice place to go with your friends or coworkers, for drinks and bites.
Jorge and Janet are the best bartenders. Happy hour menu prices are fair, and the food is great. You definitely need to try!
author: Ian Z.

description: Best place I've visited in sf my waitress was amazing! Nayely thank you for everything. You the best! PS if the owner/manager reads this please give them a praise she's my main reason I come to this place.
author: Hudie M.

description:
This is my 4th time eating here and never have been disappointed!
Guacamole spicy is a must! 
The corn tortillas are to die for!
Great place for vegetarians! 

Please do not skip dessert the churros are so amazing!

Carlos has been my server twice he's on top of everything.

Will always squeeze this place In when I'm in the city
author: SkyeBlu W.

description:
Food was excellent!  Really enjoyed the guacamole and the mango pineapple salsa.  The empanadas were also very good.  
Sebastian was an attentive, friendly, personable server.
author: Tina S.

description: Great food, service & experience! Would definitely recommend if you're a SF local or just visiting for the weekend!
author: Katelyn U.

description: Been coming here for years and I don't even live in SF. Authentic Oaxacan style Mexican food. Luis is a great waiter. Come for the churros, stay for the encyclopedia tequila list.
author: Adam L.

description:
At one point I would have given this restaurant 4 Stars, but my recent experience, not bad, not bad at all, in my opinion has slipped a bit from the jewel it was when it first opened.

Our Server Nayely was lovely.

I took an out of town guest, who was raving for several days about her meal.

We were seated way in the back, back, near the kitchen. Which was odd as the restaurant wasn't full at all. I should have said something, next time. Also, the usual more intimate lighting is now replaced with full overhead lights, which makes me feel a bit like I'm in a diner.

What I do appreciate is this is not your "usual Mexican Fare" so you will be hard pressed to find Mission Street Mexican food (aka Burrito) @ this restaurant. The menu is very creative with wonderful options to choose from.

We started with the Guacamole, which you can't go wrong, it's so authentic. However, we did ask for it medium spicy and it came rather bland. So we asked for something to spice it up and were presented with some chopped chiles, a tad odd I thought. They didn't have any "salsa" as such. Plus, they no longer make it at the table and don't serve it in the actual bowl, but in a plastic to go container in the bowl. It's always been about the authentic experience, so this was a bit disappointing "to me". Still a very adequate amount for the price and warm tortilla chips and warm tortillas just add to the experience.

Friend ordered Ceviche which was Out of this World FANTASTIC and a Huge bowl of this goodness. She couldn't even begin to finish it, so gratefully I accepted her leftovers.

Last main course was the Chile Relleno which was the Best Chile Relleno I have ever had and not "deep fried". We had ours stuffed with meat instead of vegetables. The flavors exploded in your mouth, only leaving you wanting more. Wanting more because it was a stand alone Relleno, on the small side, on some bean sauce. Of this, I was a tad disappointed, especially considering the price which was well over $20.00 I think. Which is quite outrageous for "1" Relleno with no garnish or anything. For this price, I think you could add a little scoop of Beans and a little scoop of rice to make the presentation a lot more presentable or at least make you think you are getting a good deal for the price.

We finished  with a Mango Brûlée which was lovely and so light and very refreshing without feeling heavy. 

I will return, but will reconsider my food choices in regard to cost and abundance.
author: Marla B.

description:
Had a wonderful eating experience, the food was very tasty. Staff was very attentive to our table. Being from San Diego I know good Mexican food, this place delivers. 

The fresh corn tortillas, salsa with a draft beer, set the stage for the homemade chile relleno, fresh beans and rice. 

Will definitely come back when in town again.
author: E O.

description: Very authentic Mexican food! Being from Arizona we were not expecting it to be so good. Awesome food and awesome margaritas! Best corn on the cob I have EVER had. Definitely worth it! Stop by if you get a chance! Was no wait either ...
author: Haley D.

description: Wonderful food and our server Sebastian was wonderful. The guacamole appetizer was delicious and I recommend it as a great way to get started. Thank you!
author: Joy W.

description:
Getting here was a comedy of errors. We kept being delayed. I called three times to change the reservation time.
I felt pretty badly about it.
The place is pretty popular among the Gluten-free tribe, so it was the top of the list. 
When we finally got there, we immediately ordered Guacamole. It comes with chips and little tortillas. I really want to know what masa they use, because those tortillas pack a deliciousness upper cut. Anyhow- since we live in a place where pepper is considered spicy, we are pretty used to ordering "ULTRA SPICY", we did that. It was delicious, but occasionally challenging. The next day it was excellent, btw.
The place was a little more glamorous than expected. It has a beautiful bar, stocked high with tequila.
Oh yeah.
Tequila.
It's pretty much like going to tequila heaven. I was feeling ragged out from traveling so long, or I would have played more with the tequila. I had a nice margarita and left it at that.
My partner had the Chicken Mole and I had the Carnitas. 
The Mole was rich and velvety- as it should be. It complemented the chicken just fine. The carnitas were good. I should have ordered something more creative, but carnitas is kind of comfort food for me. Go figure.
The service I found to be well above average. Very friendly.

I think the next time we go, I will be more creative.
I think you should go.
If you are gluten-free, you certainly should go.
It's not going to change your life, but it's going to be really enjoyable.
author: Tatjana V.

description: This was our first meal in SF.  The chicken tinga appetizer and strawberry basil margarita were delicious. They prepared a special dish for my picky daughter, and she actually ate it (a big plus). The trio of salsas and tortillas were a nice addition before  our meal. The churros (and ice cream) were amazing!
author: Lee Anne M.

description:
Food was excellent, tostada's and Chile rellenos we're best I've ever had. The margaritas we're also poured well and very tasty. Are waiter Armando,  was the absolute best. He went way and above to make sure we enjoyed the food, and understood the menu. 

This spot will for sure be on the list for return trips into San Francisco.
author: Shawn P.

description:
Been coming here for four years. It's a favorite for out of town guests as well. It's upscale and the menu reflects a more upscale ideal. 

In my opinion the food lives up to expectations. I almost always get the ceviche which is fresh and abundant. 

I recently had the pork adobado. It was incredible with crispy pork skin and succulent meat inside. 

I've never had a bad dish and I look forward to my next visit.
author: Tim P.

description: I'm in town and working across the street from Colibri. So far I've been to the restaurant twice. I highly recommend it. Ive also recommended it to our cast and they have enjoyed it. The ambience is great. It's beautiful. The staff has been very courteous and awesome both times !  I feel we've had great service !  The food is SO yummy !  Ive gotten the guacamole for our table both times... perfect. The chips and 3 salsas are soooo good. Then I got the arroz de la mexicana. Oh yeah and the Chile relleno. I love the way they make it !  This is not a super chain with all the same stuff. This is intimate with excellent food and service!  I will be back again several times before I leave
author: Patrice M.

description:
Fantastic service and very accommodating with reasonable prices. 

We got the bottomless mimosa brunch for our birthday friend and it was everything that you could expect. 

Highly recommend!
author: Kiriti M.

description:
I am here for brunch and it is delicious!  I gravitate toward bottomless mimosas like a moth to a light.  

I was here Saturday morning and sat at the bar with my gf.  It was busy but not out of control.  Service was prompt and friendly.  

I got huevos rancheros and my gf got the Benedict. Both were great and not overwhelming with amount of food.  We got guacamole too - could have used a little more salt but we ordered it mild

You really can't go wrong with great food and bottomless mimosas. 

Totally lovely and sweet bartender who served us!
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
This place is busy during brunch. If you don't have a reservation you can probably find space at the bar. If you're vegetarian, they can make the chilaquilles without meat. Ask for veggies instead. 

Bottomless mimosas was fun! This place is pricey so be prepared to spend.
author: Sohil N.

description: 5 stars for there hand made tortillas and salsa. We ordered the chicken tinga tostadas. They were very good. The stuffed chicken is okay. They don't stuff it with much, needs more flavor. If you order a drink you will definitely get what you pay for. They make them nice and strong!!!
author: Marissa N.

description: The food here is really good, but what keeps me coming back are the churros. They are life changing - a must have!
author: Chris D.

description:
Colibri is an authentic slice of Mexican culture tucked away in San Francisco. 

I had the Mole Poblano and was not dissapointed.  It was the perfect mix of spice with mild notes of chocolate throughout. I also had the guacamole to start and it was an indescribable mix of creamy avocado, citrusy lime, and spicy jalapeno. 

If you're in town, you need to stop by Colibri for an experience that is sure to please anyone's palate.
author: Kegan M.

description: Great lunch with family! Luis our waiter was very attentive and let us know of the ingredients of one of their dishes and provided an alternative. Will definitely come by again when in town.
author: Gabby M.

description: Honestly such a BOMB restaurant! Excellent service! Everything you order is so good! Deff try the churros. Cheeers to Armando and Sebastian !  Carlos and Jospeh are also great servers :)
author: Amber S.

description: Awesome food! Love it. They gave us unlimited tortillas with salsa, which was really good! And even if you don't see anything you like on the menu for the entrees, you can always get a combination of the sides to suit your tastes. The ambience is really nice as well - really seems like a classy place for good Mexican dining. Would recommend the carnitas, the mushroom sides, and the shrimp mixed salad! Great service - we love Luis!!!
author: Kat C.

description:
Saturday morning brunch was very good. We arrived 15 minutes before our reservations and we were seated right away. All 3 of us ordered bottomless mimosas, which we all really liked. At first they were a little slow to refill our cups, but as the day went they picked it up and never had an empty cup.

We shared a guacamole to begin. It was very good and it came with salsa and tortillas. The tortillas are homemade and very delicious. For 12 dollars, the guacamole was a very good portion, and we also really liked all 3 of their salsas.

I ordered the chilaquiles, verdes. I really liked them and it was a good portion. Highly recommend this place for brunch in San Francisco.
author: Carlos P.

description:
One of the best, upscale restaurants in San Francisco. Really good appetizers. The guacamole with hand-made tortillas is a must!! Every main dish is really good. And for dessert, you can't go wrong with the churros.

Ask for Luis, he's a great waiter.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Location: close to the mall and a lot of offices on market. The inside is pretty dark and cramped. 

Service: I went with a big group and service was pretty good. The food came out super slowly though! 

Food: 
-Guac: delicious, ask for it extra spicy if you want. 
-Camarones en Mole: really good, though there weren't enough shrimp! The corn cake was like a soft piece of cornbread. 
-Elote: unfortunately, this was really bad. I was looking forward to it but it was barely even grilled and just tasted off. 

I probably wouldn't come here again, especially since the portions aren't great for the prices.
author: Shelley K.

description:
If you're looking for authentic Mexican food, I highly recommend avoiding this place. I found very few dishes on the menu that were Mexican. One of the staples of most Mexican restaurants in the U.S., the burrito, was noticeably absent from the menu.

The service was acceptable, but felt a bit rushed. People were polite but not particularly friendly. That left much to be desired for me.

In terms of the food, they have some creations that simply don't make sense to me. I tried an entree of bacon wrapped prawns served with rice. Why would you take a prawn and wrap it in bacon? The prawn is flavorful enough by itself. Wrapping it in bacon takes away the flavor of the prawn and just leaves you with the bacon taste. It made no sense to me, although I ordered it because I couldn't find anything else that I might like.

Another member of my party had a queso fundido which had a cheese that was hard to cut and was excessively greasy. It just wasn't good.

The restaurant is clean and the food is, for the most part, well prepared. The menu doesn't feel quite Mexican to me, though. I'd avoid this if place you're wanting to try actual Mexican food.
author: Andy C.

description: This is a legit good restaurant. Drinks were great, food is delicious and just the right size. And the service was awesome. Our server, Luis (who was awesome!), even brought a shot glass of agave on the side because my wife didn't want her margarita too sweet. Oh, and did I mention the churros? Yum. Do yourself a favor and get to Colibri.
author: Ben H.

description:
I ordered steak which tasted like some old ass chewy meat and top it off, it was placed on mash potato that tasted like it came from out of a box. The most basic platter was just confusing to like since the chipotle overrode the tasteless chewy meat. The ambiance was ok, nothing special !

What I did like was the service and the sangria. I would come back because of these two great aspects of this restaurant. Just wouldn't order any food.
author: Jeff D.

description:
Okay Andy C., are you kidding? A 2 star because they aren't authentic.  Because, wait for it..... they don't have a burrito. Really? 
I don't want to be a jerk and I didn't read the rest of your "review", but you will be hard pressed to find a burrito in Mexico. They are as American as Taco Bell.
So, to what matters - a great review for a restaurant that deserves it. Colibri, thank you for the charming personal service, it really stood out. The 4 salsas were inspired and bursting with flavor. The house-made tortillas were fluffy and really really delicious. 
The restaurant was packed when we arrived and it was late on a Thursday night because we flew in late. Yes, a little expensive, but we Yelp reviewers must understand that restaurant margins are slim, so if we want really good food, we should pay a little more and be appreciative to people who care to do their best.
I have eaten throughout MEXICO and take multiple trips there every year. Calibró is as authentic and inspired as some of the best restaurants in Oaxaca and MEXICO City. So thank you, we have a deep appreciation for the food of Mexico and my kids and I agree that this is the best Mexican food we have had in the US.
author: Kara H.

description:
This place is AMAZING!
Nayely was wonderful and the best server ever.
Margaritas were sensational.
Everything on the menu is Delish.
Guacamole was EPIC.  Ask for tortillas!
author: Renee F.

description:
Had a late lunch here with my boyfriend and a friend while we were visiting on vacation. Having been here years ago, I knew it was legit! I also know they do a boozy brunch on Sundays with bottomless mimosas. We were a bit late for brunch, so lunch and margaritas it is! 
LOVE the hand pressed tortillas and salsas they offer. Green is my fave... que picante! I wanted the Jamaica salad because I find grilled romaine to be so amazingly flavorful! But the waitress informed me that they were out of romaine. Super bummed because grilled romaine, done right, can be tough to find. Mixed greens instead. Chicken on the salad was nicely seasoned. Got a side of guacamole, also delish and a good portion for three of us to share. House margarita on the rocks (with salt of course) has fresh juice, you could taste it. Friendly, accommodating servers. I'd recommend coming here, if just for the salsas and tortillas. Stay for the margs and friendly staff! Will be back!
author: Dane K.

description: Luis is so attentive and all of the wait staff are very happy to serve everyone. It doesn't matter how many times I come here it's always cheery staff and amazing food. The Pazole is delicious and the Carnitas are fall apart perfect. Get the Guacamole, try not to eat it all before your food comes because it's also great with your meal. Save room for the churros! YUUUUUMMMM!!!!!
author: Amy H.

description:
Overall: The place looks great from the outside. When we arrived and opened the doors, I saw a rat run its life along the bar seats. I had this "ugh" look. Don't ask why we didn't leave. 

Food: I ordered the pepito and it was ok. It was $15 but the portion was small. It would have been nice if it had rice and beans to fill up. I'm on a diet, but something more than just my little sandwich would have been nice
author: Stephanie Y.

description: The decorations are nice, bordering on too much. And the food is overpriced for what it is. The fresh guac was solid, and the tortillas are warm, but everything else was more on the mediocre side. The mole was okay, and the Chamorro lamb was too heavy. The flavors were just lacking. We felt this place was more of a tourist trap.
author: Eva W.

description:
Awesome service (Adriana)!!!!! Authentic Mexican restaurant, don't come here asking for nachos or burritos. 
Ceviche on point!
author: Crimson O.

description: We really enjoyed a family dinner. Mexican rice was delicious, chicken breast fill d with mushroom and sause was AMAZING!!!!! The filled pepper was flavourful. Armando was really helpful and will definitely recommend this restaurant!!!!
author: Namrata T.

description:
Let's start with the fact that there are $14 bottomless mimosas. One of the best deals in the city!

The food: delicious, a great mix of traditional Mexican breakfast and some innovative twists on things. I got the chilaquiles (okay it's one of my staples) and although presented fancier than I normally have it myself, still tasted like exactly what I was looking for. They also bring out tortillas with some fun dipping sauces that I think are all made in-house.

Mimosas have the perfect OJ and champagne proportions, meaning they are orange but you aren't left wondering if there is even any champagne in there!

The service: wonderful! Personable staff who knew their menu well. Came by to fill up our mimosas again often.

Another reason this spot is a gem: it was 12pm on a Saturday and not crowded - we didn't even have to wait! Check out this amazing deal before the rest of the city finds out about it.
author: Neda S.

description:
Everything was amazing!!!  Food was delicious, service on point, and the experience exceeded expectations. 

Kicked it off with margaritas from the bar while we waited; they were very busy, but we were still seated quickly.  House made tortillas with a variety of salsas were a tasty way to start, followed by a robust and spicy ceviche that rivaled any from Central America.  The duck in green mole was surprisingly sophisticated and well composed, while being completely satisfying.  The latin twist on their filet was refreshing and hearty.  And the churros, oh the churros!!!  We'd probably skip the mango creme brûlée next time.

And Sebastian and the rest of the wait staff really took great care of us, and kept the table spotless while not being intrusive.

PS, the bartender mixed a mean margarita to boot.

Def worth a visit!!!
author: Ryan B.

description: One word: WOW!!! This is not your typical Mexican food, it's wayyyy unexpectedly better. We had the guacamole (spiced to your liking) corn on the cob, pozole verde (so much tender chicken), pechuga rellena de huitlacoche. All tasted amazing and so fresh! The service was great, attentive and genuinely nice. Highly recommend for a date night or for hanging at the bar. No margaritas were had tonight but I heard great things. We're leaving with full stomachs but feeling good!
author: Michelle P.

description:
Always have to preface my reviews with: I'm not typically a fan of mexican food.

Usually if you're looking for mexican food you want to go to the mission. This was more tex mex but pretty decent actually. The tortillas they bring with the salsa at the beginning was probably the best part of the meal. I also ordered fish tacos which came with those same tortillas so I was pretty full at the end of the meal. 

Service was great. I believe our waitress was Brooke
author: Laura D.

description:
I do not know why they would only have 3 stars.... This place was absolutely beautiful inside, amazing service and OMG THE FOOD!!! Their homemade salsas were magnificent, their Pozole Verde was to dieeeee for, their Bloody Maria was delicious.. I mean I just can't wait to come back.  

We found this spot randomly and decided to try it because we wanted a late brunch with some good drinks and we lucked out. Amazing!
author: Cierra H.

description: Everything tasted stale and simply reheated.  Chips were hard and stale.  Chicken wings were tasting reheated/stale.  Only liked the green salsa and queso. Bad chili relleno, bad fajitas, bad chips, bad ck wings.  They were lucky we were starving or we would have left.  Service was good.  Very surprised they have 4 stars.  I've been to many Mexican restaurants and usually love it. Maybe we came on an off day/time? very disappointed.
author: Rachael J.

description: Wanted a dinner place close to the ACT theater. I found this place on yelp and decided to try it. First off, I'm glad I made a reservation as it was quite busy. After we sat down we were brought an array of three salsas and homemade tortillas. I like this take on the standard of "chips and salsa". I'm vegetarian so I'm always a tad worried about finding good options at Mexican places. Myself and my partner tried one of each of their veggie options and were very pleasantly surprised! They were both very good!
author: Jacob S.

description:
One of my faves since 2005.

Handmade corn tortillas, their salsa sampler (that mango pineapple salsa slays), the guacamole made at your table, the chilaquiles verdes, the endless tequila selection.

I can't 5-star them, because the churros are no longer on point. They taste and look like the frozen kind. So disappointing! They used to serve up crispy deliciousness that tasted fresh, just like the kind the churro guy serves up from his little cart on some random corner in Tijuana in the Revolucion neighborhood. Freshly made churros are crispy on the outside, flaky like a mutha, and have soft, chewy, tender masa on the inside that renders you helpless the minute you savor it. The chocolate dipping sauce that used to accompany them, was equally delightful as well. Bring 'em back, Colibri!
author: Gabriela W.

description:
No service! I had bookings for lunch and after being seated, never had a waiter even look my way. I left after waiting 15 minutes. 
We came before a theatre performance a previous time and it was nearly the same. 
The management needs to address this or their ratings will continue to go down. 
Very disappointing.
author: Chispa E.

description: Great Mexican fare. Guacamole was amazing and there was plenty to feed 4. Carnitas was perfect and the churros are the best thing on the planet. Armando took great care of us and even let us tweak the specialty drinks. Great experience.  Great food
author: William S.

description: Amazing food and amazing service!!! Best Guacamole ever!!!!on our vacation from Chicago had a taste for some Tex mex and found it!!! Colibri Mexican Bistro is the Best we have had in years!!!!
author: Ian F.

description: Service was excellent, however the taste of the food wasn't something our palettes were used to.  We asked for chips and salsa and were brought flour tortilla and salsa.  The tortilla tasted like Masa, but the salsa selection was decent. I am used  to chili relleno with egg batter and lots of cheese inside. This one was just a huge chili with veggies inside.  The tortilla soup was bland.  My wife and I had two bites of our our food and couldn't eat the meals.  Fortunately, the server didn't charge us for this poor excuse for Mexican food.  I have to say, this is my new worse Mexican food I have ever had surplanted the place in that Mall of America.
author: David T.

description: Great mimosa brunch deal! Service was fast and pleasant! For vegetarians I would recommend the veggie omelet and for all you cheese lovers the cheese enchiladas are on point
author: Olivia P.

description: Great food and ambiance! The guacamole and salsa is amazing. Best part is the tortillas are homemade!
author: Raven N.

description:
Great ceviche and salad . Fast and friendly service. 
Spacious for large groups of people. I highly recommend it!
author: S M.

description: If you are looking for a taste of Mexico... this restaurant is definitely worth trying. From the friendly hostess to the knowledgeable waiter this restaurant is 5 stars. They make there own tortillas for starters and the brunch menu is authentic! I will be back! This is a must try if you ever visit San Francisco! Armando and Bladimir  took care of us! Must try!
author: Oscar G.

description:
Nob Hill/ TL never disappoints with their choices of restaurants and new food spots. This restaurant is found right below hotel Diva and two doors up from Katanaya Ramen place.

When here on a Thursday night and was surprised on how cozy the restaurant looks. I was pleasantly surprised.

This place has a vast array of Tequila offerings, they actually have a menu just for tequilas.

In terms of food I wasn't really impressed but if there's a WoW item, it has to be with the ELOTE, The grilled corn.. Just heavenly.

My friends and I shared the Guacamole, came to us in this rustic stone container that was huge. Ironically, once I dogged a spoon in it. It was so shallow that 1 person wouldn't be satisfied. Lol another thing that bothered me is the guacamole doesn't come with chips. Our server mentioned that aside from the $12 guacamole, chips are $2. She also mentioned that they do have soft tacos that are home made but is unlimited.

It also seems that they don't have a set menu, what you see online is no necessarily what they offer every night. 

My group go to try their Mole, Duck, and Carnitas.

Mole - Absolutely NO! Imagine a sauce out of burned pans- that's how it tasted.. And I'm being nice.

Duck - divine, they rendered all the fat making the skin crisp and duck heavenly

Carnitas - if you're looking for bang for your buck, this is it. Nothing special but very filling.

I probably come back just for a Cocktail with the ELOTE. It's that good.
author: Jan R.

description: The food at this Mexican restaurant is amazing. I ordered the Tortita de Papas as an Entree and the fresh Guacamole as an appetizer. I have no complaints. My friend ordered the Vegetarian Chile Relleno but the waiter accidentally brought out the Carnitas version. My friend can not eat pork so it was sent back. The manager Ruth was such a sweet heart. She comped his meal and gave us a round of drinks. I would highly recommend this restaurant because they have delicious food and a compassionate manger !
author: Asia S.

description:
Honestly- really disappointed. I'm not from here and wanted some good Mexican. Not the place.

I didn't have a reservation but EVERY table was available except any seats at the bar. The hostess was really nice and said "I can seat you but I need you out by 6:45".... uh okay? It was 5:08pm. 

Food itself was okay.... Guac I asked for it mild and it's better from Trader Joe's. Not worth 16$!!! everything else? Awful. Sopas were bland. Chips and salsa were okay. 

Server paid zero attention to me. Maybe because I ate alone but to had to wait 25 minutes to get his attention for a box and check. 

Finally the bartender came and checked on me and I asked for box and check and handed her my card. The check came back with no card and she disappeared. I got another guy to get her and she blamed me... "I gave it to you. You have it"

She found it under a seat at the bar... guess it fell out.

Overall bad experience. So many better places to go!
author: Ashley M.

description:
Excellent service and food!  Ask for Jorge!  He's the best!  Amazing Paloma!  
Amazing homemade tortillas!
author: michaela b.

description: Great quality food. Sopes were my favorite. Definitely coming back to try other dishes.  Our server Armando was very nice.
author: Juan M.

description:
Came in for a brunch with my girlfriend, her friend and his wife. We are visiting from DC, and have a different understanding of brunch than most places, but this place was great!

Started off with drinks and guacamole. Delicious quick guacamole served with warm corn tortillas that were made fresh. 

We ordered the Heuvos Rancheros, Tacos a la Mexicano, Desayuno Breakfast and Eggs Benedict. 

The Huevos Rancheros were delicious. Had a great black bean puree served with it as well. 

The salsas we're a little lacking. We asked for a hot salsa to add a little more heat to our food, but it was more tangy than anything. 

Would definitely recommend this place!
author: Aaditya S.

description: It was alright. The gauc was good, there wasn't much of it. I ordered the fish tacos *meh. My dinner date ordered a bowl of soup that she believes should have been bigger for the price. Didn't order drinks, but I don't think I would return.
author: Jay W.

description:
Exceptional dining experience

Start with the Guacamole!  We got ours spicy and it was very good and not overpowering

I recommend the enchiladas but my wife had the chili releno with carnitas

Honesty, you can't go wrong with either dish and since everything is made fresh to order; the entire menu seems like a viable option 

Indulge and ENJOY!!
author: Trevor C.

description: Went for bottomless mimosas, looks like price jumped AGAIN. It was $17 with a purchase of entree, 2h limit.   Entree has small portions, tasted good. However the brunch deal wasn't bottmless since they kicked me and my bf out! If you're lightweight, don't come here since one glimp of drunkness they won't serve you. After I heard that from the server it got me sobering up. But nope, they wouldn't even provide mimosas to my bf who wasn't even tipsy! Felt like we were ripped off the bottomless deal we'd paid for.
author: Dasom H.

description: Food has great flavor and has a traditional taste with a twist. Definitely worth coming enjoy brunch or dinner menu. Staff is a friendly as well so it's a plus!
author: Diana G.

description: Good service, tasty food, and delicious drinks. There are many choices of places to eat at in San Francisco, and this is definitely up there with the best of them.
author: Brian G.

description:
We loved this spot for brunch.  Every single thing we tried was very good and the bartender took great care of us.  
I love their enchiladas and chilaquiles.
author: DJ D.

description: Sebastian is the waiter ever!! We really enjoyed the food! Highly recommend the guac and chicken tosadas. Churros were recommended to us for dessert! Drinks were amazing as well. Highly recommend this place very convenient loaction next to union square.
author: Fifi F.

description: This restaurant was a sufficient Union Square option. It's menu is different from a traditional "Mexican" restaurant (i.e. tacos, burritos), which I enjoyed, but my family visiting was a bit thrown off by (so give them a heads up if they aren't aware that Mexican/Latin food is more diverse than a burrito). The service was friendly and efficient. This also isn't a really a vegan friendly restaurant, and vegetarian could be difficult too.
author: Ryan H.

description: We had the best meal tonight!  The food was delicious, service was great, and wonderful ambiance! Rosy Bonilla was the best! Her smile was so sweet and she took great care of us!
author: Ashley T.

description: It is crowded but definitely worth it. Guacamole is bomb.
author: Sarah P.

description: Food was amazing and service was exceptional!! Too bad I don't live in San Francisco or else I would be coming every weekend. Our server name Nayeli was exceptional. Super friendly and definitely took care of us. I definitely would recommend this restaurant 100%. Happy customer:)
author: Ana D.

description: Came here for dinner with friends. I would say make reservations so you're not waiting around for a table to open up. I like the Mexican decor it makes you feel like you're in a restaurant somewhere in Mexico. They had an extensive drink menu which I appreciated. I tried the Mezcalito which is kind of like a margarita but doesn't feel so sweet; they used fresh lime and orange juice. They gave us complimentary fresh tortillas with a side of three different salsas (mild, medium, hot). My friends tried the Lamb and said it was really good. Our waitress was very kind and the food came out promptly. I knocked off a star bc they're food menu is limited. For a Mexican restaurant I would expect there to be more meal options for vegetarians and vegans since the staple foods in Mexican cuisine are primarily vegetables and legumes. I'll come back for the drinks.
author: Cristal F.

description: If your looking for authentic Mexican, look no further.  The fresh guacamole is tremendous. Great Margaritas (huge selection) and the entrees were fantastic. To take the experience to the next level, ask for Joseth, great service and very helpful in choosing the perfect meal. Highly recommend Colibri.
author: Sal L.

description:
Went with one of my friends to this supposedly upscale restaurant last night. What a costly mistake it was!. 

We can get a taco bowl just about anywhere. I can recognize good Mexican food and this wasn't the case. I ordered the Camarones en Mole and got just a few pieces of small shrimp. They tasted good though, it came with a corn cake which tasted like cornbread. After that I had a small bowl of Pozole which wasn't bad either but wasn't hot enough.

Can we all agree that amateurs should not run a restaurant in the City nor should they be in a zone where the highest rated restaurants are located. The moral of this story is... start small and then move up. Maybe, buy a taco truck in East Oakland then move to a better location.
author: Chelsea J.

description: The food is so authentic! Drove all the way from San Jose for this restaurant. Give it the Mexican pass!
author: Cristina V.

description: Excellent food and service.  The tostadas were sooooo good. Really good cazadores margarita. And Luis our server was really great!!
author: I love t.

description:
Went to watch a broadway show across the street. Stopped by here for brunch Sunday afternoon. We had made a reservation and when we got there they took us right away. Glad we made a reservation it was a packed place. 

Ambiance - awesome. Well lit, friendly,attentive and happy servers. 

Good options for vegetarians. Food came out quick and it was flavorful 

We had the bottomless mimosas which we found to be a little on the weaker side. But they were bottomless so hey no complaints . 

If you are in the city with friends do stop by you'll enjoy the experience.
author: Cinnamonny B.

description:
We stopped by on a whim (and a friend's recommendation) and found Colibri to be quite interesting. It is a small; but very well decorated restaurant located in the Tenderloin. We arrived just in time for the dinner rush and were seated in one of the few remaining tables. I remember walking past a table where someone was making fresh guacamole - it reminded me of Chevy's. We were fortunate to be seated near their elegant bar which I'm told was featured on some Food Channel show. Sorry for the lack of details. In any case, I felt like I was dining in an airy Mexican resort. It was pretty nice considering the couple next to us was less than a foot away.

I had their filet mignon with ancho chili stuffed with goat cheese, served over mashed potatoes with sautéed spinach and chipotle chili sauce. It sounds like a lot; but the proportions were just right. There were so many other enticing menu items like sopas, shrimp, and carnitas (all that will have to wait for another visit). My friend highly recommended having dessert there, too - anything and everything sounded good. We ended up sharing a flan; but it seems the churro was the dessert of choice.

Definitely worth another trip. Everything was delicious!
author: Maricel S.

description: Great meal! Sebastian was excellent & food was top notch! The complimentary salsas were a nice touch...fresh homemade tortillas instead of greasy chips & three original salsas instead of the bland watery tomato onion salsa at every Mexican place. I had the lamb shank & it was full of flavor & cooked perfectly. My wife had the filet & loved it. Street corn was spiced well & tasted good. Churros (with a creamy center) & dulce de leche ice cream were a nice finishing touch! Good choice if you're by Union Square & hungry!
author: Patrick M.

description: Best central Mexican food in the Bay Area. I'm from Mexico City and this is the most authentic Central Valley food in San Francisco. Hightower recommend the guac and carnitas
author: Gail B.

description: The service was great! The food came out quickly and was delicious! They had home made tortillas that were  overall
author: Kacey A.

description: Cozy ambience. The food arrived quickly and was very tasty. I hd made a reservation, and we were seated promptly, great service!
author: Harry C.

description:
Been here many times, love there homemade high end taco trio.
They make their own tortillas with 3 dipping salsa's. This is a fine dinning restaurant, good Happy Hour.  Across from theater, union square location.
author: elissa s.

description: Came here for dinner with a group of friends and the food was super delicious! We really enjoyed the 3 different salsas and the fresh tortillas. The service was great and the staff were incredibly kind! Definitely recommend coming here!
author: Michelle H.

description:
I would have given this place 4 stars if the service had been much better than it was today. I booked a table for a party of 8 for lunch and, when I arrived, they did not have the booking and had to get a table prepared for us. Fortunately, my party was not there yet so the wait for the table was quite ok. I booked two weeks ago so no reason why they would not have expected us. 

The inside of this place is nice looking and has an open kitchen where you can see the staff preparing the food. The tables & chairs are quite comfortable. They have a great big bar at the front of the place and it was well stocked. 

On weekends they only have a brunch menu and we were limited in what we could order. I chose the carnitas omelette and it came with beans, roasted potato and tender pulled beef filling in an omelette. I loved it and was very satisfied with the flavours. The food here gets 4 stars from me :-)) The fresh orange juice was also very nice. 

The service was very slow and we had to ask each and every time for one thing or another. With a bit of improvement here they would be 4 stars for me. The waitress was nice and polite but simple things like, I will bring you chips and salsa for the table but it never arrived ;-)) instead she put tacos on the table for the meal or, coffee took about 20 mins for 8 people and they had a small amount of espresso cups so some of us got an espresso in a big coffee cup ;-)) 

I would come back here again. The food is good and tasty and the ambience is nice. It's also priced quite ok.
author: Sam S.

description:
This is a solid option just a couple blocks from Union Square. It is not too expensive and the food is good. The decor is interesting and it has a good sized bar.

We decided to order a bunch of appetizers and mains and go family style. It is not family style place, but it worked well for us. We started with a few appetizers, Empanadas and Queso Fundido Con Chorizo. The empanadas were good and consists of baked turnovers filled with ground pork, onions, garlic, roasted peppers, served with chipotle-tomato sauce, fresco, cheese and chipotle sour cream. The empanadas themselves were a little bland, but the sauce helped make them good. The queso was tasty and had large chunks of chorizo in it. I enjoyed it a lot.

For mains we chose Filet Mignon and Carnitas. Both were solid. I enjoyed them, but felt they both could have used more flavor or seasoning. The goat cheese with the filet did help though, as did the salsa with the carnitas.
author: Brandon S.

description:
Wow!  The service and the food was amazing!!  You must try the queso and chorizo dip as well as the churros for dessert. Everything else in between was delicious too!!!

A must try!!  I'll return for sure!
author: Michael G.

description: My girlfriend and I went here for brunch on Sunday. You can usually always tell if a Mexican restaurant is going to have good food by their chips and salsa. Well, I am pretty sure I had 3 rounds of homemade tortillas (Yes, they do home made tortillas instead of chips here) and salsa. It is also very rare to find chicken tinga at Mexican restaurants so I was excited to try their chicken Tinga. Their chicken tinga omelette was amazing! And I finished my friends tortilla soup for her. Great vibes and delicious food! Highly recommended
author: Lees A.

description: The churros are amazing, service was kind and lovely. A nice place to come with a date, or girls night out.
author: Virginia P.

description: Food was incredible. Plantains, carnitas, corn and spicy margaritas all outplayed our expectations. Service was great although the lights were a little bright. Overall a great experience and would definitely recommend. Oh, and that spicy guac!!
author: Matthew S.

description: Great food with great service. Highly recommend for casual & fun atmosphere & great drinks!
author: Lani Y.

description: Great food and service. About the only drawback is it's a little small and the tables are very close. The queso fundito was among the best I've had and I highly recommend the shrimp.
author: Robin R.

description: The empanadas and margarita were spot on. The plantains and churros for dessert also fabulous. The chicken mole was a little dry and needed some spice. Waiter was suburb.
author: Julie S.

description: Love the food here! Perfect for dinner date! Try the lamb shank and if you like it spicy, notch it up one level. And if possible, ask for Armando to wait for you. He is really good! Plus his section is more fun!
author: Sai N.

description: Exceptional food and service!!! Colibri Mexican Bistro did not disappoint. The staff is extremely friendly and made us feel right at home. We will definitely be back!!
author: Erica M.

description: Great Authentic Mexican food! Glad we found this place. Guacamole is made to order and the ceviche was so yummy! I will definitely have the huevos poblano again! We will be back soon!
author: Natalja C.

description: Very authentic Mexican restaurant in union square. Great vibe and ambiance. Fantastic tequila selection. All the specials are very tasty. I had carnitas. Mis amigos had the filet and the camarones. All very good!
author: Matthew B.

description: I have had this spot bookmarked for months but never got the chance to indulge until today.  Now I'm kicking myself for waiting this long to try Colibri Bistro. With the Homemade tortillas (if you are looking for chips and guacamole then be prepared for a slight twist) succulent meats and amazing margaritas this is one of the best Mexican spots in the city. The homemade caramel stuffed churros paired with vanilla ice cream put me over the top.
author: Buckshidi B.

description: Stumbled upon Colibri. We ordered ceviche, fish del dia, corn, drinks and they even bring out homemade tortillas with salsa. Thanks Adriana ( our bartender ) ,everything was the bomb.com!! Solid restaurant.
author: Gabriela C.

description:
I'd normally give this place 4 stars,  but I'm going to give it 5 to counteract the idiots below who didn't like this place because it wasn't like the crap that passes for Mexican in the rest of America,  or because they don't really like Mexican food.  (Really! Read below.  If you're starting your review with 'I don't normally like X food,'  you should just stop... don't. It's unfair to the restaurant and readers.)

This place is delicious,  fairly authentic.  A fine example of upscale, diverse,  real Mexican food.  Service is efficient,  pleasant, low-key, not pretentious.
author: Mark D.

description: Came here for Brunch on a Sunday. I thought the fresh tortillas was a good touch but it didn't help the way the food taste. Unlimited mimosas is $18 besides the price of your entree. I had the huevos rancheros and the plate presentation was good. The beans were liquified and the nopales were cooked with an unknown food pairing like mushrooms or just the texture of it was horrible. 2entrees and mimosas $80! Save your money go eat at Jack in the box next door! Besides i have never been to a restaurant that didnt bring you back the change! For customer service sakes you should never assume the change is your tip! SMH! Terrible! That sucked!
author: Tee T.

description: Excelente! Delicious food and amazing service from Rosy.  I was running late and she was very attentive to my friend while she waited! We had the Tortita de Papas and pastel de chocolate - wonderful! Highly recommend - in particular if attending a show @ Geary Theater, right across the street.
author: Tami C.

description: Loved it here. Had a friend visiting from town and we came here for the bottomless mimosas. Since I'm from San Antonio, Texas, I've been trying to find good tacos to eat and the tacos de huevos a la mexicana was amazing. The service was great as well. Such a hit!
author: Maryam S.

description: The food, service and space were all great. We ordered the lamb shank and the sauce was perfect. The cocktails were tasty and strong! Perfect night out.
author: Lu R.

description:
