College BFF & I came here recently for old times' sake. I wasn't even a Yelper the last time we ate here! 

Colibri serves weekend brunch until 2pm, which I so appreciate because by the time we got our act together on Saturday, it was 11:30 & places that did offer breakfast had already stopped doing so. 

CBFF ordered Huevos Benedictinos estilo Michoacan; replace English muffins with corn shells and substitute carnitas for ham & you've got a better version of Eggs Benedict. 

I loved my order of chilaquiles with rojo sauce washed down with a limey, spicy michelada. 

One of the most mouthwatering items came gratis -- small corn tortillas made in-house with a trio of amazing salsas. 

Colibri, you'll be seeing us again!
author: Fancypants X.

description: Cozy Mexican Bistro with great atmosphere and food that will melt in your mouth! The wait staff is attentive and helpful, food flies out of the kitchen, and drinks are always full! This is a MUST-STOP place to satisfy those AUTHENTIC Mexican cuisine cravings!
author: Tyler S.

description:
High end Mexican restaurant!  Loved it and didn't expect what I was walking in to when we picked Mexican!

They have chips and salsa as complimentary apps and there is a good wine selection. 

Serving staff is great and very knowledgeable on all their dishes as we had to ask a few details for the stuff that we were ordering.  

Good place!
author: Alan F.

description: Had a great experience at Colibri. We ordered the tostadas (5/5) and the chicken dish (5/5), along with a strawberry margarita and a mojito. We didn't wait to get seated and had a wonderful server. Would definitely come back!
author: Tiffamy C.

description: Fantastic service by Adriana. The food is beyond delicious (I had the Chile rellenos) and location is great. Certainly will come back when I'm in town!
author: Gustavo A.

description: Stopped in for convenience and zero expectations and left there super fans and completely satisfied. Everything we had was absolutely delicious.  Guacamole and tiny, warm house-made corn tortillas. Tender Filet with Mashed potatoes and spinach. Street Corn (on the cob). And the Bananas Foster with genuine caramel sauce (cajeta) was over-the-top perfect ending to our meal. The atmosphere was pleasant.  The kitchen was open, which is always a nice touch. The staff was friendly and efficient. HIGHLY RECOMMEND if you are in the Union Square area.
author: Kelli W.

description: New to the Bay Area and decided to explore downtown San Francisco. I was in the mood for Mexican food and found Colibri. I was met with fabulous service by the bartender who took my order. I had fish tacos and they were amazing. I will bring a date the next time I come in
author: Jamie J.

description: This is my first time in San Francisco and to this restaurant. It is  absolutely yummy! I got the "Desayuno Mexicano" and it was so good! I would recommend this place to anyone.
author: Daniela G.

description:
Either sit at the bar for happy hour only or, go to any Mexican burrito place for a better meal. I've been here twice and will not be going back. Entrees are over priced and not good.  My food tasted reheated and dry. When the waitress asked how everything was (towards end of meal); I let her know. She said "what would u like me to do?" (Her tone was more like: it was ur fault for ordering it). I had smothered my tiny piece of chicken-jerky in the complimentary salsa (hate to waste food).. "Nothing", I said, "just please let the chef know".  
We left feeling like no one cared about the quality of food or service. 
Again, the appetizers were good so..if ure interested; sit at the bar and don't get the entrees unless u love reheated dry chicken bits for $21.
author: Karen C.

description: Great food, but yelp please update the prices you have listed on the menu here, they are actually 30% more than what you have listed.
author: Lucineia D.

description: Good food, vegetarian options but would not make items without dairy. Friendly service
author: Ritu D.

description: I was visiting from out of town and my mum and I popped in for a late dinner. The hostess was kind and though we had had a long day (and looked like it too), she was attentive. I am vegetarian and ended up ordering the Tortito de Papas with no mushrooms because gross. And my mum ordered the mole. We both thoroughly enjoyed our meals and were happy to try unique Mexican dishes HOWEVER I felt as though a bit pricey for what it was. Still delicious. Staff was average, but we had a delightful experience!
author: Olivia D.

description: This is a very authentic Mexican restaurant. The soles are the best I have ever had. Also the atmosphere is upscale and they serve the best Margaritas. Sebastian was a great server and very helpful with what to try for first time guest. It is in the heart of Union Square. Try the Tostadas de Tinga  and the Sopes Surtidos. The Filet Mignon is also a great choice.
author: Randy F.

description: First time at Colibri and had stellar service by Nayely. The food was amazing, we had the sopes, guacamole, and the salsas are to die for!
author: Raquel V.

description:
On business in San Francisco and looking for a good Mexican place. Colibri delivered. 
I had the duck in mole verde which reminded me of a version of jocon (Guatemalan green sauce). My friend had the shrimp and loved them!

We had the pineapple agua fresca which was light and refreshing along with some margaritas. 

Our server convinced us to try the churros and they were amazing! Served with dulce de leche ice cream.... we finished them even though we were full and we didn't regret it. 

Highly recommend!
author: Wendy P.

description: Staff were very attentive; food quality was great. I ordered Chicken Verde Chilaquiles. It was delicious! It was a great amount of food.
author: Diba T.

description: I don't understand how this place got such great reviews from ZAGAT. I'm no expert, but it doesn't take a genius to know when the bartender of a venue is being dismissive, lacks customer-service skills, and to make it worse, lacks the touch of simply being polite. My aunt and I came to this place because of the reviews. We sat at the bar and it took the bartender 5 mins to acknowledge our presence. Moreover, once we ordered our house Margaritas, he never came back to check on us. Wait he did! Much later to ask if we wanted another drink. We asked for the check! I've traveled to London, Paris, Madrid, Barcelona, Greece, Istanbul, Israel, San Francisco, CA (3 times), Las Vegas, Miami, and other cities, but I've never encountered such a rude/dismissive behavior from a bartender. We actually decided to take our business elsewhere.
author: Jose H.

description: My gf and I stopped by here around 11:30 for brunch on a Sunday morning. It is super bowl Sunday so that could be a reason but we had no wait and were sat immediately when we walked in. We opted for bottomless mimosas which were a bit pricey but delicious. Our meals were absolutely fantastic. I ordered the chilaquiles and she ordered Michoacán style eggs Benedict although The prices are a bit high I believe the quality in the food is there and is definitely worth the price. We were both very satisfied and full. Def would come back here and recommend!
author: Dylan H.

description: First time here. All the food was excellent. Guacamole, ceviche, mole were awesome. The lamb shank was cooked perfectly. And service was great too. We will definitely come again.
author: Quinton H.

description: I enjoyed the bottomless mimosas ($17) and the French toast was really good. Try and make reservations before you go!
author: Ryan S.

description: Execellent service and food!! The cinnamon French toast was the best I have ever had! Bottomless mimosas are so worth it! Nayely was our server and was so quick and kind to us!! She also kept the mimosas flowing! Definitely a must go!
author: Sarah S.

description: Nayely's service was absolutely fantastic great recommendations and friendly demeanor. The ceviche was amazing and the margaritas were bomb. Definitely recommend!
author: Anna B.

description: Food here is ok and a little pricey. Guacamole was too salty, skin on duck entree was not crispy enough, Chile rellenos was very good with lots of cheese and veggies on top of black beans. Empanas and cheese and chorizo appetizers were very good. Churro dessert was excellent.
author: Laura B.

description: Really good place to go with a small group. Brunch is a must for this place. The queso fundido is our favorite appetizer. Everyone here is really helpful and nice. Nayely (sorry if I misspelled it) was super helpful and a great pleasure. We always bring our family/friends here when they visit.
author: JD F.

description: I had the mole and my girlfriend had the fish tacos. The mole was good but needed a little more sweetness to be considered a mole poblano. My girlfriend commented to me that the fish tacos were great. The service was very good. Our server armando was very nice and welcomed us in a very warm manner. Definitely coming back.
author: Antonio T.

description: I'm sure if I go back I'll be able to give it at least 4 stars. I only sat at the bar and had the chocolate cake with ice cream. It was just ok though :( . Service was friendly and attentive by the bartender. It was a lovely and lively restaurant, good energy and decor. I'll go back for more another time.
author: Genie O.

description: Unbelievable!! Super delicious and the staff was amazing. I highly recommend this place. I live in Texas and always try New Mexican restaurants. This one is definitely one of my favorites.
author: Karen F.

description:
Four stars for their brunch, three stars for dinner.  The first time I dined here was for dinner and I ordered the chicken mole.  I thought it was pricey, but it was a pretty good meal.  However, I suggest coming here for brunch.  

Everything on their brunch menu looked delicious.  I always order chilaquiles, and I did, but I was close to ordering the huevos rancheros.  I ordered the chilaquiles with the red sauce, and it came with fried eggs and black beans.  The chips were crispy.  The red sauce was flavorful, especially with the egg yolk.  The plate looks small, but I was pretty full after I finished.  I just wish it had avocado, but it was already around $15 and I didn't want to be charged extra.  

And my roommates and I ordered guacamole as an appetizer.What I didn't like was that we were charged an extra $2 for chips.  You get a trio of salsas to start, and our salsas came with a basket of chips along with homemade corn tortillas.  The menu does state that when you order guacamole, you can order the chips for the extra price.  We never specifically ordered it, but yet we were charged.  My roommates and I didn't want to argue over $2, but if you don't want to be charged, ask the waiter before s/he puts the chips down.

Overall, I had a very delicious brunch.  The place is small, yet welcoming.  I recommend making reservations on OpenTable if you do dine here.
author: Vira P.

description: Their sign outside on the sidewalk alerted us to their great brunch and bottomless mimosas. So we came, we ate and we drank. At the bar. Todo estaba bien.  All was good. More than good actually. Chilaquiles and the carne asada omelette were delicious. Mimosas were mixed well and their Homemade tortillas and salsas were great. And our bartender Adriana was attentive, polite and quick. Every restaurant/bar should have someone like her on staff.  Give it a try. Superb service and great food overall.
author: Rob A.

description: Crazy good food. Mexican authenticity is on par.  Drinks are delicious and the ambiance is chill.  I will definitely make this a regular stop in the city.
author: Angel M.

description:
I must admit that I rarely eat at Mexican restaurants, because they tend to disappoint my Mexican self lol
But in all honesty, the food was amazingly delicious and well presented. I had the "desayuno mexicano" and "platanos con crema" and both were superb. Definitely will come back next time I'm in town!
author: Jessal S.

description: I just ate here 1/4/17 and...the margaritas were so good. I will definitely be back here for them, and the service was good. Everyone was really nice and fast. But I thought the food was just ok. Way over priced for the quality. But it's downtown so I guess it kinda makes sense. If you're downtown definitely stop for drinks but you could kinda a better restaurant that's cheaper than this.
author: Aakash X.

description: I wandered out from my hotel tonight as I've been working waaaaaaay to much. I just wanted a nice meal at a nice place with good service. I'm easy, I like to be left alone. But I was amazed by my experience at the bar at Colibri tonight. Carlos offered recommendations as to what would fit what I was looking for, was friendly and attentive. Added plus, fantastic food. The elotes were as good as any I've ever had, and it's a staple for me, and the rest was just fantastic. Thanks to the business and thanks to Carlos the bartender for taking care of me and making sure I got everything I was supposed to have.
author: Patrick S.

description: This place was great. Food was great, margaritas are AMAZING. Armando our server was superb. Two thumbs up all the way around.
author: Steven G.

description: Absolutely great Mexican food with excellent service. I would highly recommend this restaurant to friends and family
author: Derk G.

description: My husband and I came last Sunday for late lunch.  We arrived before 3pm (they closed between brunch and 3pm) and were first ones seated.  It took an hour to get our meals, we had to keep asking for things that a couple of times we never even got.  We just felt very disregarded.  Food was ok, just very bad service.
author: Jennifer C.

description: It's always a great vibe at Colibri. Good cocktails and delicious food close to the Geary and Curran theaters. Check it out.
author: M K.

description: Best Mexican food ever!! The Plato en Mole Verde Pipian was to die for! Perfect flavors and combination of sides. Also had  a side of Nopales Asados (cactus and mushrooms) that was quite tasty! Really wanted flan but the churros were fabulous. Atmosphere is good combo of modern/trendy and classic. Must try.
author: April S.

description: Excellent and authentic Mexican food, great Margaritas and fabulous service from Sebastian! I highly recommend the fresh guacamole and carnitas chili relleno.  Only disappointment was no flan.
author: Bethany M.

description: Excellent !! And Luis, our server, was fantastic!  Had the carnitas, big portions and very tasty.  The guacamole was hands down spectacular!
author: Chris M.

description: Best dinner I have ever had . Every thing is so flavorful and delicious . Start with their famous guacamole or the infamous empanadas .. tortilla soup is creamy and tasty .. loved it .. then for main course the camerrones reboso or the tortitadepapas . Many great options for those with gluten allergies or vegetarian.. can't miss out on the famous churros with dulce de leche ice cream .. all the way around a wonderful place, great atmosphere,  and talented staff who accommodates our needs ..
author: Ruth M.

description: The best guacamole I've ever had! Great vibe in this place for a fun work gathering -- but could also be a good setting for a date or girls night out. Great margarita selection!
author: Lindsay H.

description:
I came here on Friday night off the back of a recommendation from friends.  Overall, my feelings were mixed with some parts of my meal being incredibly good and others less so.

When we sat down we ordered some spicy margaritas, guacamole, and an order of queso fundido.  I was told the queso was the thing to get here so I was excited to try it. 

Our cocktails came out quickly and were shortly followed by guacamole with chips and freshly made corn tortillas.  Guac was good, nothing that made it the best guac I've ever tasted, but good, and the chips were nicely salted.  However, I wasn't expecting to be so excited when I tasted one of the corn tortillas.  They are absolutely incredibly and I think I ate like 5 in the first 5 minutes of receiving them.  I was addicted.  This was shortly followed by queso fundido which was equally delicious and I instantly wished I had only ordered this for dinner.  So good.

This was followed by my entree which was the steak, cooked medium rate.  It came out covered with mole, on top of mashed potatoes and topped with goat cheese.  Unfortunately I was less wowed by this part of my meal.  It was okay, but again I wished I had ordered only cheese, not the feeling you want to have when you've ordered an expensive steak,

I would come back here for the queso and corn tortillas.  That's probably it.
author: Jade R.

description: Best bacon wrapped shrimp ever!! So flavorful!! Loved the guacamole & chips! Awesome service!! Nayely was super friendly & efficient! Great atmosphere!!
author: Sheryl T.

description: Tacos were great, Sebastian the waiter was even greater! Will come again. *stay for the churros ;p
author: Daisa N.

description:
Mega great place.
I'm from Mexico, so I know what Mexican food should taste!
Great atmosphere, decor, service, but the 5 stars are regards the food.
Super authentic high level cuisine.
I definitely would return. Hands down!!
author: Lilly R.

description: A favorite when in SF. Everything on the menu is unique and flavorable. The chilaquiles are amazing, both Red and green sauce. Salsa comes with homemade corn tortillas, versus chips. Guac is delicious. Definitely a must try.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Had brunch here on Saturday and it was delicious!!! Started with bottomless mimosas, fresh tortillas and salsa, and guacamole and chips - all amazing. 

For main courses, I got the chilaquiles which were delicious. My friends got the enchiladas and carnitas omelette, and they said both were great. 

I think there's a 2 hour time limit on bottomless mimosas but they were very generous with them and when we finished eating, they didn't make us feel bad about staying for another hour to drink! Can't wait to come here again!
author: Linds L.

description: We happened upon this place our first day in San Francisco, the guacamole and the Margaritas were so good that we came back the next day for happy hour as well! Bartender was great with lots of information about the city. Definitely worth a stop in if you like margaritas and a cozy Mexican feel.
author: Jen I.

description: This place is hella expensive and the food they give isn't enough for a fatass like me !! I mean it's good but only if they would give a little more food in their plates !
author: Diana G.

description: One of the most disappointing meals I've ever had. Service was extremely slow. Ordered queso for an appetizer that ended up being dried up cheese. Would never recommend this place to anyone.
author: Adam K.

description: Pozole Verde.... delicious! The soup is thick... like it had simmered for hours. It comes with garnishes..Avocado, lettuce, red onions, radishes and oregano spice mix. I had it once and had to come back again before leaving San Francisco..
author: Erica D.

description: The ambience was nice and so was the guacamole. The drinks were pretty awesome too. Will definitely go there again.
author: Sharmi M.

description:
Very good margaritas ($12-$13).  My entree was so hot (throat, tongue and lips) that I could not eat it.  There was no menu indication that the entree would be hot; the restaurant did not not make any accommodation.

This is a place to eat, not dine.  Those under 40 or 50 years old might be comfortable with the closeness of the tables and the noise level.  Older folks might not be happy.

The food might be very good; it was when I ate here six years ago but the hot spiciness kept me from being able to evaluate it on my current visit.
author: Richard S.

description: Was pleasantly surprised to find a good place for Mexican food in SF!  Service was prompt, efficient and very friendly. We had some Cadillac margaritas, pozole verde and a carnitas plate. All the dishes were excellent.  Taste and flavors were amazing. Only minus is I would say the portions were a bit small relative to price (compared to what I'm used to in SoCal), but as rent/property prices here are high, I can understand.  Price is not outrageous though. I would recommend this place. Super cool vibe too.
author: Theresa F.

description: Excellenté! Gracias Nayely for the fantastic service. The guacamole and tostadas were delicioso! Will be back soon for more Margaritas
author: Margie S.

description:
Amazing tortilla! Salsa was bomb....especially the mango pineapple!! Definitely one of my favorite salsas ever. Also got their freshly, home made guacamole....so goood! Mild was not spicy at all, next time ill try medium spice. Their fish tacos were good too, but the fish was ok, kind bland

Service was ok....my water was never refilled, for once, my glass of water was empty by the end of dinnner. Ambience is great though. Would definitely come back for the chips and salsa, and guacamole!!!
author: Caitlin P.

description:
Fantastic Mexican food and slow service. 
I had the Peshuga, which was crispy chicken stuffed with corn and mushrooms. Very tasteful!! 
Except from the slow service (the waiter also forgot our drinks), this was by far the best meal we had in SF.
The location is also perfect, near Union Square.
This is an absolute favorite!
author: Nina R.

description: We came here for a date night in the City. The service was great but the food was not. I ordered the shrimp and it was over cooked and smelled. My husband ordered the steak which he enjoyed but he said, it lacked in flavor. All of the staff here were very kind and helpful. We tried it out because of all the yelp reviews.
author: Nikoo A.

description: Food is decent. I prefer appetizers and dessert here. Especially the chocolate cake, it's amazing
author: Mary M.

description: This was a mistake to come here. This small, beautiful, three time (2011-2013)Michelin recommended resturant had food that my hotel Cafe could have surpassed. I was excited because I had seen they make the guacamole at the table. They do not. the guacamole I make at home is better and my guac isn't even the best. Their guac is $15. I'm sorry, but its not worth the money. I got a 13 dollar Margarita which was basic and filled mostly with ice. The carnitas were great and my boyfriends stuffed chicken was good as well. Our bill came out as 85 dollars. Dining at a Michelin rated restaurant you'd expect staff to keep drinks topped off but they never refilled any of our drinks.  Overall, it was an expensive, disappointing dinner and we wish we got the pizza by the slice next door.
author: Elana And Tamar B.

description: Food is decent, service is lacking. The host was attentive, and perhaps it's because I was dining solo, but it took 15 mins to get my first drink and 10+mins after ordering to get the 2nd one. The food I ordered along with each drink came well ahead of the beverage in both instances. Server was friendly enough, but the efficiency isn't there.  Came here once before, a year ago, when I stayed in the same adjoining hotel. Now I remember why I didn't return. In a city with so many options, it lacked  a little..... vibe and energy provided by the patrons in the intimate layout carried it.
author: Zita S.

description:
Great mimosas but subpar food. Very very very disappointed given the number of positive reviews around. Also the $10 bottomless mimosa is a thing of the past. Expect to spend at least $17 and only available with an entree. Skip this place and go to one of the endless nu number of better places for brunch.

And don't get me started on the bathrooms!
author: sato b.

description:
Great food and just as good service. 
Guac - perfectly mixed with a nice kick
Carnitas -  as they should be - crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside. 
Ceviche -  spot on. The only thing I would have liked better is if it was served with saltines. 
Elotes - crunchy outside and sweet and moist inside
Chile rellenos w carnitas - tasty, but I think I would have preferred traditional rellenos
Margarita - delicious, great balance of tequila and lime
Dos Equis - beer as it should be  
Churros - crunchy sweetness filled with caramel gooeyiness and ice cream
French toast like bread w caramel and ice cream - tasty Yucatan dessert
author: Melissa B.

description: Spot effing on! My new little jem that I really don't want to share with anyone else. The sunburn margaritas was delicioso! I can't even pronounce what I ordered. Holy heck! Some of the best Mexican food I've ever experienced and I'm a conossuier. Yummm!order the Pancho DE cochinita pibil
author: Raeme K.

description: Had a late-night meal/snack here: queso fundido. I've had the same at their San Jose location (Consuelo) and it's just as delicious and greasy and filling. The homemade tortillas really make it. Don't forget to try their salsas, too.
author: Makena S.

description:
Met up with an old friend for lunch here a while back

We ordered the guacamole to start and for my main entree I got the carne asada plate

While I did appreciate they served fresh made tortillas with their guacamole I was puzzled by why they charged for the chips considering how rather pedestrian they were. I would rather pay for the tortillas, at least those were worth getting. Yes, you read correctly, you have to pay $2 for chips to go with your salsa/guacamole. Also, it feels rather "tacky" to serve the guacamole in plastic bowls inside the stone stands, last I check Rose Mexicano doesn't even do that. 

Anyways, on to the steak, the cut was decent and cooked well but needed more salt. The essence of chipotle peppers were their but would have liked a bigger punch. The accompany sides were fine but no stand outs. 

Overall Thoughts

I've had better mexican food at fraction of the cost
author: Eddie W.

description:
OVERPRICED. BLAND. BAD SERVICE. 
Omg bad experience. The food was nasty. 
The tortillas were soggy and everything tasted like it came from a can. The food looked really pretty but its flavor did not match up to the looks. Over priced watered down Mexican food! 
Doesn't even taste Mexican. 
Waiter was soooo rude. Gave us a really hard time, rolled his eyes at me when I asked for something.
author: Fatima A.

description: How is this place rated so low?? I had such a good dinner here for my husbands birthday last year that we're doing a repeat of it this year! It is slightly overpriced, hence the lost star, but the food was divine!! The churro with caramel was to die for, I'm so excited to go back!
author: Jessica V.

description:
BEST, and when I say BEST, I mean the absolute BEST margaritas I've ever had. Usually, margs give me some serious heartburn...these do not. I got the regular on the rocks and it was amaze...a colleague got the spicy and it was to die for. 

Don't miss out on the guacamole bc that's fire too
author: Chelsea A.

description:
Colibri handled our group of 16 pretty well, though the staff was not the warmest. Drinks remained filled, food came out fairly fast, and our long table was tucked away so we didn't disturb the main dining room. I had arranged a prix fixe menu with their manager, $40 for a 3-course meal. Quantity-wise, it's a great deal. Quality was hit or moss though: the tortilla soup was more like a bisque and had a strange musty flavor; the chicken mole was a bit tough/overcooked, and the dulce de leche churro was impossibly sweet.  Everything was presented nicely though, so our group of out-of-towners were impressed.  We also ordered some pitchers of sangria and margaritas for $25 each (they should really call them "carafes", not pitchers. They're small).  

It's hard to find a large group reservation in SF,  so I was really happy with the reservation process with Colibri. The manager was very thorough and communicative, but our servers just seemed bitter to have a large group, and upset that 4 guests didn't show up. We were supposed to be 20, but because of the December floods, we had 4 people cancel at the last minute. Colibri wanted to charge us for the 4 people who didn't show up, which was crazy to me. We still had 16 people, and bought way more alcohol than we had planned, yet they wanted to nickel and dime us. In the end, I insisted the manager not charge us for the 4 no-shows, and she begrudgingly agreed. It ended our meal on an awkward note, sadly. But I still give them credit for accommodating a large group, without any noticeable hiccups for our party (sans the battle of the bill).
author: Nique F.

description: EXCELLENT EXCELLENT EXCELLENT healthy Mexican food!  SUPERB service in a beautiful environment!!  The Margie's are fantastic and the healthy tortillas instead of deep fried with the 3 sauces they serve upfront are the BEST!  Perfect location just of Union Square make this a total WIN!!   Did I mention the Margie's???   DELISH!!!
author: Lynne P.

description: Service was slow and often incomplete. We had to ask for things repeatedly and were ignored for much of the meal. We ordered bottomless, but had to flag down the waiters to get refills on our mimosas. The sauce work was good, but otherwise the food was pretty mediocre. Would not go back. The prices are definitely too high for the quality.
author: Vinitha R.

description: My daughter and I had dinner here.  I had an amazing chicken dish and my daughter had the filet mignon. Both dishes were amazing.  They have great margaritas and tequila selections also.  We ended the meal with churros and more margaritas.  Carlos, our waiter provided wonderful service also. I highly recommend checking it out.
author: McKayla W.

description: Definitely a restaurant you'd want to eat at when craving authentic Mexican food while in the city. They serve traditional Mexican food from Guadalajara, Mexico. This place is mind blowing; from the decore, to the presentation of each food plate, to their food flavors...such a tasteful place to eat at.  I love the environment at Colibri Mexican Bistro...the restaurant is casual yet elegant. The bar at Colibri provides extensive mouth watering drink choices. You feel like you are definitely at South of the Border. The staff was extremely friendly, they knew their menu, and they were very welcoming. While at Colibri we met one of the managers named Ruth; she was so easy to talk too, she was so lively, and she recommended great dishes. Ruth is definitely a great asset to Colibri Mexico Bistro. I love when the manager comes around and makes sure our experience is met. Thank you Colibri Mexico Bistro for an awesome and yummy experience. I'm definitely going back for more. Recommend at best!!!
author: Jerry S.

description: Food is authentic Mexican, it is delicious!  Service is outstanding. We are visiting from San Diego and it was well worth the trip. You won't regret eating at Colibri!
author: Zaida M.

description: Excellent, fresh guacamole served with warm tortillas (the tortillas were literally my favorite part!). This is not your typical Tex-mex style Mexican food, but the flavors were wonderful and familiar enough. As another review said, the service was efficient and the server was nice when we asked for recommendations.
author: Laura H.

description: Food was good! Atmosphere was great. Service was pleasant and efficient. I would go again and recommend to friends.
author: Eli E.

description: I've been coming to Colibri for years! Highlights: margaritas, guacamole (with homemade tortillas!), and carnitas
author: Jen Y.

description: Awesome tequila selection.  Mainly had some apps which were good but not great.  Service was good and responsive, they had forgotten one of our dishes but they comped that dish.
author: Aaron C.

description:
Enjoyed a lovely evening at Colibri Mexican Bistro.

I was there with a large group and Colibri accommodated us well and kept the margaritas and sangria flowing.

What I loved: 

The aforementioned margaritas were quite good--well mixed with a perfect tequila to lime ratio. 

For dessert, I enjoyed their churro with dolce de leche ice cream.  I would come here for this alone.  In fact, if you are looking for an amazing dessert--and flummoxed as to where to go--this is your spot.  It was make-your-mouth-water-fabulous. 

The service was solid and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. 

What I loved less:

I ordered their chile relleno, which, honestly I wouldn't order again.  It was overly spicy (I like spice--but this was too much for me) and the flavor wasn't enough to redeem the water-chugging-discomfort.  The presentation was nice--but the taste of the dish fell flat.

I have no doubt they would have a dish that I would enjoy--the chile relleno just wasn't it!

Other than that, a lovely evening filled with fabulous margaritas and dessert to make a girl drool.  I'll take it!

Get to it!
author: Ophelia M.

description: My new fav spot! Great food and service. We ordered the ceviche, which I'm usually really picky about, and it was really fresh and flavorful. I highly recommend the Panuchos de Cochinita Pibil. I would highly recommend this place if you're looking for good elevated Mexican cuisine!
author: Layla G.

description: Had an incredible experience at Colibri.  Our server, Armand, was great in suggesting drinks that fit exactly what we were craving.  He was also good in suggesting appetizers and main dishes.  Food and drinks were excellent and we look forward to returning.
author: Sally G.

description: Delicious high end Mexican.  Fabulous cocktails and entrees were all top notch.  This isn't a dive Mexican spot, more appropriate for a nice date or dinner before seeing a show at the Curran across the street. Mezcal cocktails are delicious
author: Spencer L.

description:
Typical upscale Mexican restaurant with an extensive margarita list and specials.

The strawberry margarita was decent and the service was good. But the food generally was average. I got Carnitas which simply was not well executed. I felt like I was eating fried chicken as the exterior was crispy, the flavor lacking, and just an overall average dish.

Also, I got there and made a reservation which was supposed to take 30 minutes. I walked to a nearby bar. Fast forward 20 minutes, my partner went in the restaurant, was seated, and didn't mention my name. I got a notification 15 minutes later, which was 10 mins after I was already seated because my partner got a table. So, there wasn't much organization of that system.
author: Juan T. K.

description: I brought a group here tonight for dinner.  The service was great, as was the food but, more importantly to me, the manager Ruth took care of us in ways that were well above and beyond.  We were well below our contracted number of attendees and, rather than dinging us for the difference, she voluntarily met us half way in the difference, which was beyond generous given we had a signed contract requiring something more.  As if that wasn't enough, when our bus abandoned us, Ruth was right out there on the street with me hailing cabs and on the phone with cab companies trying to help me get everyone back to the hotel, all while the restaurant was busy.  In the end, we had a wonderful dinner and were treated so well by the staff - and especially Ruth - that I can't imagine not bringing future groups here as well.  Thank you!!  As for the bus company, we'll go elsewhere for that next time ...
author: K F.

description: Bad service. Asked for a well done fillet and it was almost alive. The food en general was lacking on flavor.
author: Monica A.

description: Extremely overpriced and the food is certainly not all that. Also, the staff is not attentive whatsoever. We were never given utensils or napkins, we had to ask for these bare necessities. After taking our first bite of food and instantly getting our hands dirty, it's Mexican food, I asked for "napkins" and the waiter returns with ONE napkin... so are my boyfriend and I supposed to share one napkin?? We had to ask for another one. Will definitely not be returning to this establishment.
author: Beatriz C.

description: For a Sunday this place was busy.  There were two of us for dinner.  We had two entrees and a bottle of wine along a creme brûlée. I had the shrimp and my friend had the chicken.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
First time here, found it on yelp and we are completely happy !
Our server, Jorge was very polite and the food was so delicious. 
We are a family of 6 and we were all satisfied 
Great place to bring the kids
author: Fannie O.

description:
Overrated. I wouldn't come back. The only thing I enjoyed really were the empanadas. They brought us fresh tortillas too, but they were flour. Bleh. 

The carnitas lacked flavor. You needed to mix up a bunch of sauce for flavor. Overall, I felt like the chef didn't care about the food he prepared, so I passed up on my favorite dessert... Creme brûlée.
author: Linh L.

description: Do not miss the table-side guacamole, fresh tortillas made on the grill while you watch, or churros and ice cream for dessert.  Everything on the menu is fresh and delicious, and certainly not your typical Mexican restaurant.
author: Mari M.

description: A restaurant in a great location, with many good reviews, but truly that falls short of our expectations of Mexican food in San Francisco. The ambiance and service were satisfying, but would recommend many restaurants in the mission or even some that are in Soma over this one.
author: Nimeela D.

description:
A few friends and I came here on a Sunday to take advantage of their bottomless mimosas ($10) and catch up. For some reason I've never noticed that this restaurant was here, even after leaving just a few blocks away from it for months. Anyways, the restaurant is pretty big and we made reservations, but it was totally unnecessary. My guess is that at dinner on the weekends it gets more crowded. 

I got the Chilaquiles verdes and everyone else got the Carne Asada estilo Sonora. The entrees were pretty standard, nothing too spectacular was good. I thought the Chilaquiles verdes was definitely better than what others got. It was kind of an ugly looking dish in terms of color but the flavors were unique and complex. The chicken was chicken, I think what made the dish was the verde tomatillo-jalapeno chile sauce. 

The mimosas were great though! Our waiter just kept coming back and filling up our flute. Even if it was only half full he would still fill it to the top. Some places can be stingy on pouring or the mimosas are really dilute. Colibri definitely doesn't skimp on the champagne. =D

The best part of the meal was most definitely the churros. We also got the mango crème brulee, but the churros blew everything else out of the water. So the crème brulee was good but far from being the best. It was a nice twist that they added the mango but I think I prefer the standard. As for the churros, they were fried PERFECTLY. There were four, one for each of us and a scope of dolce de leche ice cream. The churros came out warm and when you bit into it, it was like heaven. The dough just was fluffy and soft and practically melted in your mouth. By the time I finished eating my churro I wished I had savored it more or had a whole other plateful. Maybe I'm just used to crappy churros you get from a stand at a fair or amusement park, but these were top-notch.
author: Liza X.

description: The food here is amazing, staff is friendly and the atmosphere is welcoming and warm. We ordered the special, puerco en salsa verde which was phenomenal. The drinks are great as well.
author: Consumer C.

description: I loved the homemade tortillas, guacamole and delicious salsas! The chilaquiles, huevos rancheros, and enchiladas were on point! Bottomless mimosas!!! I can't wait to come again!
author: Julian S.

description:
I love that the region of cuisine is traditional Mexican food found in Mexico City and not what you would expect from a taqueria. If you are looking for a burrito this is not your best go-to spot.  This is "fancy" Mexican food with flair.  

Hands down my favorite item is their guacamole and fresh tortillas.  I know that is such an easy item, but their fresh, warm tortillas are delicious.  Fluffy, light, and rich masa flavor.  You get a serving of three salsas; mild, medium and hot.  The mild is a slightly sweet salsa with mango notes.  I mix the medium and mild for a smokey, slightly spicy salsa with sweet undertones.  Mixed with the guacamole I could horde all of it myself.  I would walk out with a belly ache but while eating I would be a happy camper.   

Their pan roasted chicken with huitlacoche is my favorite dish.  It is lightly seared with a slightly crispy skin, served bone in, beautifully presented and stuffed with the huitlacoche.  I usually get it every time because it is unique and delicious. Portions are slightly small, but in reality perfect compared to our overindulgent expectations for meal sizes in America.  

Their steak served with greens and over mashed spuds is also a lovely little dish.  Again, portion is small and I think this portion is smaller than the chicken even.  My last experience 4 of us ordered the same dish and our steaks were all different sizes and all small.  Served with a beautiful au jus rich in flavor and blends beautifully with the light, whipped spuds at the bottom of the plate.  

Service from the clean up staff is spot on, sometimes to a default because they want to clear plates the minute you stop eating. It feels more polite to wait until everyone is done for this occur.  

It is in Union Square neighborhood across from the Curran theater, so conveniently located to many hot locations to sight see and stop in after for a drink or some nibbles.
author: Mandy L.

description:
The bellman at our hotel recommended this place.  We had a fantastic dinner experience here last night!  Even though they had no tables available due to Super Bowl weekend, they offered us a place at the bar, and it proved to be a smart move.  The bartender was not only beautiful, friendly, skilled, and attentive, she was also a good listener.  My friend had never had mole, I recommended that he taste before he ordered it for dinner.  She heard our discussion and brought him a sample.  

We ordered a pitcher of sangria and it was delicious.  The mango, chipotle, and verde salsas, chips and corn tortillas were expertly prepared and whole-heartedly flavorful.  Guac was fresh and tasty as well.  Even in a Mexican restaurant, we both decided to order the filet.  It was prepared perfectly and tender enough to cut with a fork.  Portion size was perfect for the price, and the accompaniments of steamed spinach, garlic mashed potatoes, and chipotle sauce made your mouth come alive with the perfect balance of traditional American and Mexican flavors.

We struck up a conversation with others at the bar and ended up trying Mezcal.  Whew!  Strong, but fun.  

Wish we were going to be back in town again soon so we could repeat this evening, and sample more of the menu.
author: Angela S.

description: Delicious guacamole! Would highly recommend to anyone looking for some great food and an excellent Mojito
author: Yvette M.

description: It was my first time visiting Colibri.  There was a big conference in town but fortunately we didn't have to wait too long for our table.  Armando, our server, was extremely knowledgeable and guided us with excellent menu choices.  When the food came out, we were very pleasantly surprised by the authenticity and taste of the Mexican cuisine.  We loved Armando's service and would definitely come back for the food and his superb hospitality.  You should ask for Armando if you choose to visit.
author: Patrick C.

description: Went here on a Saturday for a late brunch. The Benedict was surprisingly lovely! The eggs were cooked perfectly
author: Jacqueline Y.

description: Awesome local Mexican restaurant, margaritas, guacamole, salsa, & service are all amazing and above par. We come have come here often over the years, and will continue to keep it in our rotation.
author: Catherine T.

description:
Review is for dinner on a Sunday evening, 2 people around 6:30p.

Environment: pretty for a date, fun for families

Appetizers:
- empanadas: wonderful, great crust and filling. Equal amounts of both for balance.
- free corn tortillas when you sit down, with 3 salsas: YUMMMM! I've never eaten tortillas that are pillowing soft! 

Mains:
- Husband had the filet. It looked small but was filling. Excellent cut of meat, almost crispy on the outside and perfectly medium rare inside. Again, all favors had balance.
- Carnitas for me; love the big and crispy chunks of pork, with very spicy salsa in the side. Small scoop of rice (which was fine by me after eating so many tortillas!).

Service:
- Main server was OK. She got our order wrong a few times but maybe it was an off day. Everyone from the hostess to the other waitstaff were amazing!

Repeat business?: yes, would definitely go back!
author: Mary H.

description: I came here to celebrate a friend's birthday, and it was the perfect choice. The salsas were delicious! I had the ceviche. It was fresh and hit the spot. A few people in our group ordered the pozole and they loved it. I will definitely be back.
author: Ash A.

description: Colibri was a fantastic experience. The food was great. Service was great. Mimosas on point. Yum ! Great brunch spot with friends
author: Nikki C.

description: Colibri has great tortillas!  Apps were better than the dinners! The churros are ridiculous.
author: Adam C.

description: We were visiting SF and were looking for a nearby restaurant close to the hotel where we were staying in Union Square. Based on the positive reviews, we decided to give this place a try. We didn't have reservations (recommended) so we waited about 30 minutes for a table. The menu is not a typical Mexican restaurant and is somewhat limited. However, everyone in our party enjoyed their dishes. The service was a bit slow and the prices a bit high but we definitely enjoyed our meal.
author: Kathy W.

description: Me and my friends came for my birthday brunch and I left very pleased. My friend didn't like her food and the manager came and took great care of us. The service was nice, the handmade tortillas were delicious and the mimosas were so good. I would definitely come back the next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: DeBrisa S.

description: First time visiting Colibrí. WOW is something I don't say often especially of a Mexican Restaurant. This place is for sure "WOW" status. We did not have reservations but the Manager was kind enough to get us in.  Not being sure what to expect this has turned into a favorite when it come to Mexican Food  in San Francisco. The Green Pozole is by far one of the best I have EVER had! Great flavor and it was just super delicious. We arrived for brunch and they of course had bottomless Mimosas. This of course made for a fun brunch and then the food being super delicious made for a brunch in San Fran for the books! Green Pozole, freshly made tortillas and the huevos rancheros, enchiladas,chilaquiles and  tinga omelet were amazing. Highly recommend this pace! Oh, we also had the queso fundido with chorizo and mushrooms with the fresh tortillas. Do yourself a favor cost his place.
author: Humberto R.

description:
I would really rate this restaurant as 3.5 stars, if i could.

We have only eaten here once.  We were a little bummed, because we really wanted lunch, but they were only serving from the brunch menu (it was the weekend).

The space - nice, clean, authentic decor.

The peeps - friendly, attentive staff.

The grub - I had the Enchiladas Divorciadas, and it was very good.  We also ordered chips & it came with 3 salsas that were really good, too.

The liquids - I had one of their margaritas (forgot which one it was, sorry), and it was really good & had some kick to it.  Definitely got my money's worth from that one!  Spouse had their sangria & she said that it was good, too.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
5 stars for the food. It was outstanding. The salsas are very unique and served with both fresh corn tortillas and chips. I had the Tortita de Papas for dinner, amazing and so flavorful. 

0 stars for service. This is about as bad as it gets. We sat at our table for 10-15 minutes before anyone came over. At one point, we were staring at three salsas and a bowl of guacamole with no chips or tortillas, took 15 minutes to get those. Had to ask for utensils and water refills. I also asked for more salsa, which never came. 

The food here is so insanely tasty, that it might be worth coming to again, despite the terrible service.
author: Anita P.

description: Stayed at the diva hotel on one of my trips to SF and I was pleasantly surprised to find out that such a great restaurant is literally in the lobby. Great food and service, friendly atmosphere, relatively calm noise wise and all around great! Even their salads were awesome!
author: Northwest T.

description: Colibrí Mexican Bistro the real shit, I got chicken relleno de huitlacoche and it was perfect, and the mole poblano it's a trip to Puebla . Mezcalitas are a trip to Puerto Escondido, Oaxaca, if u know what I mean. The service it's awesome.
author: Balam Q.

description: Absolutely love this restaurant. We found this on a quick trip to the city & loved it so much we went twice in one short weekend. Drinks are fabulous & I'm a huge fan of freshly made tortillas to dip in their amazing salsas. Everything we tried was fabulous!
author: Jen T.

description: Loved this place! The atmosphere, food, and drinks were all great. Highly recommend the bottomless mimosas and French toast.
author: James O.

description: Had a great time with friends and mimosas. Food was delicious and the plating was incredibly artistic.
author: Shelley G.

description: Colibri treated us very well! My family and I enjoyed the queso fundido which reminded of us of home. The tequila flight was great but skip the Patron selection. The street style corn on the cob was a big hit with my toddler! The  churros are a " can't skip"!
author: Joseph D.

description: We wandered in here last night when it started raining and were seated with our baby despite having no reservations and the restaurant being fully booked. As we were walking to our table, we saw fresh guacamole being made which looked amazingly fresh. We ordered it and were not disappointed. Our daughter dislikes avocados in general but actually ate the guacamole! We also ordered the tostadas which were super flavorful as well as the empanadas and the queso chorizo appetizer. The guacamole and tostadas were outstanding. We will definitely come back if we are in the area!
author: Megan S.

description: After running around San Francisco all day, I stumbled upon Colibri and immediately ordered the mole while my partner ordered the tortilla soup. I didn't try the tortilla soup but the mole was flavorful and quite delicious with a perfect blend of spices. The icing on the cake was the service we received from Rosy. She is a gem! She was attentive, cheerful, and always with a smile as she served us our various drinks and food items. We will most definitely be coming back next time we are in the area!
author: Douglas M.

description: The only reason I am even giving this place one star is because of the buser and the hostess. Our server was anything but pleasant and the management is awful. The worst experience my family and I have ever had at a restaurant.
author: Jill S.

description: This is a place that brings memories of my hometown Mexico city, at times the flavors literally transported me to early days of my life. Panuchos are great, chilaquiles a great start of your weekend, and with very well mixed drinks you can't beat this as a great restaurant.
author: Luis M.

description: We chose this restaurant because of its high ratings on various sites, to include Yelp.  We were not disappointed!  We started off with the Ceviche de Pescado.  It was perfectly seasoned and full of flavor.  Next we had the Tortilla Soup - again very tasty and a decent quantity.  Next, My wife had the Carnitas en Salsa Verde, while I had the Camarones con Reboso.  We both LOVED them!  They use a perfect blend of spices and seasonings and yet let the full flavor of the meat/shrimp shine through.  The wait staff was very attentive and explained the menu very well. Luis, our waiter, ensured we did not want for anything.  At the end of the meal, the Manager, Julio, spent several minutes ensuring we were completely satisfied and engaging in a nice conversation.  My wife said it was like spending time with old friends or family.  We will definitely be back when ever we are in San Francisco!
author: Aaron S.

description: First time here and I am impressed!! Endless mimosas?! Yes, please!! The food was amazing!! I had the chilaquiles verde and I cleaned the whole plate.  The bartender kept our glasses full the whole time.  Love this place.
author: Victoria F.

description: Came in on a Wednesday. Food and service were great even though the restaurant was crowded. Especially good were the margaritas and guacamole. Had the Carnitas and rellanos and those were good as well.  Sebastian waited on us and he was outstanding.
author: Barry B.

description: This place is amazing! Best chicken wings hands down! I definitely recommend coming here! I also recommend the churros for desert.
author: Jose B.

description:
Delicious! We came here for a nice brunch on a rainy day. $14 bottomless mimosas - YUM. Guacamole -YUM. I had the enchiladas with chicekn - really excellent. The homemade tortillas may be my favorite part! My fiance had the desayuno steak - also delicious.

We sat at the bar and received great service.

We will be back! And I'd recommend it to anyone in the area!
author: Lauren G.

description: This was our first time visiting Colibri thanks to a recommendation from our hotel! We started off with amazing margaritas and an order of guacamole ! The guacamole was so excellent we ordered another round!!! For our main entree we ordered Chile relleno, fish tacos, chicken tacos and plantains! All of it was amazing and we'll be back!!! And our service was excellent with Sebastian !!!
author: Shannon D.

description: The food here was absolutely amazing! The guacamole is definitely the way to start. My skinny margarita was a perfect compliment. Sebastian took great care of us, we will be back soon.
author: Rita T.

description: This place is awesome!! They have really good complimentary tortillas that I scarfed down lol. My best friend and I started with the queso dip and empanadas and both were really good.  We both ordered the bacon wrapped prawns.....YUM!!! We shared the churros which we barely had room for but was definitely worth stuffing ourselves for. Definitely will be back.
author: Monique G.

description:
Apparently people that eat here have never tried authentic Mexican food. No offense to anyone but the reviews are so misleading. 
Not only was the food not pleasant the prices are way to off. The TORTILLAS looked more like a "guarache" ( thick undercooked tortilla) 
The fish tacos were very poor in presentation and in flavor, it said it had chipotle cream but the chipotle looked like a yellow watery sauce. 
The CHILE RELLENO stuffed with veggies was tasteless. The CEVICHE looked and taste like an ordinary ceviche nothing special , the tortilla soup was awful. 
To be honest the plates looked so so so good in the pictures, I had to eat my food because I was starving. I didn't enjoy my experience.
author: Pat O.

description: You must go here! So good. Geez where do I start?! I'm vegetarian and my husband eats meat and we both had lots of options. The tortillas are to die for, the street corn was amazing, and the simple things like the rice and beans were beautifully flavored. And then all the tequila selection... yes. I can't wait to go back. Seems like people usually come in and stay for a while so if you wanna eat and go head there early ish rather than after 7.
author: Alison C.

description:
Food was very good, namely the homemade tortilla and guac, the Mexican corn, fish tacos, and filet mignon. 

So I'm sad to give this place just 3 stars for several reasons. Service was not good, as many people mentioned in previous reviews. It was not busy at all during early dinner and the servers were nowhere to be found for at least 5 minutes when we wanted another glass of wine or more food.

Portions are decent, but prices are high. They give you homemade tortillas with guacamole, which was tasty, but they charged us $2 for extra chips.

We were seated in a table that is next to the bar and it got a bit crowded when people were walking by.

They could seriously improve this place in many ways! I don't think we are going back even though the food was good.
author: Sera P.

description:
Damn.   This is the best Mexican Restaurant I've ever been to.  And I eat a lot of Mexican :-)
We've been here a couple of times for breakfast.  Hands down the best chilaquiles we've ever had.  Great salsas, and they give you freshly hand made mini tortillas instead of chips.  

Anyone that loves Mexican food needs to make a mecca up here and give them a try.
author: R P.

description: The service was excellent. The freshly made tortillas and salsas were delicious. We had the nopales and mushroom appetizer, also delicious. My entree was carnitas, which I thoroughly enjoyed.  They had Negra Modelo on tap, a rare treat. We had a wonderful experience and look forward to visiting again. We also discovered they have a sister restaurant in San Jose, where we live: Consuelo in Santana Row!
author: Anthony F.

description: Great service by Luis. Great location, close to theatres. We had the chicken mole , filet mignon, tostadas de tinga and land shank. Great spicy margarita too!
author: Azmir M.

description: This review is for Nayely :) she is seriously the sweetest and the best! Everyone at Colibri makes us feel amazing!! We love this place, we always come here and we'll keep coming back. Thank you so much!! :)
author: Andrea C.

description: The food is excellent! The margratini is very tasty and the churros are to die for! A casual and fun atmosphere. Sebastian is an excellent server.
author: Lisa M.

description:
The food was good and their service was awesome! I ordered a margarita that had a fly in it. When I asked the waiter for a new drink, he did not hesitate to retrieve another one quickly with a smile on his face. 

Nice ambience as well.
author: Tyrese T.

description:
-Handmade Guacamole - One of the best guacamole so have ever had.  I don't ever order guacamole.  Actually I don't like guacamole, but I was cajoled into a try.  The seasoning and freshness was out of this world, not a huge onion taste, and everything was mixed so week together.  I think I ate half the bowl to myself.
-Queso Fundido - a twist with mushrooms.  A little lacking in the chorizo.  Must be eaten when it's hot.  The fresh tortilla was amazing.  I heart fresh tortilla.  Always.
-Strawberry Margarita- The absolute best strawberry margarita I have ever had.  They used Fresh crushed strawberries and blended everything so well I felt like I was drinking juice.

4.5 Stars and def worth a repeat visit
author: Cynthia L.

description:
Overall the experience was great. We came here for brunch on a Sunday and there was no wait. I would absolutely recommended the tacos con huevos y chorizo. It was crazy good and if definitely order again.

Also, they have bottomless mimosas for $11 per person, which is lower than most places I've been to.
author: Rich W.

description:
Cozy and classy interior meets well-presented and tasteful Mexican cuisine. This is how I would describe this little Mexican (almost fusion) restaurant on the outskirts of the Union Square touristy crowd.

When it comes to Mexican, I highly advise downtown shoppers to dine here, instead of the mall restaurants.

We had the guacamole and chips, which were very fresh and make a perfect start to the meal.

For the main course, we shared a Flautas de Pollo (pictured) which was on point. Great meal to share, although a bit drippy with cheese and sour cream.

Great meal that is both delicious and affordable.

---

Distinguishing factor: Upscale Mexican restaurant, something we don't often see in hole-in-the-wall Mexican places.
author: Nick A.

description: Love coming here! The food is always great and the servers are friendly (especially Nayely). Definitely ask for the tortillas, they come wth three different salsas and are excellent. The guac and margaritas are also amazing. Lastly, if you have room for dessert -- order the churros rellenos!
author: Missy T.

description: Great list of fresh margaritas and the pre-meal tortillas & salsas. Had the carnitas, wife had the tortilla soup and were all really tasty. Cool spot and when we went in for dinner at 8 on a busy Saturday in the city there were still a few tables left.
author: Brad L.

description:
We had a late dinner on Saturday night here, and it was pretty good, the service was a little slow for drink refills considering it was not very busy, that's pretty much my only complaint.  And the food portions are not very big for the price, but that's not that big of a deal.

I had the Filet, only $23!  In San Francisco?  I was impressed.  The filet was cooked perfectly, it came on a bed of spinach and mashed potatoes in a tasty sauce.  My mom got the Chile Relleno, my sister got the Beet Salad and then the Tortilla Soup.  Everyone enjoyed the food...they serve warm home-made corn tortillas with 3 different sauces instead of chips and salsa.  Delicious.

We got some fancy cocktails, I got the pineapple spice margarita, my sister got the one with lavendar in it, my mom got the one with grapefruit, all were yummy.  I'd return.  Wanted to go there for Brunch Sunday but since we had their dinner Saturday, we canceled our brunch reservation and went to BDK which was a horrible decision.
author: Heidi I.

description: We were staying at the Warwick and came here for brunch on a Sunday. We sat at the bar and Elmer was our bartender. He was absolutely fantastic. He kept my bottomless mimosas flowing and made great recommendations for food. I ordered the Pozole which was excellent. It was the perfect amount of spice, but could have been a little hotter temperature wise. The reason for the docked star is  honestly because of the price. $15 for guacamole seems a little steep. The quality of the food was good though. My friend ordered the breakfast tacos and they were really tasty. The corn tortillas are made in house and were very fresh and moist. Elmer gave great recommendations for good non-touristy attractions in the city. I hope to return next time for happy hour and some great margaritas!
author: Heidi K.

description: Colibri never disappoints.  The margaritas are special; so many tequilas to choose from.  The regional Mexican dishes are interesting and yummy.  Tonight a friend and I shared the ceviche and empanadas.  Yum.  The homemade tortillas and salsas are the best.  Highly recommended.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Awesome mexican and margaritas!! 
We just happened to find this place a couple blocks from our hotel. We had initially thought Thai and then this menu looked so great, we switched courses. Glad we did.

We sat at the bar and our bartender was terrific and had great recommendations. We started out with a couple margaritas and of course I can't remember the names. Mine was spicy and fantastic! They're not cheap ($11~) but they're so good!

They give you some homemade tortillas and a trio of salsas to whet your appetite while you decide upon dinner. After our bartender's recommendations, we opted for the Mole Poblano and the Pato en Mole Verde Pipian- which is a seared duck breast with a green mole sauce. The mole poblano was good- the chicken quite juicy, but the duck was out of this world! I'd definitely get that again and again. It had more of a kick than the other mole which I always appreciate. 

Awesome decor, fantastic drinks and food- definitely go!
author: Andrea K.

description:
The GOOD:
Tortillas are good
Salsa is good
Food is average

The BAD:
Service was slow 
Service was sloppy ( forgot what we ordered multiple times)
Drinks took almost 15 mins to get
Drinks sucked when we got them. Wife ordered a capirinha, got something with orange juice. 
Everyone else got their food before us. They arrived at the restaurant after us.
We got our Guacamole without chips
Poor training for staff
The restaurant offers 10% discount for hotel guests. We got.. 5%. No rhyme or reason. Just that that was our discount. 

I left mad. Will never come here again. Most expensive bad food we have ever had.
author: Johnny C.

description: The food was some of the best traditional Mexican I've had.  However, the proportions were a little small
author: Dana S.

description:
I had the chilaquiles with red sauce and shredded chicken and my husband had the chicken enchilada in a green sauce. The sauces on both were fresh and flavorful even without a lot of spice. Best Mexican food I've ever had! This is not your typical Mexican restaurant with burritos and tacos galore but it is so much better! 
I didn't like that the churros were stuffed with some sort of sauce but the ice cream it came with was delicious. 
Service was nice and friendly as well.
So sad I probably won't be back since it's a bit of a drive and SF is hectic to get in and out of.
author: Teri R.

description: Everything I ate here was wonderful. The chips and salsa were very tasty. The guac was delicious and came in a generous portion size. For dinner I had the pozole soup which was exactly what I wanted since it was chilly outside. I also got the sweet plantains that come warm with crumbly cheese, which was the perfect side dish. It was a nice place with good service, all their staff was nice and accommodating. I'd definitely go back!
author: Nathanael S.

description: Came here for brunch and it was amazing! $15 bottomless mimosas I think the cheapest one you can find in SF. Delicious food and guac. We got the churro with ice cream after. It was so good. The service was excellent and they kept refilling our mimosas right away.
author: Sylvia N.

description: One of the best dining experiences I have ever been a part of. The service was incredible. Our waiter had an amazing personality and an obvious passion for the Mexican cuisine. The margaritas defineitley hit the spot (if you catch my drift). I would absolutely recommend this establishment as one of the best dining experiences in the Bay Area.
author: Will G.

description: My family of six came to celebrate my brother's bd. Wonderful drinks and delicious dinner. Highlights: nopales, camarones, duck, Chile rellenos and margaritas!!! What more could you ask for?? Ask for Joseth for your waiter! Best service ever!!
author: maria m.

description:
I made a reservation here for brunch on Sunday because of the bottomless mimosas! Unfortunately we were feeling a bit hungover from the night before, so we decided to forgo the alcohol for brunch. Overall, the food was pretty good, but I wasn't blown away.

Guacamole (2/5) - Lacked any sort of flavor. It needed both more salt and acid for my taste. It was also a bummer that you had to pay an extra $2 for chips.

Carnita Omelette (4/5) - The Carnitas were nicely cooked and tasty. There was meat both inside the omelette and on top with a sauce. This plate was pretty satisfying and a large portion (I could only eat about half).
author: Cynthia M.

description:
We wandered in here looking for a nice appetizer to tide us over until dinner. We were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the tingas and the margaritas.  Lee will definitely come back here for a meal.

Also, Carlos is a very pleasant and helpful bartender.  Great recommendations.
author: Paul M.

description: Came here for happy hour and couldn't be more satisfied with the selection and value. Ordered the sangria pitcher and the panuchos de cochinita pibil, both were delicious! Not to mention, their complimentary house made tortillas and salsas were some of the best I've had. Definitely recommend
author: Haley W.

description: My first time here and was looking forward to trying a new Mexican restaurant in the City.  The food exceeded my expectations.   The carnitas were cooked to perfection and black beans, pozole and guacamole were great.  Carlos,  our server,  was attentive and at the top of his game.   I highly recommend the Patron Tequila for a before or after dinner cocktail.
author: Louie G.

description:
Ok, I live in Maine, so I am no expert on really good Mexican food.  But I do appreciate really good, high quality, well spiced food, and this is the place.  
Let's focus on the most important thing first, the Marquita's were wonderful.  In fact everyone at the bar seemed to be very happy.  After you order you are given corn tortillas and some spiced sauces.  Let's lament for a minute that there is nowhere in Maine where you can get a corn tortilla with the smoothness of tamale masa, that is warm and melts in your mouth.  I need to move to San Francisco.  Oh, the sauces were very good, too.  I still just cannot get over the tortilla.  Finally I had the slow roasted pork carnita.  It was spectacular, tender, flavorful, with a sauce even better than the ones that came with the tortillas.  But wait.  You know how Mexican rice is dry and boring (remember I live in Maine).  I would drive an hour to get rice this flavorful.  Definitely not simple and boring.  This had some nice complex flavors, while still being a balance for other items with more spice.  The restaurant staff are also very nice.  I saw them go out of their way for at least 4 couples while I was there, and the bar staff were very nice to me.  To be short, go here, you will be extraordinarily happy that you did.
author: Frank B.

description: Let me say the food is great. But the portions are small. And, if you go in by yourself, and even if ALL the tables are open, you will be shuttled to the bar and given mediocre service.
author: Amy C.

description:
New fave spot in San Fran!
As I am literally always here for work...and not play, it was nice to have this restaurant right around the corner from the St. Francis where I often stay. 
Cute old world decor adorns the space and the staff is super friendly and on point. 
First...you HAVE to try out their handmade tortillas and salsas. They are complimentary so don't miss out! If you want to step it up a notch, order the fresh guacamole as well. There are 3 salsas...sweet, spicy chipotle, and green jalapeno? Either way, all 3 were amazing. You can, for an extra cost, get regular chips as well. This is a perfect start to your meal along with their crazy assortment of margaritas! Each unique and almost too many to choose from. 
Their house marg is A-OK. Come for Happy Hour and it's only $6! 
When I came during HH I also ordered the Queso Fundido which came with mushrooms and chorizo inside. All in all it was great along with the fresh tortillas...kind of like a quesadilla. However, this stuff was WAY too overly greasy...good...but greasy. 
As for the main course I ordered the filet Mignon and by god it was one of the best I had. Perfectly portioned and sitting atop some mashed potatoes. I ate the whole darn thing. The sauce on the plate wasn't that great in my opinion and did not bode well with the foods, but other than that it was fantastic. 
All in all this place is a for sure go-to when in San Fran!
author: Valerie W.

description: This spot had the most incredible service.  {Babe} Ruth was the epítome of hospitality.  Make sure you sit at the bar and have a conversation with the charming Jorge.  This place is a true gem.
author: Tayler C.

description: Travelers Beware, good food but got ripped off!  I ordered black beans & rice with veggies and it came up to $30.  Black beans and rice on the menu is $6, but the waiter rang it up individually.  Food was good, but if I could do it again, I'd go somewhere else!
author: Anthony L.

description:
San Fran one block from Marriott adagio on Geary
Brought tiff and she loves it too

Get two yellow salsas instead of the green. Yellow is the bomb 

Fortaleza tequilla silver was amazing 10
Their mild medium and hot salsa with corn tortillas was a 10 

Cheese enchiladas-7 good but order two of the panuchas instwad :)
Panuchos de cochonita (pork appetizer) 10

Tacos surtidos 7-8
Pork Chili relleno 7-8 healthy, not deep fried

Bacon wrapped shrimp 10 get extra sauce
author: Utah F.

description:
I don't pretend to know everything about SF's restaurant scene, but I can't believe I hadn't heard of Colibri after all these years.  Almost 1,200 reviews?  Impressive!  And clearly I spoke too soon in my review for Nopalito that they might be the only higher-end Mexican joint in the city - Colibri ain't too shabby!

With every table filled on a Friday night, my friend and I were lucky enough to snag a bar table right by the hostess stand (woohoo for first come, first serve!).  Although a regular table would have been better, sitting on those stools certainly beat waiting around, especially considering how hungry we were.

-- CAIPIRINHA - Leblon Cachaca with Muddled Limes and Sugar on the rocks...$10
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/colibri-mexican-bistro-san-francisco?select=vmWmzTrflpZFSCOOFod_wg#K3eJADB-7WczfKOdKNRAZw)
Ever since my best friend introduced this drink to me, I order it every time I see it.  Colibri's is a little pricier, but it's pretty large and one of the better ones I've had.  So refreshing...and so good!

-- SOPES SURTIDO - Assorted Sopes with Beans, Chicken, Shredded Pork, and Sautéed Vegetables; with Crumbled Queso Fresco, Onion, and Sour Cream...$10
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/colibri-mexican-bistro-san-francisco?select=vmWmzTrflpZFSCOOFod_wg#JCHoDI-uLJMyjDnUOB3pgw)
Pretty good stuff!  Of the three, the chicken was the best - moist and very flavorful.  The grilled vegetables were okay (tasty but a little overcooked) and while the shredded pork was fine, it was repetitive against my carnitas dish.

-- CARNITAS - Michoacan style Marinated Chunks of Pork, served with guajillo and chile de arbot salsa ...$17
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/colibri-mexican-bistro-san-francisco?select=vmWmzTrflpZFSCOOFod_wg#CRDnFnHafpJNlVVHVaODVQ)
I ordered this just so I could compare it directly to Nopalito's and I thought the two were pretty comparable.  Nopalito's was a little more tender and juicy, but I thought Colibri's was better seasoned and flavorful.  Pretty solid either way.

-- CREPAS CON CAJETA - Crepes with Cajeta (syrup of caramelized milk) and Vanilla Ice Cream...$8
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/colibri-mexican-bistro-san-francisco?select=vmWmzTrflpZFSCOOFod_wg#vKTonA9xJu2OqXcZaN2Hkw)
I wasn't hungry for dessert, but my friend really wanted to try this (she's got a serious sweet tooth).  The crepe itself wasn't that special (it got pretty soggy by the end), but the carjeta was so good!  A little too sweet, but still silky and delicious.

While our meal was pretty good overall, one of the highlights was definitely the tortillas that so many others have already mentioned.  Not only were they oh so warm and fluffy, but they helped to fill us up too.  Portion sizes are a little light, but the taste of the food justifies the price.  Between Colibri and Nopalito, it's nice to know there are some nicer Mexican spots in the city!
author: Mike L.

description: The service was great. Everyone that works there is very welcoming. The food on the other hand was absolutely uneatable. We ordered Guacamole and found two long blonde hairs in it. We didn't say anything. Then the food came and both plates were drenched in a bitter, over powering uneatable sauce. Colibri is definitely not a michelin star restaurant. I think the reason people keep going back to this place is not for the food but rather for the cocktails, drinks, Spanish music and ambient.
author: Michelle C.

description: I Walked in and was seated immediately, tons of open seating. The host decided to sit us in the very back though where it was freezing and after I asked to be seated toward the front she immediately said NO and said it wasn't possible. Then the server came over and asked if it was cold, and I said yes! So she moved us toward the front near the window. On the way to be seated I asked the bartender Adrianne or Adrianna what was the price for a shot of their top shelf tequila and she responded "It should be in drink menu check" ! This instantly blew my mind. I asked for her name 3 times before she finally mumbled her name and I walked away. Fast forward we stayed to eat which I don't know why, after the type of service that was being provided. The enchiladas were not good the cheese was not even melted, the chilaquiles said it had chicken! When the plate arrived there was 2 tiny pieces of chicken. The posole was alright, it had chicken which was RUBBERY. So I guess it was a good thing the other plates didn't have any chicken because it was gross anyways. Over all the service was bad along with the food. I don't recommend this place unless your coming to do bottom less mimosas. Oh an the manager came over and checked in on us, she was extremely nice and happy to be working But it still didn't  change the fact that everything else was bad.
author: Alex L.

description:
Great food. And amazing drinks. 

Plan ahead a day a day or two for early evening reservations. We went 45 min before our reservation and had a drink. Our table was ready early. 

The queso was out standing. Keep in mind it takes 15 min to come out. 

I had the carnitas and my husband had the fillet. We ordered the beans and mushrooms as sides. It was a lot of food. But well worth it. 

Desert was the chocolate cake again made to order of 15 min. Very good as well  

Order a after dinner tequila. I had never had one before and oh my goodness. I am hooked. 

When we come to San Francisco again we will be back.
author: Andrew G.

description:
Lucked out with a last minute open table reservation. Seated in a booth instead of a small table for two with no personal space.  

Food: the corn tortillas were fantastic. Very fresh and easily ripped apart with just a fork.  The chicken enchiladas were small but fantastic.the green and red sauces were very rich and flavorful. I asked for a side of mole and loved that sauce as well. I can be fairly picky when it comes to mole but it tasted as expected. The better half ordered the queso fundido with chorizo and thought it was fairly good. He loves his fundido and is quite picky with fundido. 

Service: Our server was quick to take our order and another person brought us the corn tortillas with the three salsas. However, it went downhill slow from there. The service became non-existent. Yes, the restaurant was busy but the server should still be checking in. 

Overall, I recommend coming here for the food but do not expect quick service.  You should set aside some time for dining. The prices were fairly reasonable for Union Square.
author: Sokha S.

description:
Pretty fancy Mexican restaurant. More upscale and classy looking. Had a romantic feel to it with dim lights. It was cute, I liked it.
