After tax and tip, our bill for a party of 4 was about $45/person with 1 shared guac and 2 drinks. Pricey, particularly for food that tasted bland and reheated.

I guess I'm really more of a $10-burrito-in-the-Mission girl, when it comes to Mexican food.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Let me say for the ambiance, guacamole and margaritas this place gets a solid 4 stars.  I enjoyed the drinks and guacamole a lot while the main entree slipped to 3 stars.  I should have stopped at just the appetizer and drink, but I got the carne asada which just wasn't as good as it could be.  The execution of the dish was lacking on all parts and I've had so much better at places that are 1/2 the price of Colibri.
author: Gary W.

description:
Everything we got was delicious.  

I love mole--period.  So I was glad that their mole poblano with chicken didn't disappoint.  I would also recommend the green pozole (mexican soup). It had a great limey flavor.  For appetizer, we got the toastadas with chicken and avo, and this was probably my least favorite out of all the dishes we tried.

The surprising thing was my friends potato dish (Tortita de Papas) was freaking good.  But I'm biased and love potatoes in Mexican dishes.
author: Charlie A.

description: Wow! This was amazing food!  The homemade tortillas were out of the world! They also make a great margarita!  Great guacamole and the enchiladas made me want seconds!
author: Jonathon I.

description: Food was absolutely amazing! They bring out a flight of salsa with some fresh tortillas TO DIE FOR! I had the carnitas and it fell apart in my mouth! My husband had the tortilla soup and it was delicious. Service was great as well!
author: Sally A.

description: I was surprised that the ratings for this place were so low the food was excellent.  The service was average but food makes up for it.  A little pricy but your paying for quality.
author: Eusebio C.

description: We went for brunch. Great service, delectable corn tortillas and fantastic food. Highly recommended if you are looking for a great Sunday brunch spot. The bottomless mimosas are a great side benefit.
author: Danielle D.

description:
Although the food was fine I really resented that our bill included a manditory gratuity.  This was never mentioned on any menu or web site.

I understand that for groups of 6 or more this is a customary practice and I have no problem with that policy.

However we were a party of 5 and the gratuity was included.
author: Richard D.

description:
Our first time to Colidri. We ordered the guacamole, which was pretty good. We had to pay extra for chips because only tortillas are provided. I understand charging $12 for guacamole, but to then charge for chips is bizarre. 

The enchiladas are like baby tacos with a "twist" on the traditional entree... I was definitely not a fan. My husband ordered the chile relleno and it did not have any cheese. The whole meal was strange and we won't be back again.
author: Mallory D.

description: Watch your check very closely if you are in a group with 5+. Our $200 bill arrived as $500+ and became a nightmare after an otherwise delicious meal.
author: Nicholas H.

description: Nice place to eat mexican food nice service  and great   food with handmade  tortillas
author: Jair S.

description: Excellent service and the tequila selection was some of the best I've ever seen! Bartender was very knowledgeable
author: Andy B.

description:
A great place to go before a show: it is right across the street from the Curran. Good service and an unusual take on Hispanic food, I guess because they are true to a particular region. Very interesting flavors. 

Don't look for the usual free chips and salsa. It is a fairly pricey add-on or appetizer. Portions are relatively small, but quite sufficient if you don't want to fall asleep at the theatre.  Same with the drinks, small and not very strong.  But the bar is loud and vibrant.
author: Rand S.

description:
Okay, wait a minute! There's a good restaurant a few blocks away from Union Square? And it's Mexican food without a gimmicky singing chili or tacky outside-on-the-inside decor? Yes folks, this is a solid restaurant smack in the middle of the hustle and bustle of SF.

We got the made-to-order guacamole and it was excellent. Now, I pride myself on making a good guac so I'm quite critical, but this quac stood up to the test. I got the Tamales Colibri, and they were excellent. Good enough that my wife dropped her dish and started sharing with me. The posole was also excellent.

There aren't many Mexican places I'm happy with, but Colibri really shined.
author: Akash K.

description: We loved the filet mignon cabra and the mojito we both had it very friendly staff we went there after we got tired of waiting to eat at cheesecake factory wow am i glad we went there it was a very busy saturday evening but they still gave great service very attentive to customers they had a pretty large crowd of regulars there even though we werent regulars we got great service we usually stay at a motel on saturdays in san francisco this is now on our list of must eat at places in san francisco cheesecake factorys loss colibris gain of 2 new regular repeat customers we are definately returning there to eat in a couple of weeks
author: Josephine H.

description:
I have been to Colibri a few times. My first visit was by accident. I was in town for a meeting and there was a group dinner. Pass! My friend and I ditched the group and went in search for a different restaurant. The hotel staff recommended a place close to Union Square. The good recommendation came with poor directions. We got to Colibri and decided to give it a shot. 

It's hard to describe the style of cuisine. It is not traditional Tex-Mex. It's more of a modern twist on Tex-Mex. They start you off with warm tortillas and three salsas: 1 mild, 1 hot, and 1 sweet. They're all good. My entree favorite is the carnitas. I will look at the other menu items but something really has to catch my eye to get me to move away from the carnitas. It's tender, mostly lean, and well-seasoned. The service typically leaves a bit to be desired. [Sometimes a lot to be desired...like the time I was left alone at the bar when I was finished and needed to cash out to get to a meeting.]

My guilty pleasure when I eat at Colibri is when they show El Santo movies on the TV above the bar. [I'm a big fan of El Santo y la Museo Del Cera.] If I can make it here for lunch, El Santo and eating at the bar is an hour well spent.
author: Dave C.

description:
Went here for lunch/brunch on Sunday. My friend and I both got the Huevos a la Mexicana ($10) and hot tea ($3).  Total was $28.99 + tip. 

Almost immediately they brought us water (tasted like bleach despite the fresh lemon slice). Then came the fresh warm handmade corn tortillas and trio of sauces. These were all delicious, especially the orange (mango?) salsa and the green (tomatillo?) salsas. They were not stingy with any of this and kept bringing it, so we basically filled up. 

LUCKY FOR US. 

The kichen wasn't just slow, they were glacier-like. It took more 35 minutes to get what was basically egg tacos. I seriously started to wonder if they had to go gather the eggs. When they did come they were simple and good, although not spicy bought for me so I added plenty of salsa. There was no pepper on the table, which I would have liked. 

When we walked out I told the hostess how great our waitress was but how bad the kitchen was.  She just nodded and smiled in a way that said, "I have no idea what you're saying. I don't speak English. Please go away."  She DID speak English tho!  I was not happy.

Next time I will go when I can enjoy their bottomless mimosa and relax!
author: Heather C.

description: Came with a group of 12 for dinner. Creative menu and nice ambience. I had the catch of the day which was the trout. It was good, but nothing special. Comes with a red sauce and 2-3 shrimps. The fish was well cooked but it could have used some more seasoning. Overall a 4 star experience.
author: Zeid S.

description:
Leg room for group seating is extremely small.

Lamb shank is on the bland side. Large portion but no vegetables or any other sides.
author: Ashley K.

description:
A margarita and some guacamole was just what I was craving after a fun girls day out. 

We ordered the guacamole and ceviche to start. You can order extra chips with the guacamole but you don't need them since it comes with delicious hand made corn tortillas. The ceviche was good and had a lot of lime which I like.

The lime margarita was fantastic! Just the way a margarita was meant to be made with fresh squeezed lime juice. 

I had the Mole for dinner which was very good. Having grown up in San Diego I'm a little particular about my Mexican food and especially mole. The sauce was rich and had a nice nutty chocolate flavor. The chicken was a little dry but the mole sauce balanced it out. 

Overall nice ambiance and good Mexican food near Union Square.
author: Erin Y.

description:
I'm always so torn when it comes to fancy, pricey mexican restaurants. My friend chose this restaurant since we were in the area and I'm glad I tried it out!

It's a really warm and cozy restaurant. They were pretty busy but we found a table near the door that no one else wanted to sit at so we sat there and avoided what could have been a long wait on a Thursday night!

They serve warm tortillas with 3 different salsas instead of the normal chips and salsa. This I definitely appreciated! The tortillas were wonderful and the variety of salsas were fun.

For an appetizer we ordered the shrimp ceviche. This was good to me, not the best I've had. If I would have known beforehand about the tortillas and salsa, I could have gone without the ceviche appetizer.

For my entree I ordered the most popular dish - the chicken mole. I don't know if it's because the chicken was dry, or if it's because my friend got a way better dish, but I was sort of disappointed in it. It was served with rice and it was just ok. I may just not be a fan of mole either. The sauce never tastes very flavorful to me.

My friend on the other hand got the shrimp plate with cornbread. O-M-G - best freakin' corn bread I've ever tasted! I'd go back for the corn bread alone. It's the first time I've had corn bread that had actual corn in it and just melts in your mouth. Odd for a mexican restaurant but I definitely didn't complain. She also let me try some of her shrimp and that was on point too! It went so well with the corn bread. She definitely won on the better pick, but I'm glad she let me try some of her food because it was so good!

Each entree was around $17 - not cheap, but it's quality. If I ever feel like eating some high quality, good tasting mexican food, Colibri is an option that I won't overlook!
author: Junel S.

description:
Loved everything!

 Brought sweetheart. Knocked our socks. The whole time I was there I was looking forward to coming back. Thinking about who I should bring and knowing all my people would love it there. I've been invited to happy hour upteen times to Colibri and never have been able to get off of work early enough to actually make it. We sat at the bar and Jesus took care of us. He was super attentive and kind. The epitome of a perfect BT. We ordered the carnitas appetizer and specialty drinks. Perfection. I'll be back for many more date nights. The awesome female led black and white Mexican classic film playing was the icing on the cake.
author: Animal S.

description: I don't always Yelp, but when I do it's for good reason. Get the shrimp with mole sauce, also order a side of cheese quesadillas (they have homemade tortillas, incredible). Then proceed to put the shrimp inside the cheesy goodness and enjoy. Guac is real solid too. ALSO, our server Brooke was legit. Funny, honest, and she knows how to put up with difficult guests (namely my mother). Anyway, well done Brooke. And the kitchen staff. Tasty.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Food was awesome but the drinks and service not so much. We ordered 2 Cadillac margaritas which were horrible as if completely lacking tequila and the service was very slow. It was our first time and we will not be back.
author: Kimberly C.

description:
Not sure how (or why) we ducked in here for a quick lunch with so much other great food in the neighborhood, but we did. What we got was a B- Mexican meal and D- service.

They were slammed and our poor server had an entire section of the place to herself - certainly not her fault that things went off the rails with our meal. In my experience, bad service is almost always a management problem first. Just understaffed, in this case.

Don't think I'd go back given the other solid options in the area.
author: Bill F.

description:
I love this place. Its perfect for any occasion. Ive been here a few times and the quality of service and food is consistent. The portions are small for their pricey menu, but thats the only downside. 
Love the chocolate cake! And have yet to visit for happy hour :)
author: Togi M.

description: Pretty good restaurant. Only one vegetarian option on the menu. It was crowded and they sat us by the door, which we didn't love, but we understood. Not traditional Mexican food (you will be disappointed if you're looking for common fajitas or enchiladas) but the one vegetarian option was surprisingly delicious and my friend likes her chile relleno. Pricey, but a good option if you're at a local hotel and want something different. Also, server was attentive (despite being very busy, which we appreciated).
author: Diane M.

description: Great food and service! The wait staff is AWESOME!  High end food. I had the Camarones-yum!  The margarita was very smooth - great choices and combinations.
author: Alaina E.

description:
Really good ceviche! i had the fish..and the steak was really tender and good too..

the sauce/salsa was good and hand made tortilla was fresh..i would come back..i came here for lunch and even tho its small it was nice n cozy. 

the only down side was it took forever to get he check, but other than tha..im sure the other food on the menu is good too!
author: Minerva L.

description: House margarita is outstanding with Cabo wabo Blanco as the base.  Guacamole was served with excellent homemade chips and thick soft corn tortillas.  Nice touch.
author: John C.

description:
This place was rec'd to us by our lovely bartender at RX. I am so glad we listened! 

We had already eaten a few hours before, so we got small plates. I had the guacamole - extra spicy(so good!), and the civiche. My SO had the pasole. I've never had pasole and I loved it! I've been missing out! The drinks were really good, I had a caipirinha. We ended our small meal with a Mango creme brûlée. Creme brûlée is always a must for me and it was very yummy.

It's definitely not your hole in the wall Mexican place, but it's some nice "fancy", delicious Mexican food. We will be back to try out their entrees.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Came here on a Saturday night. Food and drinks were delicious. Will definitely be back!
author: Agatha P.

description: I've had this place on my list for about 2 years, and I wanted to make it happen on this last trip, so I booked a reservation for a dinner meeting. We were seated quickly and the service was good, had drinks in no time. The drinks were quite good. We started out with some apps, none of which were particularly memorable. I got the Mole Chicken, it's very small, and the sauce was actually pretty bad in terms of Mole I have had and made as well. The one redeeming factor of this meal was the side of something which I cannot recall, but it was really good. Most of the rest of the food was pretty meh.
author: Jonah K.

description:
After seeing a play at SHN we were able to get a table for dinner. We were seated very quickly and our drink order was immediately taken. While they don't have an extensive menu they have many meals to choose from. 

The tortillas are amazing. The accompanying salsa (3 to choose from) was excellent and flavorful. 

I had the June special, short rib enchiladas. These were delicious. Excellent taste and a very nice portion size for me (3 soft taco size enchiladas). The sauce was sweet instead of spicy. 

Another in our party had the carnitas plate. This was served with rice and salsa. This plate was also a nice serving size and was delicious. 

The third in our party had the filet mignon. This was the only disappointing meal. It was very small and was tough. It was not up to par to the other meals.
author: Rhonda L.

description: Not sure how this place really is.  we ended up walking out because they wouldn't serve us lunch at 1PM.  They were still doing brunch and wouldn't budge on the menu. If you want Mexican for lunch and not breakfast- CALL and make sure they are serving lunch
author: Delilah A.

description: Well, the place is very nice.  The food is great, but it isn't very spicy. It is good in a strange flavorful/bland kind of way.  My only concern is that the cost outweighs the portion. If the cost was 25% less, then I would be happier.
author: Thomas P.

description:
Started here for Cindo De Mayo celebrations.

First off, I loved our waiter.  Super nice and very attentive even though it was extremely crowded.

Great strawberry margaritas and mojitos which went amazingly with the homemade salsas.

For food, I got the fish of the day which was salmon.  Honestly wan't too impressed, I preferred the chili relleno more which was stuffed with cheese and grilled veggies.

I think my favorite dish though was the side of rice, which is an odd thing to say, but it was really well seasoned.

Definitely will go back!
author: Michelle L.

description:
Colibri was my first foray into the SF Michelin Bib Gourmand list... excellent Mexican food in a central location with great service.  What else can you ask for? 

Came here for a business lunch and got to sample a few items including the Tomalitos, Fish Ceviche, and Enchiladas Divorciadas.  All of it was very good, but I have to say the Pièce de résistance was the churros filled with hot liquid caramel, then topped with ice cream and caramel sauce.  UNBELIEVABLE.  I couldn't help but think to myself "More churros please" in my best inner-Cartman voice while dreaming of Cliff divers.
author: Chad T.

description: I've eaten at hundreds of Mexican food places on both sides of the border over my life. This by far was one of the most incredible authentic meal experiences I have ever had. The salsas, the flavors, the presentation, their tequila collection, and the ambiance was wonderful. Homemade hand pressed corn tortillas to die for! I cannot find enough words to describe the dining experience. The wait staff was impeccable in the attentiveness and knowledge of the menu they were severing and answered questions exhibiting an sense of having eaten what they are serving. I highly recommend this to anyone thinking about eating here.
author: Daryl G.

description: FINALLY a San Francisco restaurant with authentic queso fundido. If you're into "queso" ie, nacho cheese you get at the movie theatre, queso fundido is not for you. Rather this succulent appetizer is a combination of Mexican cheeses, mushrooms, and chorizo baked together in the oven. Heaven in your mouth. Anyway, the fresh corn tortillas as delicious, and the drinks are extremely strong, only reason I am not giving them five stars is because I wish there were more traditional dinner options like burritos or enchiladas. Otherwise two thumbs up.
author: Kelsey K.

description: My first time there and I really liked it! The waitress was super nice, the food was absolutely delicious!!! We ordered 2 different margaritas which tasted the same, but the food was really good. Nice atmosphere too.
author: Neta G.

description: Great Mexican food, and very convenient if you're going to the Geary Theater or the Curran. My chicken breast stuffed with huitlacoche and accompanied by nopales was delicious.
author: Matthew T.

description: The guacamole was really great. We had Mole Poblano, Pato en Mole Verde Pipián, Pechuga Rellena de Huitlacoche and Carnitas. They were all so good. Mole Poblano was a little strange for my liking but it might just be me.
author: Vy T.

description:
Colibri

Awesome food.  Terrific, knowledgeable staff.  Amazing place to have dinner, apps, drinks, whatever.  I have to give total credit to Evangeline who saved my girlfriend's birthday party!!! We had a bad experience at another swanky restaurant downtown and ended up walking out of the place!  

Thank GOD for Evangeline and Colibri.  They clutched.  Made us a table for 12 with short notice and we received 5 star service. I swear it was amazing. And the food was hot and the servers were fast and smiled the whole time.  I could not have asked for a better turnout to what could have been a disaster of a night. If not for Colibri and Evangeling, it would have been.  She got us into a hot night club across the street to and had drinks comp'd there as well!!! 

What a great experience.  I strongly recommend you goto COLIBRI!!!
author: Paul R.

description:
Oh the little tortillas, the little tortillas!! I can just eat those little warm, fluffy, succulent pancakes and nothing else at the restaurant. And the three yummy dipping sauces that accompanies the tortillas are also wonderful.

As I tear myself away from the memories of the freebie tortillas for a second, I remember that the entrees are also very good. I had the chicken once and the duck another time. Also had the sopes appetizer that was very memorable and the guac was tasty too.

In general, the place is 3.5 stars, but the free tortillas totally push the restaurant into 4 stars territory.
author: Alice W.

description:
Had the guac, chicken mole, and prawn ceviche.

Let me start by telling everyone that I grew on up an avocado farm, and have eaten thousands upon thousands of avocados in my life, as well as have made hundreds upon hundreds of bowls of guacamole in any style you can possibly think of. I am an expert on guacamole. I know how to make it to appeal to different crowds of people, myself, my family, etc. I know what makes good guac, and what makes bad guac, down to every fine detail. 

The guac here is GOOD. It was a little heavy on the onion, and the onion could have been chopped just a tad finer, but I like onions so that did not bother me. If you are not a fan of onions, ask them to tone it down. In fact, give them your preferences up front on onion ratio, as well as spiciness. Nothing else, otherwise it gets too complicated. Just say light/heavy onion/heat. 

The rest of the meal was very good. Not above expectations hence not getting 5 stars, but very good and did not disappoint. I would experiment all over this menu if there weren't more places to eat in the city than I will have time for in my lifetime.
author: Jesten T.

description: No way. $18 bucks for three small triangular pieces of chicken breast stuff with vegetables. Food is only decent and nothing special. Not sure why this place seemed busy but I know I won't be returning. The atmosphere feels diner-ish and rugged. Not a classy place for dates.
author: Wilson L.

description:
The food was excellent.  I had the Pechuga Rellena de Huitlacoche which is 
chicken breast stuffed with a mix of huitlacoche , zucchini and fresh corn, served over a roasted garlic sauce.  Perfect sized serving and absolutely delicious.  The guacamole was really good, as well.  Everyone I was with loved the food.

Service was a bit slow...I had to wait long periods of time before getting a water refill.  But overall, a great experience and fabulous Mexican food.
author: Traci H.

description:
Great upscale but casual Mexican food, the only good restaurant in my opinion around all of Union Square. Awesome guacamole, mole dishes, carnitas. Ceviche is very good but not amazing. I think ceviche is better at the Peruvian restaurant Fresca. Great place to get meat if you doubt meat quality on 24th street. Love this place, have gone many times and will keep going back.

And great tequila  bar if you like that.
author: Michelle G.

description:
Fantastic!!  Guacamole and salsa is amazing.  I enjoyed their mole sauce.
Good service and good value pricing.
author: Lisa A.

description:
Cute place near awesome Union Square in SF. Very good ambiance. We were seated pretty quickly, despite an estimated 30 min wait. 
Food was excellent. All 5 of us loved our meal.  Only complaint was on the drinks -- ithat the "bottomless mimosas" was a sham.   Took nearly 20 min for them to bring the 1st round. Then, for 2nd round we had to ask THREE TIMES for a refill. Then had to escalate to manager. Wish I had just ordered a beer, which is what I wanted before being talked into the "bottomless" mimosa scam.
author: Aim M.

description:
Had brunch here during Santa Con weekend. My husband wanted to try it since the last time we walked by there was a 2 hour wait with no reservations and this was a weekday night! Nice upscale place with to-be expected prices for the area. Right across the street from the theater.

The service was good, not as fast as I hoped but our server was expecting so I gave her a pass. Chips and salsa were served at the table. There are three different salsas to choose from. YUM! We ordered the guacamole (my favorite anywhere). It was so good and fresh and I am glad I ordered it. Not too spicy (we had it medium spicy). 

I had the bottomless mimosas and huevos rancheros and my husband had the Chilaquiles.

My huevos rancheros were very, very good and he wolfed down the Chilaquiles. Food was served hot and fresh.   I was expecting a pitcher of the mimosa to be left at my table like Bisou but at Colibri they walk around and fill each glass. 

I will come again!
author: Lauren W.

description: Loved this place.  Visiting from New York, I was surprised to see this place didn't get better reviews on yelp!  Food was amazing, along with the extensive margarita menu, delicious Macho Margarita (made with jalapeños), table made guacamole, and wonderful service should have received more stars.  A little pricey but worth it.
author: Danielle P.

description: Was looking for a place to eat by union square that was not just an average diner and happened to stumble upon this place, and I'm so glad I did. The food is excellent, the taste, presentation and pricing was all great. The home made tortillas with the salsas are much better than your average chips and salsa, I highly recommend this place, look forward to coming back again.
author: Josue V.

description:
$31 for Unlimited Mimosas and 1 Chilaquiles verdes. I wasn't a fan of the Chilaquiles, but I made up for it by drinking my weight in Mimosas. I thought the famous Carnitas were also a bit of a let down - tender but a little boring in flavor. Our waiter was awesome, he got us as many mimosa's as 45 minutes could give us so we could make it to the Giant's game in time. And best of all, he made every mimosa with more champagne and less OJ. 

The Chilaquiles is basically tortilla chips with sauce and chicken (not much chicken by the way). I regretted not getting the Desayuno because the steak was delish. The guac is good but $12 for a bowl  is PRICEY! Also, they don't have chips, so you eat it with corn tortillas. 

No flour tortillas :( Oh well, service was great and it is refreshing to be able to walk into brunch at noon in SF without waiting!
author: Jess C.

description: Good place if you want upscale mexican food. I've been here with coworkers and always had a great time! The food is very good and pretty different from the Mission mex food joints. If you're into a more upscale atmosphere and want Mex food, then this is your place!
author: Esther F.

description: Fantastic food! I had the prawns in mole sauce and it was hands down the best Mexican food I've had. And it didn't cost a fortune for being in close proximity to Union Square. I highly recommend this place!
author: Connie B.

description: D-lish! We enjoyed the atmosphere and the service was great. The food is quite tasty but the portions are a tad small.
author: Susan F.

description: Good food, service very slow. Yes it's super bowl weekend but the back of the restaurant where we were was about 50% full... Pretty sure our server forgot about us at one point!
author: Meghan M.

description: Quick service and really well prepared food. Definitely on the higher end and fancy side, but not over priced. I am super glad I am not suffering from a gut bomb. All Mexican food should be done this way. Highly recommend!
author: Jeffrey R.

description:
I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE AT ALL !!The food was excellently good, but unfortunately I was disgusted by the service Alejandra so called "Manager"provided and the lack of service  Laura gave us. Laura Only came to bring us what we had ordered but never to ask if we were doing ok after the food had arrived. One of the busboy was whom came to ask if we needed something els.I and my family purposely went to eat at Colibri Mexican Bristo to celebrate my fathers birthday taking into account the Yelp reviews. Unfortunately, my dad who was celebrating his birthday was in the middle of his 2nd Tequila shot, ready to ask for his 3d. Let me just make it clear there was no legal sign posted at the restaurant beverage menu much less the Bar that stated that there was a limit of 3 alcohol drinks. Alejandra came over to serve the tequila shot and said " I will serve you your last tequila shot ok". We  automatically responded that my father was totally ok. We were complimenting the food to the waitress and we're having such a great time and enjoying the food. I find it very unprofessional that Alejandra came to say that to us while giving my father his Tequila shot. By then we were already disgusted sick to our stomach because the waiter never came to check on us, and when some one did it was to decide my dads last drink. Mind you the Restaurant has a BAR! Why have a BAR if you are going to have A limit of 3 drinks.  They should of had a sign stating that there was a limit of 3 tequila shots. Also we waited literally 25 min for our check, after three times of already asking for it. For the fourth time I asked Alejandra to bring us our check and she didn't even apologized for the delay. It's ashamed that we will NEVER GO BACK neither would we RECOMMEND IT TO ANYBODY! I did give a call to the General Manager Joel who currently has not called us back, I hope I get a response asap! Managers like Alejandra will bring a restaurant DOWN! She made a big mistake we've been to so many restaurants, and never have they did what she did.






Joel O: 
Business Manager
Dear Adriana, Thank you for contacting Colibri Mexican Bistro. Your comments regarding the service you received at Colibri are very important to us. We sincerely apologize for the frustration and inconvenience that you experienced at the restaurant tonight. We understand how frustrating it is to have plans for an elegant day unexpectedly go awry. We will talk to everyone involved and we'll take the appropriate actions. We'd like to add that by the State and local laws we are in charge of preventing intoxication at our restaurant or serving alcohol irresponsibly. Is our job to effectively intervene to prevent our guests to become intoxicated and cause damage to themselves, others, property or the restaurant. Thank you again for reporting this incident, and again our sincere and deepest apologies.




Adriana L: I understand that by law you guys are In charged of preventing intoxication and or serving alcohol irresponsibly, however, you should have a notification on the menu or visible in the restaurant or bar that 3 drinks is the limit like other restaurants provide, and we wouldn't have this problem. My father was not drunk or acting belligerent for Alejandra to had approached us like she did. There's a bar in the restaurant were I'm sure Friday Saturday and Sunday's no one has only 3 drinks.
author: Adriana L.

description: This was a wonderful experience.  We went for brunch on a Saturday and the food was amazing.  Very authentic.  They were making tortillas right in front of us.  Everything tasted so fresh especially the guacamole and salsas. They did a special hot sauce for my husband, who really loves spicy and it was almost to much for him, which was perfect.  Bottomless mimosas for $11. The place was very affordable, I would say even underpriced.  Will go back for sure.
author: Erin M.

description: Terrible food, terrible service. They also charged me more than I authorized on the receipt, effectively stealing money from me.
author: Nikunj M.

description: Pretty good! The filet mignon was Tasty the guacamole is also very tasty. Service is good. Was not blown away with the overall flavors. But I will be returning to try more. I had the verde soup. My bf had the meat and my friend loved the chile relleno :) so it's a good place to check out. Reservations may be a good idea for a busy weekend night.
author: Wilde E.

description: To be honest, I thought this place would be cheesy. It's not. We sat at the bar and tried several drinks. Happy to see they have several choices for Mezcal because we haven't had access to it since moving from Texas to Florida. Our bartender, Carlos, made our visit pretty special. He adjusted our drinks based on what we liked / didn't like.  We had the beet salad and queso fundido. Loved the 3 salsas and homemade tortillas that came with our meal. Try it out. Sit at the bar. You won't regret it.
author: Karen D.

description:
I was here for dinner with a group of friends. Be forewarned: the drinks are expensive. I ordered a mojito ($11) and it was very tart (lots of lime) without much mint flavor. The Carnitas were a bit on the dry side and the Chile Relleno was alright. Serving portions were small, I ended up snacking later that evening. 

On the flipside, the guacamole was very good, the service was pretty good, and the restaurant had good lighting.
author: N D.

description:
Great spot for Mexican food. The guacamole is great (though you have to pay +$2 more for chips instead of just tortillas). The chicken enchiladas is also pretty good though it isn't done in a rolled up way I'm used it -- not a big deal though.

The spot itself isn't very large though there is ample seating for lunch. The bar seating is quite long and the place probably would be great at night too.
author: Victor W.

description: The food is overpriced and the portions are small. Flavor wasn't that great and our server looked dumbfounded the entire time. Skip this place unless you want to be disappointed.
author: Mayur M.

description:
As if I didn't have enough Mexican on my California trip, I decided to have it again at Colibri.  Unlike the rest of my taqueria-centric dining, Colibri is a refined and upscale variation, and quite a different experience.  Located in central SF, this high-ceilinged modern restaurant is warm, classy, yet vibrant in rich red and dark woods.  The dining space is relatively narrow and long, with the bar midday way in on one side.  Staff were very good.

Much was tempting on their menu but alas, I can only eat so much dining solo.  I started with a standard tequila flight, which arrived in style in a spiral black metal rack, each elegantly flared shot glass held in a loop, with salt and lime to add, and a chaser in the form of tart tomato juice.  I am new to tequila so this was fun to try.  Appetizer was the Ceviche de Camarones, a large bowl of chopped prawns, vegetables, and herbs in a tart, citrus-spiced broth, topped with big avocado slices.  The shrimp were cooked, actually a bit more than I usually like, but having made shrimp ceviche at home, it didn't taste like it was "cooked" via citrus, instead tasting like it was cooked first then added to the ceviche mix (or sat in the citrus marinade too long).  Entree (actually an appetizer) was the Tacos Pescado.  These came three to the order, grilled tilapia on warm, fluffy tortillas, generously garnished.  Unfortunately not well-balanced, overwhelmed by toppings, intensely flavored sauce and crunchy sliced vegetables leaving little room for complementary or contrasting flavors and textures, respectively.

This ended up being the most underwhelming Mexican experience this trip.  Perhaps what I ordered weren't their best choices, because there would seem to be much to like about this handsome restaurant, its interesting menu, and reasonable prices.  Still, food weighs the most in my ratings so for now, will have to hold at 2 stars.
author: Valery C.

description:
I'm not a fan of writing Yelp reviews, unless they are positive and Colibri deserves it. I live up the hill and have never tried Colibri until today, stopped by for some takeout lunch and then stopped back by for dinner. I played it safe and ordered the simple Enchilada lunch and a side of Tortilla Soup, was fabulous. Grabbed another soup and black beans on the way home. I look forward to trying some of the other dishes especially Cochinita  Pibil, Ceviche, Mole Poblano, some of my favorites, etc, to just name a few. 
The staff were all very nice, lovely interior, not very pricey considering the quality and the location. 
Will certainly be back and will be more than happy to recommend!
author: Meredith S.

description: We stopped in for happy hour. Drinks are excellent as are the items on the happy hour menu. We will be stopping in again when we are close. House margarita is excellent. Great service. I recommend this place!
author: Bub N.

description:
Waiting to see a show at the Curren around lunch time, and we happened upon this wonderful Mexican place. It was a cool quiet place to escape the business of Geary St.
We ordered the Queso Fundido as an appetizer and it came out exactly perfect... Brown caramelized cheese with chorizo mixed in served with fresh tortillas. It didn't last long, and it was magnificent.
The Flautas were crispy and delicious, but the Carnitas won the prize! The pork simply fell apart when you put your fork to it and was perfectly cooked, juicy, and delicious. 
I can't wait to return and try more food from this wonderful restaurant.
author: Drew H.

description: Yummy food.. I had the vegetarian potato dish with mushroom  and tomato sauce ... Literally ate the whole dish and wanted seconds.. Worth it
author: Salma X.

description:
Best things about this place: delicious homemade tortillas and a really great tequila and mezcal selection.

Other than that, the food here is ok, but somewhat bland and not worth the absurdly steep price. $12 for a deceiving portion of fresh guacamole (served in the traditional volcanic stone bowl but then in a tiny, shallow dish disguised inside) and chips to go with are two dollars extra!! Their amazing tortillas come with it, luckily. The ceviche is very good but nothing out of the ordinary. Colibri's homemade salsas are good, but don't expect more than one bowl of chips for the table unless you want to pay. Entree portions are small by American standards, which is actually refreshing, other than the unnecessarily inflated price you pay for them. The entrees themselves are nothing special.

Unless you're at Colibri simply for a tequila or mezcal flight, or cocktails, I would recommend dining at Tropisueño instead. It's not too far away, similar/higher quality food with tons of flavor (their salsas are among the best I've ever had anywhere) and you get far more for your money.
author: Jennie P.

description:
Im not big on mexican food but my friend wanted me to try this place because it had many great reviews and was featured on zagg a few times!  The place seemed really clean and nice.  It was hard to believe that this place was just a casual mexican restaurant.  

The waiters were kind of helpful, but didn't help too much.  I ended up getting this dish that came with three tacos with egg/chicken meat.  Overall i thought it was an okay experience.  Don't get me wrong, i can still tell from bad to good mexican food, but this was probably not my best experience with mexican food.  The Price was a bit expensive for what they were giving us.  I would definitely come back here again to try some new things, but this would not be my preferred place to go for an expensive brunch.
author: Adam L.

description: In town for business and noticed the restaurant in passing. It looked promising in a somewhat hit-n-miss neighborhood (west of union square).   Came in for lunch and was very pleased. I sat at the bar and was very well attended to. Impressive selection of Mexican spirits including a nice variety of mescals. I skipped the very obvious margarita selections and went for a mescal cocktail - the Last Mariachi. It was very good. For my meal, I had the mole poblano and was also very pleased. Overall and based only on what I had, this is an extremely good Mexican restaurant. I'd place them in the same league as Hugo's (of Houston) - closer than most but still with some room to bridge that gap.
author: Robert H.

description: The hostess told us it would be a 10-15 minutes wait because the people at the table is already paying.  15 minutes later she said they have not yet paid and she had no idea when the table may be ready and it may be another 20 minutes wait.  I told her you just misrepresented the facts and have no credibility at all and we left.
author: Benjamin H.

description:
good food and good service.  i am used to the standard mexican
fare at most chain restaurants but you can really tell this place is
different.  give it a try.
author: Diane H.

description:
Gotta help the ratings here. It was super yummy and service was great. Carne Asada is the way to go! My daughter has deemed it her 5th favorite restaurant (after only being there once) and my husband had the Chile Relleno and it was amazing.

Decor is great, only advice would be to extend the decor into their restrooms!

Cheers!
author: Sandy J.

description:
Really nice restaurant.

Here's a tip, the main dishes are a little on the small side.  If you're hungry, be sure to order side dishes or appetizers and the like.  My boyfriend and I split an appetizer and a salad, then our two main dishes were the right amount of food, with room to split a delicious dessert.

The quality of the food was fantastic.

We also liked our margaritas (they didn't skimp on the tequila) and our service was good.
author: Jen G.

description:
Used to be 5 stars for me, but last weekend when we went back, discovered that the guacamole is not longer made fresh at the table. That was a special draw for us before.
AND, instead of cilantro, I had parsley. Really? How weird is that. Still, I give 4 stars with the hope that next time it will be back to the "best" days. Right across from the Curran theatre which is a positive feature for anyone on the way to the theatre.

Tortillas, freshly made!
author: Julie F.

description: So I've been here both for dinner and for weekend brunch.  I had a mole chicken for dinner that was amazing - I'm a mole freak and this was the best I've EVER had in any country.  Brunch was delightful.  Bottomless mimosas - two of my favorite words in the morning.  Prices are very reasonable.  They have an amazing selection of tequila.  The service is very prompt and friendly and the manager seemed to be really on top of things.  We will definitely be back.
author: Greta R.

description:
A associate of ours was leaving at my work and thus we were all treated to lunch down the street.

The pluses of Colibri are that it is in fact a gorgeous restaurant. It's well polished and put together, at least in the front and it bodes excellent service and tasty food. My flautas were the best I've ever actually had, even though you only receive two.

Sadly, the negatives are things that would keep me from coming back on my own. Ie when not on someone elses dollar ;) It's wildly overpriced for what you get. The guacamole is something ten dollars or more, and you receive the equivalent of two avocados at most. 

And while I enjoy that there are smaller portions, I don't expect to still be charged "full price" for what is definitely smaller cuisine.

Finally, expecting their ladies room to be just as polished as the front of the restaurant I got a rude awaking when I entered to be met with sketch accommodations and a general feeling they had sunk the bulk of their money into the front. Black duct tape adored what had once been dispensers and extremely small stalls met my eyes.

When I spend large amounts of money on food, that's right, food... not something like clothing that will be with me for years and years, I want the entire package of great food, well priced and a fully polished restaurant. I probably won't be back.
author: Meg T.

description:
Pros-
Nice beverage selection
Homemade tortillas
Server assistant was attentive and friendly

Cons
Bland dishes
Our server was "Laura" she was very distant/disconnected - rarely checked on our table, forgot our food etc.
Overpriced for the lack of flavor and quality
author: Jason L.

description:
Hmm I want to give this a place a 3.5 considering it's pricey for the relatively small portion you get, but the food was SO good, and fresh.

Not your tex-mex fare -- this is more traditional but yet, in a classy setting, which is a big change.

The restaurant is really nice :) great to chill with friends or a group. There's an add $5 to your meal to add a margarita, LOL, wish more places were like this :)

I didn't get any drinks but they sound really good. Apparently there's a chile margarita or something?? Might come back to try it one day.

Food: preeeeetty pricey and the portions are small (AKA, just right, where you won't be stuffing your face and feeling like crap afterwards)

Guacamole: pretty good, but again, small. Chips were made in-house I THINK, since it felt warm..? Haha..

I got the mole poblano (chicken with a black sauce that included chocolate and some stuff I don't remember..) The chicken was suuuuper tender and the sauce was really good and unique.

My co-workers got some tacos -- that they said was super fresh and tasted good, but it was like, $12 for 3 widdo tacos -- AND I DON'T LIKE TO USE THE WORD "WIDDO" when I have to pay for something. LOL.

Anyhow, pretty solid place and the price is justified by how nice the restaurant looks, the service, the presentation, and most of all - the food.
author: Emily C.

description: My boyfriend and I really liked this place! We went for lunch, but didn't realize it was actually brunch on a Saturday afternoon. We opted for the bottomless mimosas and couldn't have been more satisfied. The waiter definitely kept our glasses from reaching bottom the whole time we were there! I got the eggs benedict and it was delicious. Portion was on the smaller side but with all the mimosas I was drinking, I didn't mind. My bf got the chorizo, beef and scrambled eggs plate and he loved it. He said it was a hefty portion. The salsas and the fresh corn tortillas they brought out before our entrees were also delicious. The mango salsa was on point! I'm riding a mimosa high right now but I still give this place 5 stars for service and food quality!!!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Pretty great Mexican food just a few steps from Union Square. It's definitely a solid spot but probably won't make an effort for a 2nd trip. 

Margaritas are delicious, guac is fresh, and the camarones en mole are fantastic. Its a bit pricier than I'd like, but worth a try.
author: Nadine H.

description:
This was the first time I have been here and though the venue is not impressive the food makes up for it. I sat inside close to the kitchen with no air conditioning so it was kind of stuffy even though this has been one of the coldest winters in a while. 

Enough about the sitting arrangements though, the menu is well put together with a fantastic arrangement of authentic Mexican culinary flavors that stimulate the senses. The coffee is excellent and super hot just the way it's supposed to be. Personally, I had the chicken mole  poblano which to me was a mix between the classic chicken saag and full blown chicken marsala. I chose to top mine off tabasco sauce which created a flavor explosion you would come to expect from authentic Mexican food.  Perhaps it isn't the healthiest of choices but sometimes a little bit of poison is necessary to indulge in life's pleasures. 

Anyhow, I will most definitely be back to try the rest of the menu items in the near future and update my review each time. For now, if you're looking to discover that fantastic Mexican cuisine then give this place a try and write a review from your perspective!
author: Pocho G.

description:
Came back in again for brunch. The mimosas weren't suuuper bubbly ( like me ) but they were enjoyable. Definitely never saw the bottom of my glass... Oh yea the bartender was suuuper sweet. Really good service at that place.

I had the chilaquiles verde... Soooo good! Some of the best I've had.... 

I'll definitely keep coming back here..
author: Michelle W.

description:
Superb dining experience! I'll just write it all out

Appetizer: Queso Fundido con Chorizo, with the freshly made tortillas you will have to control yourself because you could easily just eat all the tortillas and queso to the point of unbuttoness!

Entre: Pato en Mole Verde Pipián and Filete Mignon.. Divine! The duck was moist and well seasoned with the sauce. The filet mignon when you combine the sauce, potatoes, meat and the ancho chile goat cheese concoction OMG it has a magical explosion of flavors on your tongue!

Dessert: Caballeros Pobres this was everything I could hope for in a dessert. Creamy ice cream that tasted like homemade, flaky, soft, Sopaipilla like..Perfect ending to a perfect meal!
author: Cherie C.

description:
The pros are:
+ Good food
+ Solid service

The bads:
- Very busy, loud
- A bit over-priced for the food
author: Kirk T.

description: So impressed. Not only did we have one of the best meals to date,  we had the best service as well. The manager is a true pro, and those in the kitchen are masters of their art.
author: Lindsay W.

description:
This restaurant is high on theme, but sports below average food and absolutely poor service. On August 26, on Monday, a low foot traffic night, I witnessed a large contingent from a high profile company struggle with everything from reservations tracking to basic headcount. Even the bar service was inattentive. The investors in the restaurant would have been explosively upset had they witnessed the poor service. 

The General Manager on duty on Monday evening August 26, was poorly trained as I've seen for place of this high stature, and outright unfriendly. I wish the the capital partners who invested in this restaurant could have seen her in action destroying their restaurants image with a party of 10+ senior executives of one of the most prominent companies on earth. The bill was to exceed $1,000, which is clearly more profitable than 10 couples at $100, plus the echo effect of having each of the guests spread the word of their experience could mean thousands more in revenue on a monthly basis.

I've visited this restaurant for tequila and bar stool dining on other occasions, but was absolutely shocked at the incompetence of the GM on duty in a dinner scenario. I highly recommend avoiding this restaurant for any serious dining.

Atmosphere=Good; Food = Fair; Service= Poor

I hope the investors read this , and pull it together on service quickly. The service is a blue print for how to go out of business in the restaurant world.
author: R W.

description:
What to say about this place...  I'd probably give it a 3.5.

Environment: Very well-lit.  Chandeliers and lanterns hanging around everywhere.

Service: It was tough to flag our servers down to get a refill of chips and salsa.  It was hard to tell who our server was, since everyone was running all over the place.

Food: Guacamole was very good.  They don't mix the guacamole in front of you, in case you were wondering.  I ordered the chicken dish and the chicken was very tender.  It literally almost fell off the bone, in a good way.  We ordered "Cadillacs" which is a glorified margarita.  Not sure what the big difference is, as it tasted just like a normal margarita.

Conclusion: Good date spot.  Come here for the atmosphere.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Pretty good.

Decent food, reasonable price, decent portions.
Nice décor.  
I have had better, but the ceviche has a lime flavor that is both healthy and enjoyable.  
I have only ordered the ceviche pescado and salad, I may come back and try more.
Pleased with the service: came by the place was packed and not only did they make my order to-go but had it ready in quite rapid pace.  
  
Fond of both red and green salsas, both are medium hot with robust flavor.  Chips a smidge bland (how I would prefer them).  Not greasy or salty which is perfect since I would much rather taste the salsa anyways.

They had what looks like an incredible guacamole, with lots of avocado chunks; but it only comes in huge portions far too large for one person eating alone.

I rate the place 3.5 stars, though if the guacamole tastes as good as it looks: can easily see this getting a solid 4 stars.
author: Veronica S.

description:
Nice ambiance. Tasty margaritas. 
Generally though, this is an overpriced non-authentic Mexican place with sub-par food at best. 
Instead of chips and salsa, they recommend their corn tortillas with salsa. The tortillas and especially salsa were not that great. I had chili reyanno for my entre, and it was expensive, not that much food, and bland (not spicy or even savory). Didn't come with rice, which I felt it needed... So I added a side of rice... For $5... They were not willing or able to provide lettuce and tomato on the side when I asked. For a $20 Mexican entre, you can't toss a scrap of lettuce / tomato on the side? Puleaze. Two stars for this place is being generous. I'm willing to pay more for good food if its worth it, but this was not.
author: Heather T.

description: Had dinner reservations with my husband for 5:30 on a Tuesday night and were seated soon after we arrived to the half full restaurant. The problem was that I use a wheelchair which I had made a point of telling the hostess about when I made the reservation. I told her both on the phone and when we arrived in person that because of the wheelchair I needed a table near the door. However, instead of seating us at one of the available tables there, we were seated at the table farthest away from the door, without her or the manager even asking us if this was OK. Being seated so far away from the door made our exit very difficult since by the time we finished, the restaurant was much more full. My husband, the wheelchair and I barely had enough room to maneuver around the many tables and the many people who stood at the long bar. It was truly awful to continually bump into tables (whose patrons didn't have much place to move to), as well as up directly against bar patrons (who also had minimal alternative space to go), all just to get back to the front door. The manager just stood next to the door and said he completely understood when we complained to him. Ha-If he really understood he would have perhaps apologized, but certainly would not have chosen to tell the hostess to seat us there. I strongly advise chair users to skip Colibri. We certainly will.
author: Nancy F.

description: What a perfect place for our anniversary / birthday dinner. Great food, amazing dessert, awesome atmosphere. We had so much fun!
author: Mike Y.

description: Restaurant was recommended by our hotel so we came by for brunch. Food was average, not bad but not great. We both had chilaquiles. The chicken had some chewy pieces. Salsa was good. The service was a bit sporadic. There was one server for 6 plus tables and he kept forgetting what we ordered. He was really nice but our orders were pretty basic. He seemed overwhelmed
author: Anna K.

description:
When in the mood for Mexican, I naturally gravitate towards hole in the wall taquerias that serve up big burritos.  But I suppose we all have to be civilized once in awhile, so I agreed when some friends decided on dinner at Colibri.

I knew nothing of the restaurant, other than my friend telling me they make a good table-side guacamole.  So, we got some guacamole, chips, and toritillas/salsa for the table, while I ordered the Pechuga Ranchera for myself.

The  Pechuga Ranchera was described as "tender chicken breast smothered in a creamy guajillo chile sauce, over mashed potatoes with sautéed spinach and garlic" on the menu.  I wasn't really sure what to expect, but what I got was delicious.  The sauce was flavorful and the potatoes were smooth and delicious.  The guacamole was good, but not outstanding.

Overall, it was a good experience, and I'm glad I ventured outside of my comfort zone.  But I probably need to eat about a dozen burritos in a hole in the wall before I'd come back for any sort of sit-down Mexican.
author: Nadeem A.

description: This place sucks. Service sucks. Food wasnt all that great neither. Carne asada was dry.  It took like 1.5 hours to get our food on a Sunday morning for a birthday. WEAK sauce.
author: Cliff S.

description: Good food no complaints there, just a bit overpriced! Guacamole doesn't come with chips, you have to pay extra for them!
author: Alex B.

description: Wonderful food!  Chile Relleno was great.  Not all the heavy fried food. Very fresh, delicate tastes. Love the homemade tortillas.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Everyone's right, get the guac. The tortillas they serve with it are mind-blowing.

The brunch was really great, albeit a bit pricey. Unique and delicious, and worth a visit if you're in the area. The scene is quiet, so don't worry about reservations - the place was empty an hour after they opened on a Saturday for brunch.
author: Derek S.

description: 2nd time visiting this place. The nopales dish was terrible. Quesadilla was terrible. The only good thing so far is the Carnitas or I'd rate this place 2 stars for it's convenient location to our mainstay hotel. Our bill was $100 for 2 entrees, order of nopales, glass of wine and a beer. Chipotle would have been 100 times better!
author: Natalie B.

description:
Came here this past saturday with a g/f as she was craving a skinny girl margarita. 

This came up on yelp under that filter and it was easy to make an online dinner reservation for 2. 

We got here around 8pm and it seemed pretty packed already. They didn't have any open tables for at least 30 min and it was first come first served in the bar area. 

Luckily, we were seated right away for our 8pm reservation. 

We ordered a couple of skinny margaritas and just wanted to share a couple of appetizers to start with. For starters we ordered the guacamole and added chips for $2, the ceviche, and we ordered the tostadas with chicken on it.

The appetizers came out really quick! But the drinks did come straight out as the waiter came back and said they were really backed up on the bar. And once the margaritas arrived, we tasted them, and they were more tart then expected. My g/f said that usually they use agave nectar to combat the tartness and wasn't sure if they did that here. Still despite the taste, it was tequila so we didn't mind too much and continue to eat and drink and continue our girl talk :)

The appetizers were ok in flavor but the portions were good sized. Except for the chicken tostadas which were only 3 chips with chicken and guac on top. I felt like They should at least been 4 pcs to make it balanced? 

The guacamole was good but we did ask for it spicy but it wasn't spicy at all to us. That could be because we both love our spicy and so we have a high tolerance for spicy? Again it was a good portion to share and definitely filled us up.

The ceviche was fresh and delish as well! Had a lot of good chunks of white fish and it was a big portion for two to nibble on. 

Overall, this place is nice for drinks and appetizers to share. I say its a little pricey as I do think they charged extra for more chips. Also I'm used to my mexican food to be cheaper and not as fancy as this place but the food is solid and the drinks are strong so definitely a nice place to check out if you are in the area.
author: Christine W.

description:
first let me say this; everything in union square is waaaay over priced so I shouldve known better. The food was excellent here. service could have been better but was pretty good overall. 

The duck mole is pretty darn good, and the tortillas are superb. the drinks were very small... and not very strong. 

I give the food 4 stars, the service 3.5 stars and the value 2 stars. its just too overpriced for what you get.
author: Ryan B.

description: Stopped by post show for drinks, app, & dessert. Overall, disappointing. Food was ok, nothing special. And service was less than desireable. Will not be coming back.
author: Laura B.

description:
A great find by The Man.  Actually, I found it kinda hard to eat in a bad restaurant in SF.

Saturday night...  This afternoon was spent doing the tourist thing.  I mean, I guess you have to do some of that shit, right? A person can only drink and eat so much in an unfamiliar city before your brain realizes that all you've seen are bar stools.

Living in LA, you become a Mexican food snob.  From taco stands to mom pop restaurants, you have an abundance of options for great Mexican.  So, I wasn't expecting much walking into Colibri.  First thing I noticed was how packed this place was.  We had no reservations on a Saturday night.  The hostess told us it'd be impossible for us to get seats but what she didn't know is that The Man is a Bar God.  Yes... that's right.  The Man can walk into any bar and be seated within about 5 minutes.  If it's longer than 5 minutes, let's say, 6, he gets pissed, looks around anxiously before noticing a couple of bar stools magically appear.  Happens every time.  And it happened again.

The food here is fantastic.  I hate to admit it, but it put a lot of Mexican restaurants in LA to shame.  The Pazole was seriously one of the best I've ever had.  I love that they give you free homemade corn tortillas to munch on instead of chips.  But, if you want chips?  They have that too.  Thick and perfectly fried.  The Empanadas were my least favorite.  The dough was a bit too thick and the pork filling was just not flavorful enough for me tho, The Man might disagree.  The tequilla flows like a river here.  Order what you will, it'll all be great.  I can't even describe the service because all the restaurants and bars in this city are ran by pros.  Truly amazing.
author: S K.

description:
One of my favorite "standbys" in SF. The table side guacamole can't be beat. Don't miss out on the tequila flights. 

I do not recommend the carnitas. The other entrees are much-much better.

You need a reservation on the weekends.
author: Joanna K.

description:
I've never believed that Mexican food should be fancy. I believed that the best Mexican food should be $1.50 tacos at a hole-in-the-wall.  

Colibri changed that belief.

Fresh guacamole made right there at your table.  Home made tortillas.  Best mole I've ever had.  Wowza.  Service is a bit slow, but you get there to relax.  Enjoy your time and savor each bite.
author: Lisa U.

description: Dinner with friends - excellent food, service and ambiance. Will go back again when I'm in SF!
author: Donna C.

description: So yummy. I had the chicken with Mexican black mushroom and my husband had the mole.  Both of us loved our meals.  Guacamole was super good too
author: Krista C.

description: No idea the bad reviews. Sometimes people get put off by a waiter, etc. but if you're coming here for AMAZING FOOD and drinks, this is the place!! We just had the most incredible meal. Made up of appetizers only. Fresh ingredients & awesome salsa to add. Def try it !
author: Lauren G.

description:
Went here a week ago with some friends from SF. I love going to the mission district to get Mexican food, and I really should have forced my friends to. The food here is very good, very high quality, but very overpriced. You don't get that same stuffed to the brim with cheesy goodness feeling you get when you go to the dirty dirty. Do yourself a favor and get in a cab and go to El Farolito -you won't be disappointed. 

This is the place you go with your stuffy aunt who is scared to go to the mission, but loves Mexican food, and is picking up the bill.

The salsa trio soft corn tortillas is awesome. The $14 for chips and guacamole crazy but it is a huge portion. But then I think $14 in the mission is my whole meal plus beer. 

I had the chicken mole and it was TASTY!! But it was small and came with only chicken, that's it, no sides!! WTF My friends had the salads -both which were very fresh.  

Overall the food quality is extremely high, but the service is super super super slowwwwwwwwwwwwww.  Pick up the pace guys! We are not in Mexico!

My favorite part: TEQUILA!! They have an incredible tequila list.
author: Elizabeth J.

description: Try chille riehenne its the best u cannot have it any other mexican restaurant --- its very good green chilly filled with cheese veges - not very filling but will still recommend
author: Mohsin H.

description: Amazing cerviche and queso with chorrizo!!  And margs and wine selection by the glass. A fun find!!
author: Anne R.

description:
Made-to-order guac is always a hit. Great drinks.  

For my money, weekend brunch is their best meal -- if you have a sweet tooth, then you can't miss their stuffed french toast.  It doesn't sound great, but it's unbelievably good -- I sometimes consider ordering two orders just for myself.  It's unique -- no other place serves a french toast like this one. It's a bit like a stuffed-churro french toast.  Yum!
author: David L.

description: This trendy spot is great for drinks, but not so good for dinner.  The food is just average and the portions so small that you need to order many apps and side dishes to make a decent meal, making it really expensive.
author: Diana D.

description: Overpriced upscale Mexican restaurant with mediocre food. The ambiance is nice and the decor pleasing.  Staff is friendly and the place is clean. It's a bland version of Mexican food with some American items to please all in a party: none of the salsa choices were very spicy, the carnitas were tender but not very flavorful and the steak salad was good with many flavors in one plate which I liked. We went on a Saturday at 9pm which must be after hours because the place was pretty empty, there were 3 tables seated.
author: Adriana M.

description: Really great restaurant in the city. Celebrated birthday here with my husband. Ramon was our server and he was great. Started with the table side guacamole very good (must have) and a pitcher of sangria. Our entree was a carnitas dish. Well let me just say it was a generous helping I could have shared my plate. We also had a side of nopalitos (cactus) very yummy. I was impressed overall with the ambiance and the staff it was a great birthday dinner.
author: Rose A.

description: Had a very positive experience here! The food was amazing, and came very quickly. The atmosphere was great and very inviting. Making a reservation was easy, and I really enjoyed my evening here! Will be returning :)
author: Sabina A.

description:
Nom nom ballers holler back at me and word to my mother. After I blasted the overstuffed burrito surplus in previous review, I sense a need to write a great Mexican restaurant. As the popular overstuffed burrito has origins in the taquerias of San Francisco, I am always on search for unique Mexican American flair when I come to San Francisco and I have not yet been disappointed with Colibri. Try to arrive early for dinner if you will require seating for large group. 

Interesting to read some of the negative reviews of this place. However overall as good as the ratings are there is somewhat consensus that the place is on the expensive end. Valid point however, read my first sentence again, this review is intended for ballers. When I roll through with my crew for nom nom nom we are ballers, understand and respect. Tequilla shot callers. 

Reliably amazing dish, mole poblano, the best dish I have had and I have had this several times without being disappointed. Chile Relleno, yes. Filet mignon very good with ancho chile and goat cheese. Guacamole is excellent. Sangria pitchers, delicious. 

I am not liberal with my five star reviews.  Me gusta Colibri.
author: James D.

description: Really good food. Great service. Not tex-mex but more true Mexican style food. A bit more spice/heat would be appreciated. We had a great time.
author: Mary T.

description:
Great food! 
we walked in without reservations on a pretty busy night but were able to score bar seating. The trio of salsa that they provide is a nice addition and was more than welcomed by two very hungry individuals. I opted for the fish of the day and I can't even tell you what kind of fish it was but it was delicious. It was a white fish for sure with a side of grilled seasonal vegetables with a little Mexican flair. Service was attentive and friendly and the atmosphere was light and lively but not too loud or crowded. I think it might be a great ' drinks only' spot as well because as we were leaving I noticed that the bar was getting pretty busy. If you can, make a reservation to ensure that you can get a seat.
author: Rhonda G.

description: Came here for brunch and bottomless mimosa and was not impressed. The selections were "meh" and the service was mediocre. Don't think I will be back
author: Vanessa Y.

description: Great Mexican dinner place near Union square.  Really enjoyed the drinks , guacamole and chile rellenos!  The churros at the end were great!!!
author: Sherry-Mike M.

description:
Delicious!!! 

Came here for a Saturday brunch. I started the meal with guacamole and hand-tossed corn tortillas. OUTSTANDING!!! (Don't bother ordering chips for the guac -- it's amazing with the tortillas it comes with by default.) Then on to chilaquiles verdes, which was delightfully tart and flavorful. Topped off with a bottomless mimosa, and what's not to love?

The service was friendly. the food delicious, and the atmosphere great. Highly recommend this place for a weekend brunch!
author: Courtney T.

description:
I don't think I will ever come back here.

Overpriced, although the food was decent. Service was below expectations. 

For instance, the guacamole on the menu stated that it can be made to be as spicy as we want it to be, and we asked them to completely max out on spiciness...We had a whole conversation with the waiter about how we wanted our mouths to burn.

When it arrived, it was completely mild; there actually wasn't even a hint of spiciness in the guacamole. The waiter looked surprised when we asked if this was made spicy, and said "Oh, you wanted spicy?" and then offered to give us hot sauce to pour into the guacamole. Um, what? I am not impressed with this place.
author: Amy D.

description: The food was mediocre in my opinion. The service was pretty good. I ordered the fish of the day and the stuffed pepper with carnitas. The Hawaiian fish was too salty and the Chile Relleno stuffed with Carnitas was pretty bland. In addition the place was pricey for the what it was.
author: Richie C.

description: The food was great!!! Service was perfect. I told my husband that I wanted to be waited on.... I got that! Thank you to the staff for making us have a perfect anniversary lunch!!
author: Andrea F.

description:
Really liked the food, and ordinarily may be a four star Mexican place, but the very high prices trimmed off a star.  

I agree with the reviews that the guacamole was very good, though they didn't make it at my table or ask how spicy I wanted it, and so it turned out a bit too mild.  We ordered the highly recommended Carnitas, but I found it to be a it dry and really needed the guacamole and black beans (also extra) to add flavor and make a soft taco.  We also had the scallops, which were very good, but also didn't quite merit the high cost or really stand out.   I was too full to order the mango creme brulee, but I'll be back for that as I'm still on a quest to find the best creme brulee in the city!

All in all, an above average Mexican place at above average prices.
author: Greg B.

description: My sister and I shared the carnitas they were tender and delicious. Also had the filet mignon as well, fabulous.
author: Mae C.

description:
I think this place has 4 star potential, but we came not so hungry and didn't get to try as much as we'd like on the menu. My bf and I shared:

-carnitas - solid, but was expecting a larger portion (their corn tortillas are SOO good, though)
-queso fundido dip - this was good but it got really oily and hard to eat as it cooled down. prob wouldn't get it again and would prefer to try their ceviche or guac for a dip
-churros for dessert - this was DEELISH. the churros were filled with caramel! can't get better than that

I'd like to come back to this place with a larger party to try some more dishes...
author: Erica L.

description:
Not your typical Mexican restaurant, Colibri sports high-end, authentic Latin cuisine.

With colorful decorations and a vibrant atmosphere, Colibri Mexican Bistro is a perfect escape from the throngs of Union Square after an afternoon of shopping or a great spot for a pre-theatre dinner.

Without exception, everything from the kitchen at Colibri is authentic and flavorful.  Complimentary housemade tortillas and a trio of great salsas kick off the dining experience.  They were so good, they disappeared almost immediately.  With bracing citrus acidity and a good amount of heat, the pescado ceviche ($16) perfectly marries Pacific cod with lime, green olives, jalapeño, onion, cilantro, tomato, avocado, and olive oil.  Although on the small side, the dark, rich mole poblano ($16) combines spices, chiles, nuts, and chocolate into a flavorful sauce served over moist and tasty chicken.  Marinated in fresh herbs, roasted garlic, oregano, and olive oil, the slightly vegetal quality of the nopales asados (grilled young cactus leaves, $8) was complemented by the earthy flavor of succulent portobello mushroom strips.

Colibri has a full bar with a super selection of high-end tequilas, so o course, different varieties of margaritas (most around $12) abound.  For those who are not agave lovers, copious options for cerveza and vino exist as well.  Service was friendly, attentive, and relaxed.  Staff ably fielded questions about the preparation of various menu items and the provenance of some of the more obscure tequilas. 

The decidedly upscale Mexican at Colibri comes with a  price.  But in this case, it is a price worth paying.
author: CJ G.

description:
I like the food at Colibri.  So why only three stars?  Well, I think for the price point it wouldn't kill them to put something on the plate other than the entree.  That's it.  You order carnitas, that's what you get.  You order the relleno, you get a relleno.  You have to order the rice and beans separate (although the side portion is large enough for 2 or 3 people to share) it just seems stingy not to provide it up front.  And it you order Guac, they serve it with corn tortillas, not chips, which makes it a little hard to dip (I know, you are supposed to scoop in this case, but to me Guac and CHIPS go together like bread and butter).  

The menu is different.  Don't come here expecting any cheese enchiladas, or crispy tacos...

Drinks are good.  Tequila selection is fantastic.  And it's right across the street from the theatre, so very convenient.
author: Lindy B.

description: Make reservations!! My parents and I went on a Saturday around 6:45 and it was quite crowded. We went without reservations and we sat on bar stools with a tiny table. We got the guacamole appetizer which was freshly made and amaaaazing and customizable spicy levels. The tortillas that came with that were soft and sweet. For entrees we got pechuga rellena de huitlacoche, chile relleno, and tortita de papas. The chicken in the pechuga rellena de huitlacoche was cooked very well and wasn't dry. The chile relleno wasn't nearly as spicy as expected. The tortita de papas was my favorite dish. The one thing all the dishes had in common was that they were quite small. They were filling for us since we had the guacamole as well but I feel like if you didn't have an appetizer it wouldn't have been enough. Service wise one of our waiters was very polite but the other two just dropped off food and left, not caring as much. Was it worth going once? Sure. Would I go a second time? Probably not, no.
author: Monsi M.

description:
Flavorful, upscale Mexican food, but a little overpriced.

LOOOVED the sopes. My pechuga rellena de huitlacoche (stuffed chicken breast with garlic sauce) was dry and simply unexciting. Bf's carnitas were a hit though. Torta de elote (cornbread) was okay.
author: Sophia B.

description:
Look, I get it, we live in SF.  Basically a tie with NYC for most expensive city in the US.  Everything is getting more expensive (insert a political rant and rave of your choosing about the economy).  But let's see here...this is literally all we ordered...

*2 Margarita $10-12+/Each (depending on tequila pref).
*Guacamole $12
Made fresh just tell us how spicy you would like it; served with fresh hand made corn      tortillas
Add chips $2
*Tamales Colibri  $12
Corn dough tamale assortment,  tomatillo sauce and poblano strips with cheese, 
guajillo sauce and chicken, axiote sauce and pork
*Then add in the Tax, Tip, SF Healthy Living Whatever, Finders Fee, Etc. and even this small meal is lame pricey.

Here's what gets me, Guacamole $12?  And you don't even get chips? $14 if you want both chips and guac.  Seriously? You have got to be kidding me. The guac was just "eh." And then $12 for tamales that honestly were not very good and literally had the smallest amount of meat ever of all time forever.  I remember back in my day when you could get this entire meal for $0.50 (not true, I'm not that old, but still).

Ok, switching gears to being positive. The margarita were solid. And both the hostess and server were nice and did a great job. So thumbs up for that.

Parting thoughts...step it up Colibri.  And yes, again, I get it, we live in SF, but still, the pricing should be adjusted in my opinion.  I'll be hitting up Tacolicious next time.  Sorry.
author: John R.

description:
Stopped in with a group of 6, able to get a table (made reservations an hour before we got there). Cool place, nice atmosphere. Server was okay, didn't speak great English and didn't seem to know the menu all that well or give great suggestions
Food: 
Guacamole: decent amount, good - ordered mild and it was good. Came with tortillas and we had to order chips separately, which was annoying. Just not as good with tortillas. Chips were good. Woulda liked a little more lime in it, but that's typical for me.
Pechuga rellena de huitlacoche: really enjoyed this, well cooked and quite flavorful - all the components mixing together well.
Camarones en mole de tamarindo: I didn't try the shrimp, but the sauce and corn cake were both great. My friend really enjoyed the dish
Carnitas: I helped my friend to finish this one, well cooked and really flavorful.
Strawberry margarita: very tasty, but not that strong.
