description: Loved the restaurant!  Great service!  Recommend the guac (great with the freshly made tortillas it comes with) and the fish taco app was great. Also got the Chile relleno, but would probably try something else next time - it was okay but not as great as everything else we ordered!
author: Janna E.

description: Great drinks, good guacamole, but the bartender, Luis, on Vday was HORRID!  Rude, condescending and overall bad! Big mistake, my husband was in a great mood and is a BIG tipper!
author: Leah G.

description: Soo good! They give you warm to tortillas with three different salsas at table. Service was so good!
author: Robyn P.

description: Food is excellent. Pretty pricy for a full meal, but great for a few beers and tacos if you split
author: Jonathan M.

description: Excellent find. While it is a bit pricey, the food is delicious! I recommend: the mango salsa, the bacon jalapeño cornbread, and the Caballaros Pobres postre! Good service. I will go back when I'm in the theatre district.
author: Kellie R.

description: It was packed when I got there at almost 9pm on a thurs but I was able to get reservations with no issues. Staff was really nice. Started with the guacamole. Didn't get spicy but wish I had. It was really good and fresh. Up there with some of the best guac I've had. The salsas came in a set of 3. All good but not spicy for people like me who live spice. Had the most interesting and more popular items on the menu. Chilli relleno with carnitas and chicaron. It was good but wished the chicaron was crunchy. Still pretty good though. We also got the ceviche with fish. It was so fresh and worth ordering. The chips just were how I like it, thick and crunchy. Def best place in the u sq area. My cousin ordered carnitas but it seemed kinda dry. This place is pricier than most mex places. It's definitely mexican in a more upscale way. Next time I wanna try the huge selection of tequilas!
author: Bryant L.

description:
Colibri's is actually a pretty cool place to be.
They have lots of eye candy in the form of uniquely shaped bottles of tequila lining their walls.
Their service is excellent (IF you make a reservation and go EARLY and by early I mean eating dinner at 4pm).  
Their food is good but not justified by the hefty pricetag.
HOWEVER  their dessert is to die for!  I was literally moaning with every bite of my crepas con cajeta (crepes with caramel).  I don't think I've ever had such a good dessert.  If  I could eat this every day I most certainly would ......except for the fact that for the portion size is quite small given the high price.
Would I come here again?  Yes.  But only if they lowered their prices to match the quality of the food.  

Bottom line: Go here if you can afford to spend  forty bucks for a bowl of soup and a desert.
author: Sharon P.

description: Great service but bland, boring food. worst place to take someone for their birthday.
author: Melissa B.

description:
Five of us had dinner at Colibri tonight before attending a play across the street at ACT. 

The meal was delicious. I had the Camarones en Mole de Tamarindo. Yum!! The chile relleno ordered by someone else in our party was also amazing. Wonderful tortillas, too, with an interesting array of sauces. 

I dine out a lot, chiefly in the North Bay/Sonoma County, and I can't remember EVER having better service! 

We will definitely be back.
author: Kathy J.

description:
I was first told about this restaurant by my sister years ago, she had high praises, so I checked it out. The first few times I went I was very impressed with this Mexican restaurant because of the subtle twists to traditional Mexican flavors. I tried Huitlacoche(Mexican caviar) for the first time in my life and loved it, was stuffed in a chicken breast with a poblano sauce. I really don't care for chicken but those additions changes my opinion about boring chicken.  I also enjoy the mole verde with duck, a change from the usual chicken that accompanies mole. The duck fat really enhances the mole sauce. 
I have since been back, and all of this time prior to my last visit I highly recommended Colibri.  My opinion has drastically changed. The flavors are still there but what happened to the portion sizes?? Entrée's now are the size of appetizers, entrée sizes in the past weren't huge but adequate. I won't be back or recommend Colibri, until I can no longer say "where's the beef" about portions.
author: Joe Buck s.

description: horrible, snotty service. Overpriced Mexican at its worst.
author: Jess C.

description: We waited at the front for the hostesses for about 5 minutes and when she finally decided to greet us she gave us attitude and asked if we had reservations.  We didn't but she accommodated us after we promised to eat in less than an hour, even though there were plenty of open tables when we arrived and when we departed? Overall the staff was snobby and made us feel like we were an inconvenience, maybe it was the small child in our party.  I have to say the food was pretty good, but we won't be going back due to the staff.
author: Donald J.

description: This was one of our most enjoyable surprises in SF. Great location, killer margaritas, tasty food, good service and a great crowd. That pretty much sums up our experience at Colibri!
author: Ermelinda C.

description: Amazing restaurant!  Great find in the city of fantastic food and drinks.  Save room for the churros!
author: Melissa J.

description:
I am in love with their guacamole. Trust me. I'm Mexican and I know good guacamole. 

Colibri is located right downtown but once inside you'll easily forget about the hustle and bustle around you. 

On the weekends they have bottomless mimosas. Need I say more?
author: Jasmine M.

description: Amazing meal. The duck breast is a new favorite! Highly recommend!
author: Blaine B.

description: This place has a great atmosphere, friendly staff and exceptional Carnitas! If your in San Fran stop by have the spicy guacamole, a house Marg and the CARNITAS! So delicious you will be back.
author: Han Z.

description: Love the guacamole, the churros con cajeta and the hand made tortillas, all the food is delicious and good service!!!!
author: Carolina G.

description:
350 tequilas behind the bar!  I didn't try any but I was impressed.

Great Mexican food and recommended by me!  The service was very good too.
author: Peter Y.

description:
I have wanted to try this place for awhile, but randomly happened upon it one evening.  We had just gone to see In the Heights and it was still open for food after the show, so we ended up here.  Such a great call.  I had a delicious meal!

The restaurant looks small from the outside, but it's actually pretty spacious.  There is a cool looking bar with tons of varieties of tequilla in the front and then there is seating next to the bar as well as in the back.  The decor was cool and the servers were nice.  I would have liked to come to eat earlier in the evening to see if there is a difference in the crowd/atmosphere.  However, the group I was with needed no other tables but our own to have a great time.

We started off with a variety of apps, we tried both the fish and prawn ceviche.  One word: DELICIOUS.  I had not had prawn ceviche before, but it was so tasty.  The citrus flavor was awesome and the texture was great.  I would totally have that again.  We also got the queso with chorizo.  Also tasty, but very rich, so if you are not super hungry you might want to skip as an app, because it's pretty filling.  We also had the quacamole--it was good, but didnt really stand out compared to the other dishes we had.

For my main dish I had the relleno, which wasn't bad, but I was pretty full already from the appetizers.  Although I was ful, I still managed to squeeze in dessert--churros with dulce de leche and ice cream.  Umm what?  Yep, it was as good as it sounds.

It's a great option if you are going to the theater at the Curran--it's literally across the street.  We closed the place down the night we went, and I would happily do it again.
author: Lu E.

description:
You need to make a reservation for sure.
Their guacamole and margaritas are super good.
author: Arum K.

description:
I was excited to try this place as several of my friends like it and made reservations for us all to go before a play at ACT. I was especially excited  after the hype from my sis-in-law (see novel..aka "review" from Alita M).

Per her review, she had a great bartender (Adrian), and being the social-butterfly yelper i am, I promptly located him. He made some great reccos for my friends who opted for the Tequila flights. He even let us work some substitutions. He really is in tune with his customers. I stuck with a house margarita which was quite tasty. One thing I also loved about him was that he was FAST! So refreshing after patronizing a slew of trendy spots with fancy drinks (see Alembic). I brought up yelp somehow in conversation and he mentioned how how had just checked the site and gotten a good review. He seemed really excited about that! So here ya go, dude, another one! You rocked it.

Naturally I made the suggestion that we should try those jalapeno margarita's mentioned that he made special. He was happy to oblige and we joined him at the bar for the show. Setting drinks on fire sure is cool, but the general concensus was that the drink was more gimmicky than drinkable. I appreciated the effort tho.

After this we took our seats. I sat on the wrong side of the table (the side that got the plates last, damn!) so I only had a tiny bit of food, but it meant I was able to try everything! The Queso Fundido was amazing, as was the Filet Mignon. Second runners up were the Mole and the Cauliflower. People were pushing the corn bread, but it was too dry for me and way too covered in the sauce. 

For dessert we seriously tried them all but everyone raved about the Churros being the best they'd ever had.
author: Nikki M.

description: Fellow yelpers you've really let me down on this one.  If this were a cheap little bistro I would maybe go with a 2, but it was SO expensive for lunch.  First of all, it's slow.  There were servers and bartenders everywhere doing nothing; only one girl was serving all 8 tables.  The Bloody Mary was the worst one I've ever had.  It tasted like rotten tomato water and was poured from a disgusting tub behind the bar.  12 chips and an inch of guacamole cost $14.  And both were not so great.  Lunches are $12-$15 with no sides.  I had to order rice in addition to my entree.  I got the cheese enchiladas.  Horrific is the best term.  It was a corn tortilla wrapped around cold cheese put on a plate and covered with cold sauce and cold cheese.  The meal was cold and the cheese wasn't melted.  Plus the green sauce was okay, but the red was terrible.  I could only eat the half with green sauce.  I didn't come close to finishing my meal or drink and they cleared our table without even asking how it was.  Big scam in an area with a lot of hotels.  Do not go here unless what I described is something you're into.
author: Courtney B.

description: We wanted to stay in the 'hood for Mother's day, my son and I. We didn't even get a chance to experience the food because the hostess was so unpleasant and perturbed when I asked not to be seated at the door practically. We turned around and left. She's obviously either the owner's kid or burned out, either way she needs a new vocation.
author: Mira L.

description:
i just tried this place again after a couple years respite and I ma just not that big of a fan. The food is decent but it is expensive and you can get better and cheaper mexican food all over the city. The guac is fine but a bit salty. The only input you can give is on spicyness level ...

i dunno it is pretty good and it is really convenient if you are going to a play (or staying at Hotel Diva) but I don't see much reason to return
author: Jess O.

description:
Great combination of intimate atmosphere with friendly attentive service. Both the servers and the bussers were great, cover for eachother so that nothing went unattended for an unreasonable amount of time. The margarita selection was good, and the menu selection was ideal for my fiance and I. We specifically were out on an adventure to see what we could find, and the unique items were a pleasant surprise. Both the appetizers we got, as well as both of our dishes were very tasty and well prepared.

However, I don't know that we would go out of our way to visit this place again, as there's just soo many options for good food in the city. It was definitely better than a 3 star rating, not quite good enough for a 5 star.
author: Mark D.

description: Went for lunch on a couple of recommendations and were still pleasantly surprised at how good the food was. We went with our daughters, 8 and 11, and were not offered a kids' menu but we didn't ask for one either. Ordered a selection to try, including the torta, carnitas, and sopes. The carnitas were good but not exceptional. The torta was amazing as were the pork sopes. I would recommend getting all 3 sopes pork instead of the variety that comes standard.  We also ordered the fresh guacamole, which was very good and a large portion. The prices are definitely not cheap but we were not disappointed at all. We would definitely come back! And don't forget the churros! You can add them on to an entree for $5 and they were incredible! 4 nice size pieces of churro and a large scoop of ice cream with caramel in it. We couldn't get over how good they were...
author: James H.

description:
colibri kind of has that cheesecake factory vibe...but in a good way.  brunch seating on a weekend is a breeze (huge plus for me) and they have bottomless mimosas (another plus!).  the food is pretty good but the complimentary tortillas are homemade and warm and oh so delicious!  i also like the salsas that come with them.

a great option in the union square area.
author: Christy C.

description:
I kinda prefer the Mexican cantina type Mexican restaurants, or taquerias, but for a night out in SF, this place is kewl and classy. 

We arrived and the place was packed! There was 6 of us and we had reservations, and we were immediately seated upon arrival. 

For drinks, I ordered the Sangria, which was way too sweet for my taste. 

For aps, we ordered the guacamole, and ceviche. Both were EXCELLENT. Yes it came with dipping sauces, I think our waiter referred to them as mild, medium, and spicy. I like medium and spicy! 

All of us ordered different dishes and we pretty much shared with each other except for my dish, which was the Fillet Mi non. Unfortunately, the fillet was very petite and hardly shareable. On a good note, the flavors of all of the dishes were excellent. 

The service was friendly and very attentive. 

Bottom line, There are soo many options in this area, but if I'm craving Mexican flavors in the Union Square area, then this is the place!
author: Eric D.

description: This place wasn't bad but it wasn't that good. Family was in town staying in Union Square and wanted to stay around the area. This place is a classic Union Square tourist location. Not bad food and pretty damn good drinks but WAY overpriced. I got the Carnitas and was very disappointed - dry and under-seasoned. Honestly, my entree was the worst thing all night and of course was around $22 for a small portion of dry carnitas. The staff was incredibly nice and the restaurant has a good vibe. The bar is classically beautiful. Would highly recommend the happy hour, good deals on drinks and good food. This is the kind of place you should go enjoy some drinks and appetizers; you won't spend too much and you'll leave happy (the appetizers and drinks are the best part - none of my party of 4 were very impressed by their entrees but apps and drinks are really good).
author: Andrew M.

description: I had a mid-afternoon dinner there on a weekend with friends and kids. The place was nice with great Mexican paintings and upscale food. They had handmade tortillas and really good salsas, and our meals were really flavorful. My only complaint was the noise and service. I didn't get a refill once on my water and we had to ask several times for more tortillas because we had a large table. It's not really a kids kind of place, but they loved the tortillas. One other thing was the hostess sort of balked because we had no reservation, but there was plenty of room. She said we could have a table if we ate in an hour and when we left the place was almost empty. She could have been friendlier and more accommodating considering the huge party.
author: Joan B.

description:
Colibri is excellent! I had the pleasure to eat here last night for the first time and I really it. 
So a friend had been raving about this restaurant and he decided to take me so I our meal was entirely based off of his recommendations.

They have a huge selection of tequila's, I believe over 300 to choose from! A really great drink menu. We ordered a pitcher of yummy sangria made with pieces of mango..

So on to the food!
We ordered a few dishes to share and we started off with fresh guacamole (which the waiter makes right at your table) accompanied by freshly made tortillas and three different types of salsa. By the way..the mango salsa is delicious so try it.
We also ordered Tostadas de Tinga which were amazing. They are mini tortillas topped with chicken, avocado and some type of chipotle sauce. 
Then we had Ceviche made with fish which was also very good. Flavor wise, I did feel as though it was missing something but it was still very good. I just really really love ceviche.
So last but not least we had the Mole Poblano, a mole sauce served over chicken. I think that's pretty self explanatory. Yum!

The place has a great atmosphere, nice decor and beautiful bar. There is also a really great mix of people and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves and the food. I definitely recommend this restaurant and I am sure I will be back to try more.
author: Denise S.

description: What. a. Disappointment.  Came in due to the 4 stars rating, never again.  El Torito is not as bad since you know what you're getting there which is far from authentic, like this place.  Guacamole was BLAND, no spice, no tanginess, almost no flavor.  Tortillas were cold enough that they would break.  Queso fundido was only saving grace, and the Tinga was nothing to brag about.  Couple next to us was making same coming comments, I know I have high expectations of Mexican food therefore it is truly sad when I find anglicized versions of amazing dishes no one should cut corners on.  Staff was only so so, when they hear you speak Spanish they give you the stink eye.  Maybe they already know what natives think about this place.  Those piñatas are suspiciously not you typical Mexican design... More modern, less artsy?  I'm over this place.
author: Tanya G.

description: Excellent. We were in town for two days and went there twice. We sat next to the same couple on both days; they also went there twice because it was so good. I'm going to crave it when I go home. Colibri, please open a Restaurant in San Diego!
author: Nathan M.

description: Nice atmosphere (a great departure from my usual Mission Street digs). The complimentary fresh tortilla with the trio of dipping sauces is good. Tortita de Papas was delicious! Mole was just okay.
author: Anne Y.

description:
This restaurant is about as good as it gets, and, as a result it is usually jammed with customers and reservations are highly recommended. I

Went there with my Mom and Dad and had Sangria, guacamole, tostaditas, chile relleno pork, the pechuga huitlacoche and the papas gratin. 

Excellent food, excellent service; though a bit pricey for Mexican food, the only reason for getting four stars, but they definitely get my "four paws up"!

Tip: We used a $25.00 restaurant.com coupon which save us money!  

Not pet friendly as there is no outdoor area when we were there.
author: Finnegan M.

description: My wife and I have been to Colibri several times over the years, and we love it. The food is always exception, the ever-changing choices on their Tequila Tree are always top-notch, the atmosphere is wondering and there is always some wonderfully crappy black and white Mexican B-movie from the 1950s on the screens around the place.
author: Edward H.

description: It was not a "wow" experience. This place was so overpriced and the food was not fully seasoned! (They charge $12 for guacamole and another $2 for chips! That's not right!)
author: Amir Z.

description: Was disappointed with our meal. The servings are small so be sure to order sides if you are hungry. The service was also subpar. For the price of the meals, I would expect a lot more. I had the chile rellano stuffed with carnitas. It was good, but not extraordinary. We did, however, love the guacamole and house made tortilla's. We have also been here before for brunch and were amazed.  My recommendation is skip dinner and enjoy their fantastic brunch menu.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Oh no! I went to a TOURIST TRAP. I studiously avoid them, as there's nothing worse than paying too much for mediocre food, particularly in a city with as much wonderful food as San Francisco. It was the fault of restaurant.com -- and this ridiculous four star average on Yelp!

The moment I walked in, I could tell that something was off. White table clothes at a restaurant where the entrees average $15? Not to mention the cheesy empty alcohol bottle decoration/display, the bad lighting, etc.

Dedicated potato lovers, we ordered the papas al gratin. Unfortunately, it was quite bland and I couldn't not taste the chile cream. For my entree, I had a seared duck breast which I requested medium well...it came medium rare. Our server, who was friendly and attentive, corrected the issue once I complained, but even so, the dish just wasn't that great. And I think it came on a bed of what seemed to be frozen veggies. 

With a Union Square location, I should've known better.
author: Ada T.

description: Food and settings were good, the service so so: one of the waitress was not friendly but the other was.
author: Laurent C.

description: Great atmosphere, convenient location, and A-Mazing guacamole.  If it wasn't so hard to get a last min table, this would be a 5 star-er, but then I guess that's the inevitable catch 22.   If you can make resos in advance, its a good spot for groups given the fun atmosphere, but if nothing else, it always makes for a nice date night.  One of my favorite Mexican restaurants in San Francisco!
author: Nakissa G.

description: i always get drunk here i love their margaritas and their vegetarians sopes!! jfc i'm mexican and i approve of their food and service. the restrooms are ok and the waiter is always so attentive and nice and i keep ordering and ordering lmao you should really just go here for the appetizers and the margaritas :) the music is a tad bit loud the atmosphere is a tad bit loud also people feel the need to yell
author: Anu C.

description:
This is one of the few REAL Mexican food restaurants in the Bay Area. 

The best.
author: Tehari W.

description:
Dodge a homeless dewd and come in!

This place has killer food and the interior is a nice respite from the grit that can come out at night on that part of Geary.  

We ate here a few times during a trip here.  It was great every time.  I think we had everything on the menu between the 4 of us and our multiple trips.  It was great...everything.

The margaritas were super tasty.  Definitely get one or six.  The bar is also a good area to grab a rita made from one of the million tequilas they have there.  

Don't half step.  This would be a great start to an evening that wanted to start off "civilized".
author: Brendon D.

description:
I was distracted by the bizarre Mexican movie playing on the TV above the bar.  It was a horror movie, starring a Mexican wrestler - complete with leather head mask like Nacho Libre but no shirt.  Someone had hired him as a PI/bodyguard to recover some woman who was going to be sacrificed by some ancient cult.

The guacamole was amazingly good, the tortillas impressively fresh, the margaritas deliciously deceptively strong, the huevos rancheros tasty and generous.  I'm glad I found this place on yelp while people watching in Union Square.
author: Angela M.

description:
I ate here a few years ago, when I was staying in Union Square on a business trip. My last night in town, I dined alone at Colibri to celebrate a few successes.

Even though I was a solo diner, my server was very sweet and didn't treat me like I was wasting a table in her section. She strongly recommended the tortilla soup, which was excellent, although the portion was a bit large. I also had the guacamole, prepared tableside in a big stone mortar thingy. It was cool to watch the guy scoop out the flesh from the avocados and mash it up with everything else. I also had the chicken mole and the lamb shank. I love mole and always try to order it because it is so hard to get in Hawaii and I hate making it. Their mole was pretty good. The server was nice and got me extra sauce for the rice because she knew how much I liked it. The lamb shank was huge, but not super tasty. 

I also loved the sangria. Overall, I had a great experience here and I loved the atmosphere. Next time, I'm bringing a friend!
author: Olivia D.

description: great place. my margarita was fantastic- muddled jalapeño.  yummy.  bartenders were great and best of all....the Churros  save room. they are worth it.
author: Barb B.

description: Rude customer service!!! Called in to see if they could accommodate a party of 9 and was told no with an immediate hang up! Obviously whomever answered the phone didn't want any service at there restaurant.
author: Esther D.

description: I had a pretty tasty dinner at Colibri this evening.  I am vegan and had seen that "vegetarians love this place" but unfortunately the vegan options were fairly limited.  I did enjoy the delicious side dish of Mexican vegetables including corn, pasilla pepers and other tasty items.  The side of black beans came in a large bowl and was a little liquidy, but nicely spiced.  My dinner mate had an entree of chicken with mole - the mole was smoky and good.  The guacamole was very fresh and delicious.  The only reason I give three and not four stars is the lack of vegan entrees and variety.  The service was efficient and friendly, even in tight quarters that required waiting for people to push in their chairs to serve food!
author: Erica H.

description: Dinner was very good (especially loved the guacamole) and service was friendly and engaging.  The only downside was that food came out VERY slowly -- not sure if that was just because it was after 8 pm on a Saturday night, or if that's usual.  Our server was nice, but I was frustrated to wait so long for each part of the meal (long wait after ordering drinks and before ordering entrees, long wait for dessert and coffee to arrive).
author: Amy E.

description:
Randomly popped in here w/a friend before a show at the ACT and was pleasantly surprised. It was a little pricy and packed, but we managed to split a few snacks and drinks in less than an hour (note, we picked from the list of quick bites the bartender pointed out).

Guac came with fresh handmade tortillas and we also got a couple cups of salsa. LOVED this. It was like making mini guac tacos! Tamalitos Colibri were ok...really dense for tamales and the cheese was super hard...not my fave. Tostadas de Tinga - YOU MUST TRY THESE! Cute little tostadas topped with just the right amount of delicious stewed meat. AAAHH yum. I wish there were more than 3 per order (or maybe we should have each gotten an order haha)!
author: Karena Q.

description: A bit pricey for what you get, but a great selection and friendly staff. The guac was really good, and the trio of salsa's they give is a very nice touch to start the meal. Also, the margaritas were stellar :)
author: Michael M.

description: It ain't cheap, but at least you get something for your money here.  I had salad, chile relleno y flan, and all was excellent and beautifully displayed.   The salad and flan were served with flower petals, too.  The margaritas where excellent, with top-shelf (ok, maybe not TOP shelf) tequila and I liked that they were not overly sweet.   I won't hesitate to return next time I'm in town.
author: Richard F.

description: Expensive, relatively bland food. Food isn't bad, so I can't go below 3 stars, but the expense and the fact that it isn't much better than "not bad" prevents it from rising higher.
author: Bruins E.

description:
Horrible experience I never encountered!!! Will never return again!! Very disappointed with a level of service presented by it's management. We demand your apology for ruining our important dinner, since our precious time that was lost at your restaurant will never be recovered. We are still waiting for your word-- Joel or Evangeline, from both managers-

   We are at the restaurant for my best friend's birthday and after 1.5 hours after being seated, Evangeline, the manager on duty told us to leave our table due to she has another reservation. What!?

   We could not believe what we heard! So rude! We were still eating with plenty of main course on our plate, not yet to even ordered deserts. Is this a discrimination over certain clients w/specific ethnic background? We are very offended and she ruined
our first experience at the restaurant. 

I will surely share my worst experience here with everyone.. Our coworkers, friends&family, and of course online review such as Yelp. We are still very upset today.
author: N N.

description: Went here for my wife's birthday.  We got the guacamole, carnitas, cheese and chorizo.  Everything was very good, but I am just not used to paying so much for Mexican food.  The portions were not large which was fine, but should I have to pay more than I am used to for Mexican food for less Mexican food than I am used to quantity-wise?  Just doesn't add up.  My wife felt the same.  Good location (downtown SF), but wouldn't go back.
author: Joe L.

description:
Not your typical mexican restaurant. It is right in the theatre district so you can certainly go there when you're downtown for a show. The place has a great atmosphere and the old latin movies shown above the bar are an interesting visual addition if you sit at the bar or near the bar area.

You should definitely reserve a table as it is quite busy and the food is testament as to why there is SRO to get in. We were there for an anniversary dinner.   

If you like appetizers of chips and guac, then I definitely recommend it. I thought it was great that we were asked if we wanted our handmade (tableside) guacamole spicy - it is nice to know that they don't think everyone wants bland guacamole. The margaritas - good enough to just have one if you're a light drinker (it isn't all sweet/sour mix!).

For the main course I had Callos con Crust de Tortilla - which is perfectly cooked large scallops, served over purple fingerling mashed potatoes and sautéed poblano pepper, cactus leaves,corn and portobello mushroom. Loved it! If I hadn't filled up on chips and guacamole, I might have been disappointed that ther were only 3 large scallops. So keep that in mind if you have a large or small appetite.

My husband had the Camarones en Mole de Tamarindo - sautéed prawns in tamarind mole served with a corn cake. The mole sauce was quite good and the corn cake made an interesting flavor combination that was really quite delicious. Get this is you like a good mole sauce.
author: Carol T.

description:
I Was in town for a friends wedding, a friend had recommended this establishment. 
 
I live in LA and am accustomed to good mexican cuisine, and I have to say this was one of the best experiences I have ever had. The chile relleno is exquisite. Light, spicy, crisp. Great margaritas, guac, mole.
author: Garrett S.

description: This is downright amazing Mexican food. Whatever you think Mexican food means, just forget it and prepare yourself. If you are familiar with Mexican, you'll recognize everything on the menu but each dish from fish tacos to the duck, will arrive beautifully prepared, delicious, and utterly unique. I highly recommend the guacamole, the tortillas and salsa they bring to every table, and the chicken molé. Oh, and the desserts. The flour-less chocolate cake is unforgettable.
author: Daniel R.

description:
Not Mexican,,,, a white people place:{ not that white is bad, just not latino typical.
Very small expensive plates-

One example of their plates--- Not typical AT all.. what MEXICAN eats a Chile Relleno with carnitas?? Not typical, heard of, and not a very good combination.. I think this place tries toooo HARD.
not typical or traditional in real time MEXICO..
No thanks-
author: Alejandra M.

description: Pretty good food & desserts.  Fondly remember the guacamole! Maybe a little loud for my taste but definitely a good option for Mexican food in this area.
author: Stefan P.

description: Tequilla is excellent, but everything else is just okay. Don't try to call for reservations between 6-8 they will turn you away, but if you show up they will seat you. You will be rushed to eat and pay in the interest of being "efficient." That's not so much a problem since the portions are small! The guac is $10 and was substandard and the homemade tortillas are nothing special. Not sure why this place is rated so high other than it looks inviting inside and the location is great. The waitstaff are also really nice and good about explaining how the dishes and service works. All I got was cold chile relleno and a side of bland spanish rice. If you're looking for a pricey shot of tequilla this is your place, but if you want to dine to impress your date, there are plenty of other restaurants to choose from in the area.
author: Drew T.

description:
Went here for dinner on a Saturday night and it did not disappoint. The ambiance was nice, but nothing too special; the bottles of tequila in the window are a nice touch. Speaking of tequila, they have an incredible selection of authentic Mexican tequilas. The margaritas were strong and tasty, but a little overpriced. If I were to do it again, I would get shots with salt and lime rather than a margarita.

On to the food. We started with the guacamole, which they prepare at your table to the level of spice you ask for. It was delicious and fresh with perfect texture. They give you hot, fresh tortillas rather than chips, in addition to 3 homemade salsas that are excellent. I could have a whole meal of mini tortilla-salsa-guacamole sandwiches and be completely satisfied.

The tortilla soup was very good. They bring a bowl of avocado, cheese and tortilla strips and pour the soup over it on the table. Much better texture and taste than your average tortilla soup. I ordered the Mole Poblano and was mildly impressed. The sauce was interesting; it was a bit too chocolaty for my taste, but the texture and complexity were good. The chicken it was served with ranged from satisfactory to very tender; the tenderness of the  meat on the drumstick redeemed the dish for me. My date ordered the Chile Relleno, and I was blown away. The cheese and other fillings were delicious, and it was perfectly spicy; one of the best Mexican dishes I've ever had. The bill came to $100 with tip, but it was worth it for me; I'd never had gourmet Mexican food before, and the drinks and ambiance made for a very good dining experience (and some of the best guacamole I've ever had).
author: Geoff L.

description:
My friend bought a Groupon and took me with her to spend it. I lacked any benefits from this experience considering I didn't like it AND didn't have a groupon to use myself to make it ridiculously cheap. I give the 2 stars strictly for the fresh guacamole and the nice man that served us. Though the guac was delish, you had to pay $3 to get chips. I'm not saying that $3 breaks the bank, but its the principle. Seriously, even my hole in the wall dumpy mexican restaurant gives me free fresh chips. None of the food we had was good between the appetizer quesadillas, tamales, tortilla soup, and sangria. Judging by the other reviews, we should have tried some of the main entrees, but from what I did have, it tasted like bad americanized mexican food. Next time I want bad mexican food, I will go to Chevy's. At least it will be cheap. And most importantly, I will get free chips.

Wow, re-reading this I sound like a frugal old lady. Old, i am not. Unemployed with time and no money, yes, yes thats me.
author: Caitlin D.

description:
This place is really cute and funky. I loved the atmosphere at this place. Normally, I don't mind being seated so close to people, but this place was dimly lit and almost made it feel like even if you were on a romantic date that it wouldn't bother you. When you walk in, you're almost transported to a little place in Spain.

Of course, the hotel we stayed in was in walking distance of Colibri and you gotta love that. Even though it was a cold October evening, it was an enjoyable walk from the hotel to this  happening spot. 


The drinks were amazing and and they have a pretty nice variety of tapas, as well as bigger plates. Everyone that we were seated next to was friendly and it seems like a pretty popular spot for dates in San Francisco. I would most definitely go back. We've got a trip planned for Napa/San Francisco early next year and I hope to put this on my list of go to spots!
author: Danielle P.

description: Went here for weekend brunch with a large group (8 people). Colibri is great for group brunches because it's not too crowded and takes reservations. The food was pretty good across the board, and the bloody mary's were popular. We didn't have the $10 all-you-can-drink mimosa special but that seems like a great deal, especially for the neighborhood. The non-drink prices were high, though. The guacamole was tasty, but at $12 for a small bowl, plus $2 for chips (!) it's a bit steep.
author: David C.

description:
Don't see the point in joining Facebook and/or twitter? Well, if nothing else, you get some pretty rocking daily deals at Colibri- 1/2 price appetizers, tequila flights, etc. Definitely worth checking out the daily deal if you plan on eating here. (Or, hell, just ask your server what the daily twitter deal is- I don't think they'll make you prove you're a follower).

Another tip- restaurant.com gift certificate. $25 value for $10 and the minimum purchase is $35.

I've been to Colibri several times and I've consistently been pretty impressed. Excellent, carefully conceived and executed, high-end Mexican fare. The gratis, house-made tortillas are awesome. The fresh guacamole is killer. The entrees are all really good- the pato en pipian (duck in a delicious green mole sauce), filete mignon (accompanied by delicious mashed potatoes, one of the more filling entrees on the menu), and carnitas are personal favorites, but I have never been disappointed with anything I've tried here. Nice ambience, friendly servers, rockin' margaritas, extensive tequila options. For my money, one of the better restaurant values in the Union Square area (and some of the better high-end Mexican fare in San Francisco).
author: Brian H.

description: We do not recommend this place and will not be going back.  This place is soooo overpriced. The food is mediocre and the margaritas were so-so. We ordered the guacamole and it was good, but extra corn tortillas were $10!!  You have GOT TO BE KIDDING ME!!!  We are from Texas so we know good Mexican food and don't mind paying for good Mexican food.  If this place charged 1/2 as much as they do, I still don't know if I would go back.  Spend your money elsewhere.
author: Matt B.

description:
Oh. My. Heavens.

Let's start with the tequila, shall we? Loads and loads of artisanal, often expensive tequilas. Every one of them a treasure across your tongue. Good-sized shots are served in a fine champagne flute so you can truly appreciate all these tequilas have to offer.

If you're lucky, you'll be there one of the nights when Jared is bartending. This dude knows his stuff, and will deliver up exactly what you want. I told him I wanted something a little malty, a little sweet, and the tequila he served me blew me away.

I also had the guacamole (very amply portioned) with their amazing homemade tortillas and three kinds of sauce. The dark red sauce was awe-inspiring.

Alongside, we had the Queso Fundo, hearty chunks of chorizo enrobed in loads of tasty chewy cheese, floating in a puddle of spicy love. I could marry it. Jared recommended a side of the chipotle sour cream, which elevated him to Ghod status in our eyes :)

The place was full, and more kept arriving, yet the hostess seemed to seamlessly keep people moving along in a way that didn't seem at all invasive. 

I'll go again and again and again, and suggest you do as well. Join me! :)
author: SisterMable S.

description: Seems like everyone raves about this place.... The food is delicious and reasonably priced. The atmosphere is very nice, contemporary Mexican is the center of the City.... But.... the Margaritas we received were WEAK at best and just plain bland and they also charge $11 for a Margarita!!!! WTF? and a weak one at that (minus 1 star)... The next day 2 in our party had Montezuma's Revenge like you would not believe! They ate the same thing... a dish with pork in it....2 others in our party had no ill effects as one had a chicken dish and the other had a plain quesadilla (sp)..... The strange thing is that everyone thought their meal was delicious! So that is minus 2 stars.... Beware of the pork dishes I guess 'cause it sucks being in China Town trying to find a place to go do your business when you are about to explode out the back end!!!
author: Andy S.

description: Amazing margaritas!!!! The biggest tequila selection I've ever seen in California! Average food however. The handmade tortillas and salsas were great (and complimentary). The carnitas were good but the salsa accompanying the dish is a must. The shrimp mole was smoky and flavorful. Definitely want to go there again and explore more of the menu
author: Jillian I.

description: Very good margaritas, solid ceviche and interesting menu items.  Good quasi-upscale Mexican spot in central location
author: Arvindh K.

description: A M A Z I N G. the only con was table proximinity.. but in the city, you will have that! delish food + delish margs. must order tableside guac!
author: Z Z.

description:
This place is really good!

Fantastic service. Very attentive but not annoyingly so. Nice relaxed atmosphere. Delicious guacamole and arroz a la tumblada. 

It's not your standard burrito joint restaurant - there's a lot of mole dishes on the menu (as in the Mexican sauce rather than the subterranean-dwelling mammal), and other rather more unusual fayre. But it feels very authentic. And it tastes great!
author: Jonny P.

description: Food was delicious but OVER priced for the petite amount you get. If you're looking for a meal that doesn't look like a starter, this in not your place.  The waiter was not friendly or personable at all and the server had our table feeling rushed as he was cleaning up our plates before we were done eating. For a good looking decor restaurant , I expected the restrooms to match, but they were old and dirty. Not worth the price.
author: Susana Q.

description: Last minute decision thanks to Yelp. We were craving Mexican food before leaving town. This place hit the spot. It's much more upscale Mexican as compared to my hometown but it was very good. Table side guacamole was very good! They came with homemade tortillas (street taco size).  I had the fish tacos with a pineapple salsa.  Prices are a bit steep but I thought it was delicious. Wish we had more time to spend here.  They had a very extensive margarita menu. Will definitely be back next time I'm in Union Square.
author: Bethany D.

description:
We came across this bistro after discovering that nearby Katana-ya was off-the-hook (and out-the-door) busy.  In the mood for unagi and ramen, the thought of some spicy Mexican didn't seem too bad of a change, though, so we sought some refuge at Colibri.

Service was good and the hubs loved his carnitas with the sauteed veggies.  The special (carnitas chile relleno was a little bland) so if you're used to the typical fried-goodness of a more traditional relleno, then you might not like it.  Pricing was reasonable and the space itself is warm and welcoming.  Next time I will be back for the camarones!
author: Chris G.

description: Right down the street from one of my favorite places La Scene Cafe and Bar.  This place gets packed bar area is very nice lots of great booze.  Bartenders were great and poured excellent drinks got totally ripped.  had some apps at the bar food was kinda meh for me but my friends really liked it.  For the price $$$ I would go to the mission for some kick ass food instead.  Overall ok if your stuck in the union square area and no where else to go
author: Shirley W.

description: Great food, decent service on the pricier side.
author: Omar C.

description:
Was here for a friend's birthday. We were a decent sized group, and had a reservation for the evening. They have a pretty interesting rule wherein a quorum of your party must be present before they seat you. 

Food was really quite good. Everyone was happy. The guacomole was amazing. That is definitely a must get whenever you visit.
author: Gurpreet S.

description: the guac and homemade tortillas are out of the world. recommend tamales and carnitas omelet--service was attentive and great. Highly recommend
author: Kerry K.

description:
JoJo had lunch here on his most recent trip to the west coast. It was probably one of the best meals he had on this trip, although that isn't saying much. The San Francisco food scene was pretty disappointing!

Anyway, Colibri's service was adequate, the food was good, the decor ambience was pretty good (despite the Three Stooges movie playing on the flat screen above the bar). Highlights included the custom-made guacamole served with fresh corn tortillas rather than tortilla chips. Why don't more places do this!?! The enchiladas divorciadas were also quite good and deceptively filling. 

The place was fairly pricey, but JoJo would go back if he lived nearby.
author: Joseph B.

description:
This was our first stop as we started our weekend in SF and by accident because it was the only place that could accommodate a large party (of 8). We started with 2 pitchers of Sangrias, which was actually pretty good, MUCH smaller than expected, but we ordered another 2 pitchers anyway. I ordered the Pechuga Ranchera (chicken breast with spinach garlic mashed potatoes, smothered over a chili cream sauce) I thought the dish was decent, the chicken was kinda tough (although it was chicken breast, expected) the sauce was not too creamy, and the spinach garlic mash was good, except the bites of garlic chunks made it somewhat bitter. The tortilla and dipping sauces were really good, but no chips and salsa?? weird.

Overall it was good, not great. 
Docked one star for the price, greatly overpriced. docked another star for the hella dirty cup..i mean really dirty! left over pulp and lipstick stains, yuck!
author: Tina P.

description: very good food. their salsas are excellent as always. I had an appetizer with chorizo and cheese. I didnt like it much as it was mostly cheese but I loved my fiancees soup
author: Jay K.

description: The food may be good, but just to give you a peek into the type of service you'll be getting, when you first walk in you'll notice the host stand faces away from the door and so does your host.  No, they won't help you or inform you of anything about their food or restaurant.  Sad part is it isn't because they're cocky, they're just flat out incompetent.
author: Biqi C.

description:
The challenge with Colibri is that we are surrounded in San Francisco by high quality Mexican fare at very reasonable prices.  So, you had better have serious game if you want to position yourself as high end Mexican.  And, unfortunately, Colibri does not deliver.  Why?  The dining space is cut into a forward cramped section and a back desolate section.  The forward section schizophrenically cannot decide whether it should be a bar or a dining space.  After returning a syrupy mojito, we received a prawn ceciche that was passable, but fundamentally lacked the freshness and acid that great ceviche requires.  Also odd was that rather than using whole prawns, they chopped them up.  Not sure why. My carnitas was a bit overcooked and lacked the juice and flavor I could get a few miles away for a fraction of the price.

But the worst thing about Colibri was the sound system.  Apparently, they could not get radio reception so the music would degenerate into a loud buzz randomly.  Strangely, the initial response was to turn up the volume.  If I want to hear random static while I eat, I can bust out my AM radio and a bowl of cheerios at home, for free.

Wont be back to this one.
author: Anup D.

description:
My BFF and I went to see a show at the Curran a couple weeks ago and I called here last minute to get a reservation. Luckily, they had one available and it was right at the time we wanted. Pretty awesome.

Ran into a ton of traffic on the way, but they were kind enough to push our reservation back half an hour to accommodate us.  When we got there, it was PACKED but we were still promptly seated.

Started out with some cocktails. I had the Ginger Spice and my friend got some sort of Mezcal cocktail.  Both were really good, but I especially liked the ginger kick in the one I got. They first served us some pretty delicious corn tortillas and a trio of salsas, which we quickly devoured because we were both kinda starving.  We ordered the carne asana empanadas as an appetizer (I think it was one of the specials that day) and it was served over this sauce that I think was avocado-based. They were really good, tender beef and a substantial pastry that wasn't too heavy or too thin.  I forgot what dish my friend ordered because I was or pretty enamoured with the mole poblano that I ordered.  When I've ordered a mole with chicken at other restaurants, it was typically served with breast meat and usually is kind of dry.  Here, it is served with some rather juicy bone-in chicken and was preeeeeetty satisfying with a side order of their rice.

I wanted to get dessert, but we were running out of time before our show started (War Horse, so good!!!!) so the server got us our check right in the nick of time for us to be able to head across the street, instagram a bunch of pictures, and have time to settle into our seats at the theater.

While not super engaging, the service here was very nice and efficient and the food and drinks were pretty awesome.  Definitely recommend this place whether or not you are going to see a play or musical across the street!
author: Jerome R.

description:
Fancier Mexican food. There were sauces (regular salsa, green, and mango). It also comes out with tortillas. The meat dishes were about $18 (Filet Mignon and Lamb shank). The veggie dishes were a little cheaper. There's a appetizer menu and then there's the salads, entrees and sides. Pretty standard. The margaritas were about $10 and up. There are a lot of tequillas available, but we did not choose any of them. A little pricey. So not sure what the dishes are supposed to be like, but the menu says tapas, but the entrees that come out in varying sizes. 

Anyway, the restaurant was busy and we had reservations, so we had a table for 10 ready for us. I could have used some more water refills though.
author: Andrew Y.

description: I was here a couple years ago and it was excellent back then. Now it is still pretty good but the place has lost something. The food is very good but the service was lacking. Still a nice place to drop in to and spend some time...if your have a bit of it.
author: John M.

description:
I went here with a large group with a reservation and things went pretty smoothly. Drinks and food came out promptly, and the service was attentive. I got the house margarita and was happy with it. For my main course, I had shrimp with a polenta cake. The shrimp were not overcooked, and the cake was excellent. Not too pasty or dry. The amount of food was very modest, but well prepared. 

This is not the place you go to get blitzed in a bathtub sized margarita made of cheap tequila and splenda sweetened mixer. Everything on the menu is pricy ($10+ for margaritas, $25 and up for main courses when you add in rice or other sides) but it's nice to go fancy once in a while.
author: Arun C.

description: I have had lunch numerous times at Colibri and it always is perfect both in service and food, but yesterday was the best.  I ordered the Pescado del Dia which was Hawaiian Walu (with mushrooms and a little cream) - It melted in my mouth and was unbelievably delicious.  I highly recommend that they have this on their menu more often.  I also enjoy their fresh tortillas and salsa.  My only complaint during our last visit was that it was a bit chilly where we first sat, but the waiter was very kind and immediately moved us to a comfortable spot.
author: Nancy M.

description: Food is fine but the service is awful here! The waiter is rude, they don't welcome you, then don't have patience, and they don't even ask if you have any questions about the menu. The waiters working here deserve no stars!!! Will not go to this place again since I can find a handful of good MEXICAN food around!!!
author: Z L.

description:
'sexy Ladies night out' on a Friday evening

- After looking for about an hour for a place that would take 7 ladies for a Friday evening dinner, I finally was ablet o find a late dinner reservation at Colibri Mexican Bistro

The place is charming, and a lot bigger inside compared to what you would think when walking by outside (in the heart of Union Square area)

Grabbed many a drinks, the Queso and Guacamole to start us off. The drinks were VERY STRONG. 
 I got the Pink Bull Rush, which was tasty but a bit too sweet for my liking, and VERY strong. The sangria was quite tasty (i think I'll go with that if I go there again). The margaritas and caipirinha were also very strong.

APPS:
- Guacamole: delicious, made at the table but definitely NOT ENOUGH for the amt paid
- Queso with mushrooms (left out the chorizos bc we had a vegetarian at the table): Pretty legit, however it was hard to eat because the cheese was melted a lot
**I found it odd that they only gave tortillas, and when we asked for chips for dipping, they charged us per bowl of chips so BEWARE!

Dinner:
- Callos con Crust de Tortilla: Scallops - pretty legit, nothing spectacular but they were pretty good and the perfect amount. There were three scallops, perfectly cooked and seared that came on top of green beans, a small dollop of mashed potatoes mixed with corn and other items.

Dessert: BEST PART OF THE ENTIRE DINNER
- Pudin de chocolate: Bowl of dense chocolate pudding (kind of like a pot de creme) that was amazing and I wanted a full bowl of it for myself
- Churros Rellenos: A friend of mine said I had to try this, and she was completely right. I didn't try the ice cream, but this was AMAZING, the churros were crispy and perfectly crusted with cinnamon sugar and caramel filling.
We devoured both of these dishes. Some others got the creme brulee and the crepe but I didn't try them because our desserts were so delicious.

Overall, service was great, and the lady was more than happy to split our checks between 7 cards and cash. Everything was fine, except that I didn't think the meal was worth $46 per person even after getting $25 off for a restaurant.com coupon.

I would potentially go back but just for drinks/dessert, I don't know if the food is worth the amount they charge. Overall we had a grand time and it was fun but from a food quality, it was ok.
author: Jung-Ah Y.

description:
Finally rediscovered Colibri after stumbling upon it months ago and neglecting to get a business card.

Colibri is normally busy, so prepare to wait a few minutes for the fresh, hot, handmade tortillas and selection of 3 sauces.  But that wait is worth it!  These flour tortillas are so soft and have somewhat of a corn texture to satisfy even those who hate flour tortillas.

We dined on the tortilla soup, cactus leaves side, and sopes trio.
The soup is poured fresh from the pot right at your table so your tortillas stay crunchy and your queso fresco stays, well, fresco.  It's a cream soup, rather than a broth and is the perfect price for those on a budget.

The cactus leaves side with portabello mushroom is tasty and well-seasoned (if not a bit heavy on the rosemary)

The sopes trio is a great sampler of carne asada, seasoned chicken, and vegetable (from their rellano)

And try their hibiscus agua fresca, yum!
I'll never lose track of Colibri again!
author: Karen L.

description:
First time here, I really liked this place. It was a busy Saturday night and we had reservations but actually got seated early which was nice. 
Started with the Queso Fondito - two kinds of cheese melted over chorizo and mushrooms, Excellent, very very rich though, it comes with fresh hand made corn tortillas that you can just eat by themselves because they are that good. 
Next it was the Camerones en Mole, unbelievable dish! Six big perfectly cooked prawns in the most complex tamarind mole sauce I've ever tasted. First bite layers of different flavors danced around, it's served with a sweet/savory corn muffin that is so delicate it falls apart and melts in you mouth immediately. Only complaint was this plate was lukewarm but it was so good I just ate it anyway. 
Then we had the Carnitas, tender chunks of pork served with a spicy sauce. I actually didn't use the sauce that came with it and put some of the mole from the prawns on it instead. Delicious 
Side dish was the Papas Au Gratin, thin slices of creamy potatoes layered with a very light chili cream sauce and then topped with the same gooey cheese as the Fondito. Could have used a touch of salt but otherwise very good. 
The food was excellent my only complaints would be that our waitress was scarce and I had a tough time flagging her down and the PRICES! Way over priced for what you get ,it's in Union Square and the prices are higher, but because what we did get was so delicious I still give it 4 stars.
author: Ang x.

description:
Jared makes possibly the best margarita I have ever had and gets five stars all by himself. The bartenders at Colibri are awesome, and I highly recommend sitting at the bar and taking their recommendations when it comes to tequila (and requesting the fresh squeezed version when ordering a margarita.)

The food is yummy and wonderfully executed. Don't go here if you are expecting giant burritos. 

Yum yum mezcal and new and different tequilas.
author: A K.

description:
Colibri has good food, but I was really surprised at the price tag.  I'm usually not one to whine about paying for good food, but WAAA.  The portions are ridiculously small (like tapas size), the average plate at our table of five was around $25, and to tell the truth, the food was not particularly interesting in any way, and his wasn't due to lack of courage on my party to try more exotic sounding items.  I guess what I'm trying to say is that when I pay $25 for three or four bites of food, I expect something more than stylish decor and an extensive wine list.  Colibri's food was not memorable, to put it kindly.  There wasn't anything wrong with the food per se, but I wouldn't call it delicious.  You know what I mean?

I really felt gypped after I finished dinner.  I almost went down the street to Katana-Ya to have dinner since I basically just had an outrageously expensive appetizer at Colibri.  There's way better authentic and delicious Mexican food for half the price with double or triple the portions in the Mission.  Will definitely not be coming back here.
author: Linh N.

description:
I am really impressed there is now a decent option for food in Union Square that's not a diner, part of the mall, or ridiculously overpriced.  There were 6 in our party so we got to sample quite a bit.

Sangria - good, not like the best ever, but it's a good glass when you need it.

Guacamole - yes absurd that you have to pay extra for the tortilla chips.  They serve it in this mondo size bowl that is not super deep.  Comes with tortillas and salsa which the guy said we could make mini tacos.  Um veggie ones?  

The table had lamb, bacon wrapped shrimp, cheese/mushroom fondue mix (an app), chicken tamales, and carnitas.  There were no leftovers - enough said!

Dessert- mango creme brulee, churros, and some thing that I can't remember but looked like an upgraded version of french toast.  Yeah, we should have each gotten one of each because it was super divine!

Yummy stuff!
author: Denice L.

description:
Walked by this place on a Tuesday night around 8:30. Almost every table was full. We went in. The hostess immediately sat us, we had menus in hand, waters and drinks placed before us in minutes. 

The guacamole was made fresh in front of us and served with chips and warm tortillas. 

My husband ordered the stuffed chicken. I ordered a pork stuffed  pepper. Both dinners were perfectly prepared! We ate every last bite!

Dimly lit restaurant, modern decor, quality food and comfortable environment. 

I would go here any night of the week. Yum!
author: Megan J.

description:
After a busy day in the office, we were too weary to venture down to the Mission for some real Latin Food.....so we settled on Colibri.  Yes, you do have to dodge the voracious homeless crew.....Dinner Entrees were from $14 to $18, but they arrive in Tapas portions.  Fortunately, that yummy FRESH quacamole that they prepare at your table is worth the trip.  We also celebrated the arrival of the Ceviche, which was a perfect compliment to the warm corn tortillas that came with the guac.

The interior is nice and cozy.  I feel comfortable bringing a client or a foodie here, and am happy to know that there is some sit-down-Mexican food near the financial district.
author: L L.

description: Salsa flavors, and chilequilles are must haves!  Some mexican places try to overpower with heat.  This place does it right with smooth savory flavors.  It is one gooood place to eat.
author: T L.

description: I recommend making a reservation. The service was good. The margaritas were all ice. The corn tortillas are pretty heavy. I would suggest asking for chips, but their chips are very dense and overly crunchy. The food was just okay.
author: Emma H.

description:
i was really disappointed with the food here. 

the guacamole was fresh, but it was lacking something -- either salt or lime or some kind of spice. 

i got the pechuga ranchera - chicken over mashed potatoes + spinach. it just tasted like chicken over mashed potatoes + spinach. nothing really stood out to me, chicken wasn't super tender or above average quality. 

the fact that is was super expensive for less than average tasting food made me take off 1 star.
author: sharon s.

description:
Excellent pork

Most excellent overall tequila selection

Nice to have this high end Mexican restaurant in the Tenderknob...

Service has been good for the most part

Sadly, the price point is a bit high 

Nice ambiance and enjoyable when it is not packed with peeps (noise level)
author: Joe Bob J.

description:
I came with a friend for dinner on a Tuesday - we were catching a show across the street at the American Conservatory Theater. We were seated right away without reservations. Service was efficient, not particularly friendly, but we were able to get to our show with plenty of time.

We shared 2 entrees and 1 dessert which was actually the highlight of the meal. 

The fresh tortillas were soft and warm, came with 3 sauces. 

Pato en Mole Verde Pipián - pan seared duck breast in a green mole sauce made with pumpkin seeds, tomatillos, nuts and spices. I wish the skin on the duck was more crispy. The mole sauce sounded great on the menu but actually fell flat for me. 

Chile Relleno Carne Asada was the June special - they fire roast the pepper and stuff it with meat, cheese and potatoes. The sauce was tasty. I prefer roasting the pepper -  the other way is to stuff the pepper, coat it in flour or egg batter and deep fry the whole thing. i love the smokiness of this dish. 

The dessert was awesome. Churros rellenos - Traditional hispanic pastry filled with cajeta caramel cream, served with dulce de leche ice cream. omg. I would come back just to have this dessert.
author: Annie c.

description: Oh those corn tortillas.  I would return just to eat them again.  A fabulous find in San Fran.
author: Linda R.

description: Nice relaxed atmosphere.  Margaritas just  OK.  Better Margaritas at Tropisueno.  Great food.  Guacamole is delicious.  Very nice staff.
author: Dr. Octagon O.

description:
This was an amazing mexican restaurant. The decor was warm, old wood, mexican tiles, and very inviting. 

 Food was unique, authentic, beautifully presented and great service. 

We are Mexican food enthusiasts  and have it frequently wherever we go! This was truly one of the best meals ever. I recommend starting with the homemade guacamole which is made in front of you!
author: Stephanie W.

description: Ok place, I think it gets high ratings bc of location.  Food tasted reheated and was overpriced.  Better places away from Union Square.
author: Paula S.

description: Close to the ACT theatre.  Here from out of town.  Guacamole appetizer was very good with fresh corn tortillas.  They served three salsa from mild to hot.  Atmosphere was nice.  Server was excellent.  Food was good.
author: Barbara S.

description:
Really friendly and attentive service.  Food was really good.  Can't go wrong with Fresh(?) hot tortillas and 3 different sauces while you wait for your meal.  Ice Tea was really good, I could've sworn there was Tamarind in the ice tea!! 

I had their Jicama Salad with grilled chicken (added on).  Can't really mess up a salad.  My dining companion had 3 tacos that looked very delicious!!  He also had a margarita made from an organic Tequila, if I remember correctly, and he said it was very smooth and made perfectly. 

They also have a DIne About Town prix-fixe menu during the lunch hour.  Can't wait to return to have more yummy Mexican food, especially their Guacamole!
author: Karen B.

description:
Colibri's is pretty impressive looking, full of swanky gourmet feathers that would be associated with such dining, and some obligatory mood lighting. Their food, on the other hand, is a mixed bag. On my last dining trip, our guacamole was peppered with unique spices and great consistency. But why do we have to pay $2 for tortilla chips deep fried so badly that they taste like corn nuts? Shouldn't the chips accompany the guacamole? I know they bring out tortillas, but with only three per two guests, and a huge bowl of guacamole, it felt like bad math. Nevertheless, the appetizer was pretty impressive. 

For the main course I ordered the carnitas dish, which, to the apprehensive prodding of my fork, was mostly fatty globs of meat. I would have an easier time sliding my fork into a gummi bear than I would some of these pieces of pork. 

Being that I'm from San Diego, and have had many better Mexican dishes, I feel a little underwhelmed by the jell-o pork and the cold rice that could double for rock salt. I would certainly recommend future patrons to go straight for the guacamole and margaritas. Forget the entrees. Three stars for the appetizers and bar quality, negligible praise for the actual lunch and dinner items.
author: Rob P.

description: I hate to do it but I'm downgrading one star. My friends and I went for brunch on Saturday; the food was completely delicious as it has been in the past but the margaritas were not consistent. The round we ordered this time were SO sour we had to send them back. Sad.
author: Julia N.

description:
Was there for dinner with a large party.  

Service was quite slow.  Took forever to get the to take our appetizer order.  When we asked if we could order appetizers, we were told "of course you can" but there was no "and what would you like".  Strange.

Ordered the guacamole.  It was all right.  My colleague was convinced that it was storebought because it came out in disposable plastic containers.  :-)

The accompanying chips were quite stale.

I ordered duck with mole. I wouldn't normally associate duck with Mexican cuisine but decided to be adventurous. It wasn't a successful adventure.  Duck chewy. Dish was accompanied with thin noodles and a pasta sauce, which seems more Italian than Mexican.

Others ordered the carnitas which looked really nice but I was told that it was "meh".  Same thing withe scallops - looked good but not so wonderful on taste. 

On the other hand, the fish tacos were supposedly good and the leg of lamb was excellent.

Given that we were a big party, I'd have expected better service - but then another colleague said that since the tip was already built in (it is automatically added to the bill for a group of 6 or more) there was no incentive for the waitstaff to provide good service.  Based on the experience, I'd have to agree.
author: Nick K.

description:
Colibri is okay. The complimentary tortillas with sauce, while not quite as appealing as chips and salsa, are a good distraction... but will leave one craving the main course.

We had two dishes in total here. One was bland and forgettable, while the other fish dish was very mouth watering... leaving to an odd mix between experiences. 

The portions are small, and the prices are upscale. Overall, it was an okay experience, but the price vs experience ratio will probably keep us from coming back.
author: Sami R.

description: Best. Guacamole. Ever. A fresh, house-made tortilla to accompany the green goodness is even better. I have been here twice and delighted not only in the phenomenal guac, but also the chile relleno and the pechuga ranchera. Both dishes are so tasty that I am salivating a bit just typing this review. The ambiance is pretty cool, too. With the food being this superb, I would let it go if the service was just alright. But even the service is top-notch. Prices for dinner can be a bit high, but you are definitely getting what you pay for.
author: Kim S.

description:
Macho margarita - jalepeno with tequila and lemon -  By far the BEST Margarita I've had!!

Only two veggie options, but both awesome.. Live music, great ambience, good service and great food.. Comes at a high price!
author: Ruchika I.

description: Top shelf, super creative Mexican fare.  Great antojitos and drinks.  I'm not a big ceviche fan, but Colibri's made me rethink that position.  The my group had were incredible-filete and carnitas.  Great to go with a big group so you can experience the wide variety of flavors on the menu. I'm a huge fan, best high end Mexican food I've had and I seek it out everywhere.
author: Greg F.

description: Excellent food quality and tasty margaritas.  Great selection of tequila.Very friendly waitress.  I'll go back.
author: Clayton W.

description:
I struggled between giving them a 3 versus a 5, so I'm settling for a 4.  The reason?

Appetizers and entrees are OK!  Nothing amazing but nothing bad either.

HOWEVER....

HANDS DOWN, THE BEST CHURROS I HAVE EVER EATEN IN MY LIFE.

Ladies and gentleman - If there is only ONE reason to hit up this restaurant, IT IS FOR THE CHURROS!  A - MAZE - ING!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Arian H.

description:
This was the best mexican brunch I have ever had. Not only is the food delicious and prepared so fresh but its $10 endless mimosas kept me smiling and feelin' good for hours after!
You must check it out!
author: Joshua M.

description:
Margaritas = great
Guacamole = fantastic (I've made my own before, and loved their version)
Food = meh...the mole poblano was a bit bland and the carnitas was better, but nothing to write home about.
author: Julia K.

description: This place did not disappoint. I thought it was a little pricey, but I am not from the city. The meal I had was very good. I would go back, but they have very few options for vegan/vegetarians. Overall, a great experience.
author: Lish R.

description:
a friend and i were on our way to another restaurant when we passed colibri and decided to dine here instead.  we should have kept walking.  it was a friday night and we had no reservation, so we checked in at the front desk and were told it would be about 10 minutes.  a few minutes later, another party of 2 without a reservation came in and were whisked away to a high top table.  then several minutes later, another party of 2 without a reservation came in and were taken to be seated at the bar area.  that's when my hunger and frustration really kicked in and i asked the hostess why we had to wait when several parties just went ahead of us.  she said she was waiting to seat us at a regular table rather than a high top or bar, but we were never asked for our preference.  strike 1.

the hostess comped us the guacamole and chips for the confusion and my frustration level dropped at the thought of some really great guac.  it was terrible.  it's as if someone who had never eaten guacamole and really didn't have an idea of what it should taste like made it.  it needed more lime juice and salt and probably cilantro.  it had little to no flavor, which seems like a difficult task in itself.  in addition, the bowl of chips primarily contained one giant lump of chips folded and stuck together.  we had to break it apart which created a bowl full of broken and crushed chips, which coincidentally also needed salt.  very, very rarely do i add salt or pepper to my food in restaurants.  it's usually seasoned appropriately for my tastes.  this was completely bland.  strike 2.

considering the prices, i expected the entrées to be more substantial.  the servings were small, but the taste was a little better.  small serving for a large serving price = strike 3.

i was disappointed in colibri.  it's a beautiful place and was packed when we got there.  i expected more.
author: Anjanette M.

description:
#4 on my 5 Best Margaritas in SF list!

Guacamole, homemade tortillas, the appetizer Sopes are just delectable (that's right I said delectable!), the Margaritas are tasty tasty tasty and the Churros with the caramel are orgasmic!

I would order Guacamole, pick 3 other appetizers, have a few Margaritas and the churros for desert and just skip the entrees which are small & overpriced. Ole'

Also Louisa who was our server was excellent!
author: Josh C.

description: Oh those wam corn tortillas!  I'd go back just to savor another warm wonderful plié.
author: John A.

description: Delicous, authentic tasting mexican food. LOVE the queso fundido con chorizo coupled with the ceviche is a great way to kick off the night. Oh,and of course one of their awesome drinks. Posole is delicious and so are the empanadas. My husband and I love this place!
author: Cristina G.

description: Service was ok, specialty margarita was too strong to taste anything.  Chicken was dry, salsa was under seasoned, guac was standard, Pozole was pretty awesome, tortillas were really good too.  My big complaint was the Mole.  It was only bitter, I didn't get sweetness, nuttiness, sour, salty, only bitterness.  Pretty disappointing for a sauce that's only job is to be complex and balanced
author: Ricky C.

description: We were walk in and were informed of a 45 minute wait. We received a text in 40 minutes then were seated promptly. The waiter was pleasant and efficient. We had the guacamole appetizer which was excellent with the home made soft tortillas. The carnitas entree was cooked perfectly. Killer margaritas!! We'll be back.
author: Michael P.

description: The guacamole was good but like others don't like to pay extra for chips.  Ordered a chicken dish that was totally dried out and portion was tiny.  They did help us get our dinner and drinks in a timely manner to allow us to get to our play on time.  Expensive  but not great quality.
author: Steve M.

description: Fantastic dinner out with folks from work. Delightful margaritas, and the scallops on a purple potato mash with marinated/sauteed cactus was fantastic. Guac also great. Not cheap, but they brought it with the quality.
author: Jack S.

description: Visited this place during a solo business trip and was very pleasantly surprised. The salsas with tortillas as the beginning of the meal are a nice touch. I wasn't famished and decided to try the chicken pozole, which was absolutely delicious, with fresh, vibrant flavors. I also enjoyed my margarita; I think I just chose the classic. Considering the great food and the excellent service, I would definitely come back when visiting the Union Square area of San Francisco.
author: Beck B.

description:
Delicious! Came here at the urging of a friend and I enjoyed it thoroughly! Note that I was sick at the time (not as in cold-sick but nausea-sick) and I still loved it.

The guac--and I am a guac and avocado hater--was delicious. That's definitely saying something. We got the hottest type and I couldn't get enough of it.

The tortillas were also to die for. I still can't believe they're corn tortillas. They tasted flour-y to me (which is good). What kind of corn tortillas have I been having all my life? Apparently terrible ones. 

The dish I got was the carnitas. Very delicious and tender. The sauce was hot and addicting. 

I also tasted the scallops. They seemed cooked well (as in good) but not as good as I would have liked. The sauce was delicious though.

Note that I haven't been in SF for a while and have been exposed to LA's terrible food. Still, food that addictive must be good. 

Their sangria was tasty but a little light-handed.

The only con would have to be it's prices. The menu said in small print "Tapas" which surprised me... expensive tapas, that's for sure! The portions were generally big for tapas though, so be assured you won't be given minuscule portions.

Arggg so addicting... makes me want to go to SF for more... argggg... *books flight now.*
author: Tina M.

description:
Superb restaurant largely thanks to authentically served guacamole and conspicously friendly service.

Had the restaurant manager acquainted and equipped themselves with a wine decanter, I would not have spared the fifth star from my rating.
author: Martin V.

description: My cousin used to work here and so she always knew what to order.  Food was great and the drinks are strong.  No complaints!
author: Suz L.

description: We went for Happy hour right when we got into town.  The food was amazing, the service was wonderful!!  We will be back every time we are in town!!  Their homemade salsas were to die for and I loved the homemade tortillas...Sooooo good!!
author: Well Gnome Chef f.

description:
A bit on the overpriced side ($10 for guac ... without chips???) but this ain't no taqueria, plus the food is pretty good. My most favorite thing there was actually their complimentary tortillas and fresh-made salsas.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
we stopped in because we were early for a dinner appointment with friends next door at katanaya.  we sat at the bar.  the service was fast and friendly.
