description: LOVE the fresh homemade tortillas with their mango salsa. i would go  there for that alone.  we went in for lunch on a quiet day and the manager came over to our table, with a refill of tortillas, and was very hospitable. staff is always very attentive. cant wait to go back!
author: Miriam M.

description: Love Colibri for many reasons: the Pechuga Ranchera, the little tortilla w/ chicken appetizers,  the mango creme brulee, the helpful waitstaff.  I had my birthday dinner here and they sat us in the back alcove, which was a little more spacious and worked well with the number of people we had.  Although they couldn't fit all 20 of us in one table (I know, asking much), they were very attentive and helpful with everything else.  Our main waitress constantly made sure we all had everything we needed and she even kept my friend's plate warm since she was running late.  (I really appreciated that little detail).  Working with the event coordinator there was equally pleasant; they try to be as accommodating as possible.  The food was good with our large party, but is even better when you go in smaller groups so they don't have to cook everything in big batches.
author: Kalista W.

description: Great guacamole! I've been here a number of times, and the food is really good. The jicama salad is sooo good.
author: Carson H.

description: I love this place - great atmosphere, great drinks, amazing food and amazing staff! The manager there will definitely take care of you as if she owns the place. I recommend the mojitos, loved them!
author: Tarah O.

description: I love this restaurant. We stopped in before going to a local concert and the food was great.  I think its best to sit in the back. The front can get really cramped. The food was amazing. I loved the fillet mignon with goat cheese. We ordered the guacamole made to order at our table..Yummy and the caiparinas where great.
author: Julie V.

description:
This place is sort of a hole in the wall if you don't know its there you will pass it up completely. Rather small and depending on the time you may have to wait a while. 
Queso fundido con chorizo...mmmmm! Fattening as it may it is soo GOOD! The food is a tad bit pricey considering you get no side dishes. 
The service varies, Last time I was there the bartender was really nice and generous with the liquor however our waitress was rather stuck-up and forgetful; she acted as if she was there against her will. Word of advice if are not a people person don't become a waitress/server or whatever the PC term is. 
If you plan on having desert the crepes served warm with melted Mexican caramel and ice cream are a MUST! YUM!
author: Evangelina M.

description: Not a shabby spot- great jalapeno margarita. Service was spotty but really knowledgeable waiter- super nice, and recommended that wacky drink. Scallops were wonderful, ceviche not shabby. We just had bar service, but I love sit-down Mexican and glad that we have more options now downtown for this kind of food.
author: Anna B.

description:
If I could give a 3.75 I would. It wasn't A-OK, it was pretty good. But it wasn't FAN worthy. Haha. It's a pretty neat little place - the decor fits the Mexican Bistro theme very nicely. And since it was good times with my friends, I'll round up and give this place a 4!

The guacamole, I must say, was really REALLY good. It is definitely a notch above Chevy's guac. (Haha.) Fresh made by the table. And a kick of spice too! Very refreshing. We tried the medium spicyness but I'm curious was the really spicy one tastes like! And they served it with freshly made tortilla! Which was also very tasty. The tortilla soup wasn't anything TRULY special. But it was good. After much debate, I ordered "Camarones en Mole de Tamarindo" which was the "sautéed prawns in tamarind mole served with a savory corn cake" and it looks like I hit a home run. The tamarind mole was really YUMMY! It reminded of a sauce that I was familiar with... but I couldn't really put a finger on it until my sister tried it and said it tasted like the marinade that is used for Korean fried chicken wings! Haha. And the corn bread/cake... wow. It was good. Sweet and savory at the same time - nice and soft. it even had chunks of whole corn in it! Everyone else said their dishes weren't anything special... I tried my sister's lamb and wasn't very impressed (then again, I don't like lamb...) But my dish was YUUUUUMAY! I love prawns. I cleaned off the entire dish. The portions were pretty small compared to normal American standards - but I couldn't have eaten more - perfect portion for me! My friend also ordered a dessert as part of the "Dine About Town" menu. It was waaaarrrrmmm churros with ice cream. Yeah. That was pretty freakin' good too...

...Alright, so maybe I did have a great, food experience here! Haha.
author: Karen K.

description: Had to update, because I realized that I didn't give Colibri a fair shot. Went back with friends and enjoyed the food (probably cause I didn't order a lame salad this time). The chile relleno was solid, and not too heavy, and the boyfriend's shrimp with mole was very good indeed. In addition, the strong drinks make this a very decent spot to have a meal if you're in the area.
author: Halli P.

description:
We found Colibri a few years ago on a midnight search for food and we have returned several times over the past few years.  The food has been consistently delicious and the margaritas have been phenomenal.  The Nopales and Carnitas are so yummy!  Fresh salsa and tortillas?  Hit the spot. 
Don't know what tequilla to choose?  Ask the bartender and tell them what flavors you like.  I lean toward lighter, citrusy flavors while the boyfriend enjoys flavors like smoke.  We used this technique the last time we went and bartender Adrian did not disappoint!  If he's working, ask for him to make your margarita.  
After allowing us to smell the tequillas he was considering, he blended boyfriend's tequilla with orange to bring out the smokiness and he NAILED the floral/citrus flavors that I was looking for.  He even insisted that we taste the tequillas first on their own to know what they taste like without the fresh juices in the margarita.  It's hard to find someone so knowledgeable and who takes the time to ensure his guests are more than satisfied.  He definitely knows what he's doing!
author: Meredith S.

description:
Four stars for the food, four stars for the wait staff, no star for the service I received from the manager.  I'll average to three.

I have been to Colibri in the past with friends for dinner and really enjoyed the interesting dishes on the menu (a sort of French twist to traditional Mexican flavors and spices).  I thought about coming back with my family, but put it off since it was a little pricey, and I wasn't too sure how they would like it.  Anyway, I saw it on Bloomspot some time ago, and decided to get the coupon and bring my family.  I was under the impression that the coupon expired on June 30, 2011.  It was my sister's birthday today, so I bought it thinking that I would be able to use it.  Anyway, being under that impression, I did not check the coupon until today when I realized that it actually had already expired three plus weeks before.  I checked the Bloomspot site and it states that if the coupon has expired, I would be able to use the coupon for the amount paid for the coupon.

When the time came for the bill, the waiter took the coupon, and came back to tell me that the coupon could not be honored because it had expired.  He went and talked to the manager, who said that she would honor the coupon for me, but that they no longer work with Bloomspot, and they generally do not accept the coupons any more.  She also continued to tell me that she would get in trouble later from her boss and made me feel bad for missing the expiration date.  I, thinking she's let me use the Bloomspot coupon as if it had not expired, apologized once again, and took the check for the remainder of the balance.  When I opened up the check, I saw that she had only docked the amount I paid for the coupon that I was telling her was owed to me, as per Bloomspot policy.  I felt like I was all of a sudden in an awkward position where I could not say anything more to the manager, who had already left the table anyway, or be satisfied with the service that was provided to me.  I am NOT happy with the restaurant's resolution to the problem or the way they made me feel guilty for making a mistake. I was honest from the beginning about the coupon, but they seemed to either not know about the policy, or were trying not to accept it for even face value.  Either way, it was a horrible experience.
author: P S.

description: Comfortable, colorful atmosphere, good drink menu- the Toro Azul is good but quite sweet so beware. Our waitress was exceptionally attentive and friendly- dont remember her name, blonde hair.....jicima salad is great and bursting with bright flavors. Instead of the usual tortilla chips, a stack of warm homemade corn tortillas with 3 types of salsa are brought to the table before the meal- very nice. I ordered the scallops- they were delicious, but its not a huge amount of food in that dish so you might want to get either an appetizer or munch on a few of those yummy tortillas beforehand. I tried a bit of the lamb shank- that was also delicious- very tender, moist and flavorful. Try this place out
author: Julie S.

description: I went here for lunch. We had great food and awesome margaritas. Very elegant dining atmosphere. Fabulous mexican tiles. I can't wait to go back for dinner.
author: Sarah T.

description: I've been here several times with friends, and I'm always pleased.  If you go here, you pretty much have to get the guacamole, which they make right in front of you.  It's delicious.  They have a good selection of tequilas;  if you like margaritas, they have a nice variety of flavors.  The entrees (tapas style) were killer; I specifically remember that the "Pechuga ranchera a la nata" was excellent -- perfectly tender chicken breast in a guajillo chile sauce.  But I've had a lot of other things here and I don't think there's anything I wouldn't recommend.  The desserts are also very good and nicely presented.  The restaurant can get very loud, but that's about the only knock against it.
author: David A.

description: Food's pretty tasty. Drinks overpriced. Small portions so it adds up. Loved the Sopes Surtidos... unfortunately, the service sucked (again!).  We had to constantly ask for our server.  Friendly, knowledgeable staff? Not so much. Left frustrated and feeling like we could have gotten our time and money's worth elsewhere.
author: Michael A.

description: This place really gets 3.5 stars.  Great margaritas, really tasty food.  It is Mexican-ish, but they serve it tapas style.  Went with a large group & the staff was very accommodating and kept the yummy (and strong) margaritas coming all night long.  Some of our fave dishes were the freshly made (table side) guacamole, carnitas & cornbread.
author: Katie P.

description: i was underwhelmed by the food here. Firstly I had 3,count them three ,horrible margaritas. First one was way too bitter,second one was an overly berried marg,and third was so undrinkable we had to send it back . My tortilla soup was meh, my quesedillas were alright but nothing special. nice decor and friendly waitstaff though, i just wont be back
author: Lauren V.

description: Defnitely a little pricey for Mexican food but this food is SO DAMN GOOD!   Extensive tequila menu, the yummiest margaritas I have ever had and again, delicious food.  I went twice, once with my partner and once with two friends.  Going with friends was actually more enjoyable because we all ordered something different and shared.  Getting to try a variety of flavors really made the experience even better.  (My partner is a vegetarian and I like meat!)  The carnitas, to the fish, to chili rellenos, to the piping hot homemade tortillas- it was all to die for.  This is defnitely a place I plan on bring out of town visitors and for a nice night out.
author: J L.

description: I chose colibri for my friends bachlorette party dinner, and i was not disapointed. The ambiance is perfect. It has romantic lighting, but you can still see your food. The music is pumping, but you can still hold a conversation with your friend across the table. the food is fantastic and reasonably priced. Do not miss the guacamole, which is made right at your table to taste, and paired with the homemade corn tortillas. There is an extensive alcohol menu, highlighted by their many margaritas, but don't overlook the sangria, which you can get by the pitcher. The Staff was very accomadating, and overall I was very pleased. I would recommend making a reservation.
author: Caddy M.

description:
Fabulous, friendly staff and great deserts: warm chocolate cake and a delicious crepe both served with a very smooth vanilla ice cream.

The margaritas are also the real thing.

Thank you!!!
author: Nena G.

description: The other night our friends made reservations at "an upscale Mexican place downtown." At first my husband and I thought it was Cortez and were super disappointed. Fortunately, it was Colibri. We got a great table in the back which allowed us to talk--the place can be pretty noisy if you're right in the middle of it all. I ordered a Tequila Flight, which is a sampler of 3 tequilas along with a spicy tomato concoction to cleanse your palate between sips. I got drunk when I was 15 on tequila and wound up throwing up in both shoes. I thought maybe those days were behind me. They aren't. I couldn't finish them, but everybody at my table did. The food was excellent and our waitress was incredibly nice. I will definitely be coming back again! Except no tequila next time.
author: kristen v.

description:
Eh, I guess I have high standards for Mexican food. I heard a lot about this place so it was a natural choice after a full day of shopping.

We ordered the guac. It was bleh. Lots of big onion chunks and not enough salt. 

My caipirinha was pretty good. 

Over all - unimpressed.
author: A K.

description: First time there and had the lamb shank dish - I don't usually eat lamb but this was delicious.  Had a margie too - very smooth and yummy.  Decent prices for the area with great food - definitely a must go.  Very nice service as well.
author: Venus A.

description:
Really enjoyable meal.

With no reservation on a Thursday night, we were offered two bar seats, which we accepted - perfectly comfortable.

I was tired and grumpy due to jet lag and this meal single-handedly cheered me up.  Guacamole to start (amazing fresh corn tortillas), followed by chicken with mole and filet mignon for husband.  Delicious margarita.  Much happier.
author: Helen B.

description:
The bf and I stopped in one evening for drinks and some guac.  Firstly, the guac is good not great but I only say that because I make the best guac in the world.  Seriously.  I'm not a chef or anything and I'm not one to toot my own horn about these kinds of things but it's just kind of a known fact that my guac cannot be beat, worldwide.  So, given those circumstances, their guac was just ok.  Their fresh warm slash hot tortillas, however, were delicious and a lovely alternative to the greasy fried tortilla chips served everywhere else.  They are really filling though so keep that in mind if you're ordering main courses.  
The highlight of the visit was the jalapeno margarita the bf ordered.  The bartender sliced up a fresh jalapeno, laid it on a plate, covered it in Bacardi 151 and lit it on fire--but in an understated, Mexican bistro sort of way--not a Cancun hit you on the head and pour tequila down your throat sort of way.  Anyway, he let it burn for around 10 minutes then muddled it all up into a margarita.  De. Lish. Us.  For real.  Wasn't expecting that at all.  This was around 3 weeks ago and I haven't stopped craving another. 
Can't comment on the main courses or anything else on the menu but for a quick app and an unusual, delicious, unusually delicious cocktail and some good guac with great tortillas, I definitely recommend Colibri.
author: BJ F.

description: Wish could give 3.5 stars. Good decor, good location, good food. Cactus leaves were awesome. Sangria was decent. But nothing jumped out so much that I would go again (would not mind it but would not plan for it). I am little biased though as I am vegetarian and had all veggie dishes.
author: Abhi Anu A.

description: SO Amazing!!!!!....... The best is brunch! When my lady friends and I do girls' weekend this is always the Saturday morning mission! Bottomless Mimosas!!! Everything is perfect. The food, the people and the location, just down the street is Union square!!! Shopping, yes please!!!
author: Nana C.

description:
I will tell you my secret...I don't like Mexican food!@#$ Wait! Correction. I don't like Mexican food but very nicely done dishes like the ones that you can get in Colibri. We had Guacamole, Chicken Mole and Carnitas. All were good. Also the service was very nice.

Just the perfect dinner before we went to Burn The Floor.
author: Charlie S.

description:
i enjoyed the duck immensely.  we also had the tamales, the different salsas with fresh tortillas and a fairly decent/standard margarita. but i really enjoyed the duck.  everything else was just ok- and a little pricey. i just don't get pricey mexican food. did i mention the duck was very good? i think it was in a spicy pumpkin sauce.  
all in all, you can get just as good tacos at that impala on taco tuesday...2 dollars 2 tacos (only the carne asada- don't eat pork and the chicken was ehn)
i'll revisit this review when i'm not a poor student.
author: Yvonne Y.

description: The guacamole and tortillas alone make this place worth visiting.  I did, however, find my chair to be rather uncomfortable.
author: Marcus C.

description: Saw "Jersey Boys" across the street and my roommate suggested Margaritas @ Colibri's.  Tequila gives me a headache, but their margaritas were delicious...what headache?  Maybe it was the guacamoles w/ the mini tortillas?  I don't eat guacamoles, but Colibri's left an impression.  I went to bed thinking about it.
author: D C.

description: Two and a half stars, really. I've been here twice and was unimpressed on the whole. The margaritas are good- the prickly pear was spicy and tasty. Guac was also good. Main courses, not so much. If you want to go before the theater, it's a good place for drinks and apps.
author: Dana K.

description: The guacamole is some of the best I have ever had! This place is all about the small plates. I have been there a couple of times and seems to fill up pretty quickly.  Everything I have had here is above average to really good! I thought the drinks were over priced, but not the food. This is definitely is not your normal Mexican joint......it's more like a couple of steps up from that.
author: tom h.

description:
Its a bit pricey and the portions are small, but VERY good traditional interior Mexican food.  If you know a bit about tequila, then you'll understand why some of the margaritas stand out.  The reposado's they have are from producers that age to most closely bring out the true agave taste.  Anejo's are aged to produce the smokiness from the oak that you most associate with scotch, whiskey's or even heavily oaked / aged wine.  

Service is hit or miss, but the bartendars are super friendly if you go in on a packed nigth without a rezzie and just want to grab some good dinner!
author: Julie C.

description: Drinks were great, but service was terrible and food was bad.  My steak was charred on the outside and raw in the middle, and I had to send it back and order a salad instead.  We specifically waited for table in the dining room (away from the cold bar tables) only to be sat at a table not two yards away from the front door.  Our server was uninterested and barely spoke to us.  He didn't even offer to get us a second round.   Go for happy hour, skip the food.
author: Tom H.

description: Pricey for serving size, but very tasty and good service. The guacamole isn't worth the price, but the entrees are delicious. I recommend splitting a few among friends. We had the scallops and carnitas. Both were fantastic with the perfect side sauces.
author: Jeremiah L.

description: Its a bad sign when you look at your visa bill and can't remember what the charges were for and don't recognize the restaurant name.  The food was ok.  I was pretty hungry when I ordered so maybe I didn't need the queso fondido with my soup but it came out and congealed into a solid mass pretty darn quickly.  The drinks were good as I recall.  Needless to say I've had better elsewhere.
author: Gwyneth T.

description: Definitely more bistro than I'd like it to be,  Being of Mexican descent Their food is pretty mild and mostly suited for the mild palate, people with limited experience when it comes to Mexican cuisine. I ordered a spicy guacamole and it was good just not spicy lol... They do however have an impressive collection of Tequilas, would probably be better off as a Tequila bar than the "Upscale" aka Gringo style Mexican food it tries to be.  But take my word with a grain of salt. My expectations of Mexican food in restaurants is probably wayyyyy too high. Something that does steal the show is their blanco y negro desert, if you like dark chocolate  you will not be disappointed.
author: J Angel G.

description: It's a good place for Sunday brunch. The guacamole and the handmade corn tortilla are great! They serve three types of yummy sauces with tortilla. But the main course was a little bland. It's right next to the theaters, good convenient place to got o before the show.
author: Maya G.

description: The food is exceptional- fantastic flavors and they have great alcoholic beverages.  The service wasn't as fast as you might hope for, but they were jam-packed and we were in the hidden corner.
author: Jen T.

description: The food is upscale, innovative Mexican food. Ate there twice this week.the food and service were excellent!!  Best restaurant experience I've had in a long time. I highly recommend !
author: Coleen T.

description:
A friend and I decided to just walk on Geary and see what we found last night, and we couldn't have found anything better than Colibri! We sat at the bar, had some amazing margaritas and appetizers. 
 If you like spicy they make a really good jalapeno margarita, even roast the peppers in front of you.  The prices are a little more than I normally go for, but everything was really good. We had the sopes and tamales, both small appetizers but not lacking in flavor.  
The bartenders were helpful picking some tequilas to try, it was an overall success!
author: Jaylene S.

description: I am sorry to say we didn't like this restaurant at all.  The atmosphere is okay but it is way too packed full of tables.  It isn't at all comfortable.  The noise level is fairly high as well.  The service was just okay--nothing to rave about.  We tried the sangria and it was nothing special.  In fact, we didn't get enough ice in our glasses so we had to take some ice from our water glasses and add it in.  Don't expect a basket of complimentary chips.  If you want chips it will cost you.  How cheap is that not to even give you some chips to munch on?  As for our meals, we had the tamales and they were so small you needed a magnifying glass to find them.  The salad we had was joke.  It was beyond sparse.  As for the complimentary tortillas, they tasted like rubber which was so disappointing considering we had heard they were good.  Oh and everything is "a la carte" which is ridiculous for Mexican food.  Imagine having to order rice separately. It's rice, for godsake--one of the cheapest things you can make. Needless to say, we left hungry and obviously won't return.  There are many good Mexican restaurants in San Francisco but Colibri is definitely not one of them.
author: Rabbit B.

description: The filet mignon with blue cheese and the chocolate mousse were the highlights of our meal.  Excellent service.
author: P-Rock F.

description:
Who said all the authentic Mexican restaurants are in the Mission? Well they are wrong!
Went there last night at the recommendation of fellow yelpers.......great guacamole, made tableside. I had the mole chicken & my friend had the shrimp, definitely enough for 2 people. We had an old fashion & a mojito...all for $50. The prices alongwith the service will definitely get me going back!
author: dawn w.

description: Among the very many redundant places that one can go eat in the city, this place seems to have a unique stature of its own. The ambience is great, not to mention the stellar decor that takes you away from the usual san francisco type decor. The service is prompt and the food outstanding. The drinks could be just a tad bit stronger, but then again I think most people tend to frequent this place for its eats.
author: Raj K.

description: Great margaritas, great food, fantastic atmosphere.  Hope to be back here again soon.
author: JBO ..

description: Yummy!  I really enjoyed my meal here.  I had the scallops which were delcious and of course the fresh guacamole made at your table--to die for.  They also don't try to stuff you with crappy tortilla chips which I appreciate.  I also really enjoyed the inventive and delicious cocktail menu.  I had a pomegranate mojito that danced on my tongue!  It was definitely more on the pricey tip when it comes to Mexican so coming from San Diego where I could get an amazing burrito as big as my head for 5 bucks, it HAD to be delish to get 5 stars from me.  Def unique and tasty.  I will be going back!  Lastly, our server gave me burn spray when I was being an idiot and burnt myself trying to light the table candle/lantern thingy.  So sweet.....
author: Nikki M.

description: I really like this place.  I've been about four times so far.  I usually meet friends there before going to the theater.  My favorite is the cornbread.  I also love the pork dish.  They make the guacamole right at the table, serve it with house made tortillas, and it's D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S!
author: Warren M.

description: The Guacamole was amazing and the tortillas YUMMY!  What a great experience and a great place to take guests from out of town.
author: Trudi B.

description: This is the place for cocktails and appetizers. They have the best guacamole served with warm, home-made corn tortillas. Also, don't miss the queso fundido which is delicious. It is one of my favorite after work haunts. Atmosphere is dimly lit and cozy and there is always an old cheezy Mexican movie on the bar TV. I love it!
author: Nicole K.

description: The guacamole dip is great, as was the tortilla soup. The service was so-so (we sat with empty water glasses for a good 20 minutes). The menu could be a little more exciting; it seemed like a lot of dishes were the same, only substituting the kind of meat.
author: Melissa B.

description: My friend and I wanted to have dinner here before catching a show at the Conservatory (conveniently located right across the street) and kindly asked them if they could be a little quick with our order. The server was very nice and accommodating. We ordered the guacamole (which they make at your table) and told him to make it spicy....yummm it was sooo good with their warm tortillas. The portion was way more than enough for two people but sadly we had to catch a show (SCAPIN which btw was hilarious!) so we couldn't box the rest. But oh believe me I REALLY wanted to take some home to enjoy the next afternoon (Sunday) while in my pjs curled up on the couch with some tortilla chips and.....We also ordered Sopes Surtidos : "sope assortment, with beans, chicken, shredded pork and sautéed vegetables; with crumbled queso fresco, onion and sour cream". mmmm...They are kind of like a round fluffy corn cake (or think a little bit of a denser version of the outer part of a tamale) topped with all the goodness quoted above. My friend, who is Mexican, recommended I order them and I am so glad she did because I LOVED it. I think that I have had just enough of a taste of their food to make me want to come back and try more things and possibly add more stars to my review. ;)
author: jasdeep g.

description:
You have to love the fresh warm tortillas at Colibri.  I'd take those over chips any day.  That was the best part of our entire meal.  

There were 6 of us and only one person liked their dish (she had scallops).  2 people ordered the filet mignon and besides the fact that they were not even the size of your palm, they were totally overcooked.  One was ordered medium and the other ordered med-well and there was NO pink in either of the pieces of meat.  2 ordered chicken, one was dry and other other smothered with so much sauce it just looked gross and tasted bland.  Then the halibut (fish of the day) was as salty as can be.  

The hongos al chileajo (mushroom w/garlic) was decent.  The ensalada mixta was nothing too exciting and a bit oily.  

Drinks, I've had better.  The waitress was nonexistent.  She didn't check up on us once.  Of course we had to pay the obligatory 18% b/c there were 6 in our party.    

After the reading the 4*yelp reviews, I wonder if they were having an off night.  Oh well.  With so many selections down in that area, I probably won't visit this place again.
author: TV J.

description: Don't think Mexican taqueria food here. This is upscale Mexican/Latin, fresh, very flavorful food. The tequilla selection is incredible and one of the best margaritas I've had in the Bay Area. The server knew his menu and tequillas and made very good suggestions.  The fresh tortillas and individually made guacamole are fantastic.  My husband had the duck brest in a verde sauce and I had the chicken breast ranchero in a light red guajillo chili sauce. Both were excellent. We were too full for dessert, but they looked fantastic.  I'd recommend this place to anyone and will be back!
author: Nicholette M.

description:
How did I find Colibri?  Well, if had not been desperate for a last minute brunch reservation on Sunday Mother's Day, and had I not been browsing www.opentable.com, I would not have found this place.
But what a gem it is?  Located right on Geary across from the Theater district, it's storefront makes it look deceptively small.  But, this place is stretched out and spacious. 
This is not standard "beans and rice" or "chips and salsa" Mexican food.  The menu is chick full of regional specialties and very large.  There are daily specials, and the wait staff is great about recommending menu items.
Not to miss:
1. The guac - made to order right at your table, served with warm tortillas.
2. Queso Fundido - spicy and cheesy and full of kinds of greasy goodness (spoon this into a tortilla as well!)
3. Mole - 'nuff said.
4. Margaritas/Cocktails - the margarita menu is mind blowing, but there is not not dud in the bunch.

Other hints: if the Host or Hostess wants to seat you in front by the bar, ask for a roomy booth around back.  You will not regret it!
If you are looking for a different Mexican food experience, check out Colibri.
author: Rachel W.

description: Best guacamole in town - they make it fresh table-side!  Great with the hot tortillas.  Supposed to be tapas - but some dishes are too expensive.  Great scallops, but they need to rinse them first - the grittiness was the last taste in my mouth.  They need to get rid of a few tables too - you are on top of each other in there.
author: JP D.

description: Outstanding Mexican food in SF, what a concept. Don 't look for steamed burrittos and enchiladas here. Very nicely prepared traditional Mexican dishes. Although they still don't touch Dona Tomas, the carnitas are not to be missed. The freshly prepared guacamole served with delicious petite fresh corn tortillas is some of the best I have had anywhere. They do a nice job with chicken and fish as well. All the sauces I have tried are excellent. Full flavored, but nicely subtle. The theatre crowd is lucky to have this near by. I can't wait to try the brunch.
author: J. Wade W.

description:
i like this place a lot. 

the fresh guacamole (made at your table in a molcajete) is the best ever. 

you know what - screw it - i'm not going to do the play by play this time. this is the best mexican restaurant i've ever been to. waitstaff is great. selection of tequila's is great & the food is great. best mex in SF.
author: Lawrence K.

description: Normally I would say more but all I got is mmmmmm....guacamole....so good...tortillas with it are so good...it's a revelation...gotta get back and get some more of that!
author: Eliza L.

description: just went in for drinks and watched amazing looking food pass me by... unfortunately the few drinks i tried were not so great. the worst by far was this mango cocktail (to be avoided!)
author: eli p.

description: A friend and I visited this place on a whim - we walked in with no reservation and even though they were packed, we were treated well and seated quickly. Now, their food - by far the best authentic Mexican I have had anywhere. And I've been everywhere. Do not miss this place.
author: Maggie F.

description:
Well informed staff, good food, nice ambience.

I liked the food and the staff was attentive and friendly.  I asked our server to recommend dishes and he made very good recommendations.  We ordered what he suggested.  

We were seated right across the bar and I liked looking at the bottle display, it along with the food and the rest of the atmosphere made it a cozy experience.
author: RT M.

description: I enjoyed the chicken mole.  The fresh made-at-the-table guacamole was a hit.  I can get crowed with the theaters across the street so call for a reservation.
author: John R.

description: We heard great things about this restaurant and at 5:30 on a Wednesday night, the place was PACKED.  The menu looked awesome (entrees are ala carte).  The starter tortillas and salsa are free and quite tasty.  My friend had been there before and said the filet mignon was bland so we decided to try other things.  She had the chicken ranchero and I had the shrimp w/tamarind mole and we split a side dish of potatoes gratin.  She said the chicken ranchero was good, but lacked spice.  The shrimps were not large and were literally drowning in a dark brown, bland mole sauce.  The corn muffin was the tastiest thing on the plate.  The potatoes gratin were quite good.  Service was just okay and not very attentive, but then, it wasn't invasive either.  For the price, I wouldn't go back.
author: Leonora G.

description: terrible service right as we walked in. Put us in the corner when the booths and tables in front were empty.  not very kid friendly at all - stay clear
author: S G.

description: Food is on the pricey side, but worth every penny. Guac is out of this world. I ordered the filet mignon, which was super flavorful, tender, and surrounded by this awesome orange sauce. Star of the night was prob the dessert. I'm not sure what it's called, but it looked like french toast with a scoop of ice cream on top. Freaking amazing. I can't wait to come back. Oh yeah, the sangria was bombdiggity too.
author: Milton T.

description: I regret not visiting more often when it first opened, as it's now difficult to get seated for dinner without a reservation. Still an amazing place. The fresh tortillas and table-made guacamole are tasty enough to live on. This is gourmet mexican, easily my favorite restaurant in SF. Excellent everything, drinks, service, food... reasonably priced and consistently so. Also a great spot for brunch, I love the mexican hot chocolate.
author: Micah K.

description: Someone is thinking in the kitchen here. It's not refined food, but it's very good. There is quality of ingredient and quality of preparation. I suggest ordering more than you think you want to eat and go to a taqueria if you're on a budget. Nice list of tequilas -- don't you want to taste a $100 shot of tequila? My server was a consummate salesman and a nice, knowledgeable sort-of guy. I think your empty plates should be cleared automatically rather than being asked if you would like for him to do it.
author: Keith R.

description:
The appetizers sampled were the guacamole (very tasty + mixed in front of everyone at our booth) + queso fundido con chorizo (very cheesy and rich) and Tostadas de Tinga (OK).  The main courses were a mixed bag - Pechuga Rellena de Huitlacoche pretty good, Carnitas good as well.  Pechuga Ranchera was very bland - I was searching for pepper or anything to help give it some taste.  Torta de Elote was very highly rated by two members of our party.  

The desserts sampled were tres leches (very good), churros with ice cream (incredibly sweet but good) and flan (below average).  
Sangria and margaritas good as well. Service was good.  

Overall I give it 3-3.5 stars - it was a pleasant dining experience.
author: Michael M.

description: Still one of my top gourmet Mexican food dining experiences in San Francisco!
author: Mitch P.

description:
Well I am surprised of all the reviews giving less than four or five stars, from reading them the main complaints are:
#1 Service
#2 Small Portions

to compliant #1 as much as I dislike to agree since I've loved this place for a while, I have to agree but not entirely. There could be bad service on occasions but in a mild way. 

Complaint #2
People PLEASE, read before you GO SOMEWHERE and have a little more knowledge and less ignorance. 

Mexican BISTRO!!!! what does BISTRO mean? for one more $$$
and, they portions are TAPAS style, hello!!! small portions. 
so why is this place getting lower stars for your ignorance. 

If you are a junkie from the Mission who expects the typical big fattening plate of sour cream and guacamole , DONT GO
NOW... I AM FROM THE MISSION myself and  I love that big plate of sour cream and guacamole as well and probably eat it more than the more educated palate of Colibri due to the price but you cannot compare apples and oranges. 
This is authentic Mexican food and is the food served in "Restaurants" the tacos and burritos are from street corners in Mexico. 
They are BOTH DELICIOUS!! to my taste but cannot compare the two and definitely not for a review. 


back to service, the first time I went to Colibri it was moderately new and I remember checking their reviews back then, definitely five stars. 

I agree, lately (maybe because of the popular traffic) I been served by two servers whom I did not like. 
I'm sorry to say this but they were both American servers and for service I like my waiters to be Hispanic or Mexican. American servers are just not as friendly and are more rushed to behave a certain way for their tip, in comparison with Mexican servers who seem more genuine. 
Wait I have to add that I like my servers to be gay Hispanic, the best!!
They used to serve the Guacamole at our table and recently they have not done so, the last time our waitress was not checking on us. 

Why I give five stars?

Still THE BEST MEXICAN FOOD in town for a more educated palate.
author: Geena T.

description: I loooooooooooooooooooooove this place. Nothing negative to say, I think the best seat is at the bar!
author: Gerardo G.

description: Yummmm. I have had a lot of mexican food - cheap, expensive, fancy, taco-truck and whoever said expensive mexican food isn't worth it is wrong. Soooo good!
author: Anna V.

description: I hate to do this, but here is it - we had a really bad service experience here last night.  We got to the restaurant around 5.40 and were the only people at the restaurant.  We didn't have reservations.  My friend and I had some drinks and a few appetizers.  It was still a $60-something dollar bill.  When we were done with food, the waitress asked if we wanted another round of drinks.  The margaritas were yummy, so we said yes.  She brings us our drinks and the bill, which we paid.  Five minutes later, another waitress/hostess comes up and tells us they need this table for a large party that has reservations.  At this point around 7pm, the place is really crowded.  She tells us that they don't have another table to move us to and the bar is full, but she still wants us to give up our seats.  I was shocked.  Really?  That's how you treat your customers?  Then she informed us that since we didn't have reservations, somebody should have informed us that we will need to give up the table by 7pm.  I have never been treated so poorly in a restaurant.  The food was good and drinks were good, but it'll be a long time before I decide to come back here.
author: Lidiya B.

description: Glad I found this place after giving up on the line at Katanaya next door. The fish tacos were brilliant. Will have to come back to sample their extensive tequila collection. It's definitely worth stopping in if you're in the neighborhood, but maybe not something I'd go out of my way to seek out just because. If the atmosphere was a bit better, the server a bit quicker and the upholstery on the booths not torn up it might warrant the full five stars.
author: Laura w.

description: This is excellent Mexican food.  You won't find burritos, tacos, or fajitas on the menu.  Definitely order the guacamole that they make for you tableside.  Queso fundido is good, hot chorizo and cheeze...mmmm...  They recently added a fabulous stuffed chicken dish with huitlacoche and some other vegetables, really really good.  If you go for lunch, I always get the berenjena gratinada...so I can't vouch for anything else on the lunch menu, but this one is fantastic.  They also have the best cornbread...don't know how authentic that is, but it's damn good.  The only desert I liked was the chocolate cake, very good - other desert's were so-so.
author: jerri b.

description: With all the good Mexican food we have in the city, why go to an overpriced tourist hangout where dudes make guacamole table-side? It's just silly.
author: Bourbon S.

description: This was the second time I enjoyed Colibri and it was just as great as the first.  The menu is quite diverse.  Most of the dishes are served Tapas style, so I recommend ordering at least two dishes.  Be sure to order fresh guacamole, along with homemade tortillas, which is prepared right at your table!  The bar offered a wide range of tequilas.  Upon my last visit, our server even  gave my mom one of their gorgeous tequila bottles to take home complimentary.  The restaurant is quite large, so you can usually count on getting a table.  It is located right downtown, so its convenient after a busy day of shopping.
author: kiki W.

description: Stopped at this place on Saturday to get a quick bite to eat on the cheap.  Boy were we wrong!!  Yes, it may have cool atmosphere, and yes they did play Shakira the whole time I was there (you gotta love her).  However, after ordering mediocre margaritas, gauc w/ flour tortillas (?) and ceviche, our bill came to $89!  Honestly people!  2 apps and 4 margaritas!  My date and I were in shock.  Yes we DID order "top-shelf" but still, we felt it was a little outrageous.  I do have to admit that the food is good, and the guac was creamy and rich.  However, I will think twice about going here again for a "quick bite".
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Top Notch!

Myself and my wife decided to try this place and what a pleasant surprise. This is not "Beans and rice" type Mexican restaurant - The meals we had were high end without the high end prices. I had the catch of the day and she had the chicken over potatoes. Both had a Mexican feel to them but once again, this is not a burrito place.

For dessert we had a new entry on the dessert menu, Mango Creme Brulee. It is one of those desserts i would come just for that when i want something sweet.

Nice service, great appetizer, great food, great dessert, nice hip ambiance with decent prices.

This would be a good date place for you singles too BTW.
author: Frank H.

description:
Went there after receiving a recommendation while looking at the menu in the doorway...

Service was good, could have been a little better - we were just put off by a bit of an attitude... nothing obvious...


Food was incredible - they give you tortillas (handmade) with three salsas - one hot, one sweet, one 'in-between'...

Skipped the appetizers - but did get to watch the waiter make guacamole on the spot - 1.5 avacadoes, tomatoes, onions, etc.

I got a scallop dish, she got chicken... excellent - perfectly cooked,  sauces were incredible...

Kinda pricey for us, but great food....
author: NC I.

description:
Pretty disappointing. Though we may have gone on an off night, we found that both the food and the service severely lacked. The menu and pricing are similar  to Maya, but they don't deliver on that promise. 

Our waitress was one of those that doesn't like to write down the order, which is fine, but when she repeated it back to us, she got it wrong - not impressive. It went downhill from there with only a third of the items we ordered (two soups, two appetizers, and two entrees) being decent, the rest being disappointments.
author: Matthew Z.

description: I luvvvvv the bartender! Adrian....hes HOT!
author: Ms B t.

description: It's the little things that count. PJ loves the fresh corn tortillas that melt in your mouth.  These go well with the mouth-watering spicy guacamole from Avocado heaven. To wash it all down try a fresh fruity margarita, pick your flavor, with the perfect twist of tanginess.  I drink it virgin because I'm just a little piglet.  Enjoy --Oink Oink!
author: PJ T.

description: a little spendy for what you get, but I would eat here again if I attend an event at Ruby Skye.
author: Josh T.

description: Great atmosphere and location, with an excellent choice of margaritas (the blood orange margarita, a special last week, was EXCELLENT).  Having the guacamole prepared to your taste at the table was a wonderful surprise.  The food portions are small and tapas style, which is well explained by the wait staff.  The quality of the food is great!
author: Peter M.

description: I have mixed feelings about this place. The drinks were awesome. I highly recommend the Mojito's. The food was great. We ordered a bunch of dishes and shared everything. The service was pretty lousy with the exception of the busser who was the only one who asked if we enjoyed our meal. I might go again.
author: Amber W.

description: We visited this restaurant at 4:30pm Saturday because of a food review we caught in the Chron. The place was virtually empty but because we had no reservation the hostess sat us at a horrendous table next to the servers. We asked for a better table (again the place was almost empty) and after checking her system sat us at a pleasant table. Five minutes later she was back and said we would have to move because the Manager "said so". She had confirmed the next reservation for the table was 7:30. I spoke with the Manager who waived me off and only responded we could have the original table. The only conclusion is that there was some unknown arrogance surrounding the fact that we asked for a better table without benetit of a reservation. I would not recommend this restaurant because of the indifference and rudeness on the part of the management. Success can get in the way of common sense.
author: clif w.

description: the only knock on this place is their prices! so damn expensive for what you get. i've been here on two occassions. i've had their queso (decent), and their guacamole (pretty good). another knock on this place is they don't have any tortilla chips??!! although the warm tortillas were good, i would rather have had chips with my guac and queso. they also give you three types of salsa dipping sauces with your tortillas. the sweet one was pretty damn good. their margaritas were ok, but pricey as hell. they start at $8 per glass and climb up steadily - depending on the kind of tequila you order. i have no complaints about the service. the girl who served my friend and i last time was pretty nice ... she seemed eastern european and she either give me a free margarita or she forget to charge me on the bill. who knows. i might go back at some point.
author: James J.

description: I was really looking forward to eating here, but it did not live up to it's reputation or a previous visit. The guacamole was good. but the carnitas were made in a heart healthy way. Calling them carnitas was a gross insult to Mexican Cuisine. The sauce on the fish of the day tasted like it came out of a jar from TJs. The salsa's were uninspired. And the room was so noisy it was not possible to talk to my companions without shouting. The unenthusiastic one star is for the guacamole alone. Never again.]
author: Dan G.

description: Bambi and Dunzo were in search of a good Margarita and headed here last night. When we arrived the place was packed and they didn't have any tables so we tried the bar to no luck when the hostess came up and said " oh a table just opened up please follow me". We got excited until we saw where we were sitting. OMG this table was way in the back next to their service area against a wooden wall that completely covered any view.  Dunzo said " I think they reserve this area for the ugly people... to which I replied no honey they reserve this back table for the skinny people so we don't scare away their regulars by  giving the impression that the food  is small plates here. And after all we are pretty people.... or maybe we were to cute to be seen... anyways .. the strawberry Margarita was excellent. I love the idea of having your guacamole made at your table... a new twist. I had the fillet Mignon which was tasty but dam people I need to eat too... I mean it was tiny.  Service was actually great maybe because we got there late and most of the dinner crowed was leaving. I will have to go back at an earlier time and see if they will put me back at that table again.
author: Teddy d.

description: I supremely DIG Colibri - not just because hummingbirds are cool in all their glory but because Colibri has GREAT food and a fun atmosphere with encouraging (and perceptive) waitstaff - always a plus.  My first time there I sent a drink to a cute boy at the next table and although he thanked me profusely I later learned (from my oh-so-brilliant waiter) that the object of my affection was gay!  At least the waiter brought me another strong drink and some delicious guac so I could drown my sorrows!
author: Anjali K.

description: This was my second time to Colibri.  I had the guacamole delivered to me already made. The first time I came here, it was prepared fresh at my table.  My waitress was extremely nice and made sure to check up on us the right  amount of times.  I had the mole poblano, not their best plate.  It really lacked flavor.  Their chile relleno was made just right. I also had the tacos de pescado, also tasty. My favorite part of the dinner was the tortillas and assortment of salsas. I also had a few Mojitos, made perfect.  I was not very impressed with their tres leches cake however, which was extra dry and not a bit moist. The flan is their best dessert.  Also, i'm not a fan of tapas(small plates), which is what this restaurant focuses on.  I hope they would add dinner plates. Overall, this restaurant passed the test.  If you're looking for cheap food at a dirty restaurant, this is not the place to dine.  Go to the Mission district. However, if you're looking for fine mexican dining at a nice restaurant and convenient union square location, then this place deserves a try. Make sure you take extra money as dinner for two with drinks and dessert can easily cost you $100.00. This place gets two thumbs up.
author: Alex H.

description: they make your guacamole right there in front of you so its really good. i remember i went here on a date once. i really enjoyed it but i cantremmeber who my date was. so that just shows u how good the food is.
author: Ashley H.

description: i'm not mexican, but i really don't think that this is "authentic" mexican food.  but whatevs, it's still really good for my taste.  they have a great tequila menu, and the margaritas are tasty and fresh.  no mixed cocktails here, just good 'ole tequila and fresh lime juice.  their meat dishes are great; tender, juicy and tasty.  the made at the table guacamole, although not a novelty, is still fun to watch and tasty.  plus, you can make it as hot as you want.  great place to go before a show.
author: Reina M.

description: The queso fundido is awesome! Start with that definitely and of course some margaritas which are superb. The tamales were great but I would of appreciated a couple of more. I loved the the mole and the pechuga, amazing, I'll definitely be back. Thanks to the yelpers who sent me here.
author: Cbr A.

description: Nice place to eat.  Small, but not cramped setting.  The staff was generally attentive and friendly.  Good authentic mexican food (at least as far as I know).  Had the chicken mole which was very good.  Was definitely a fan of the magaritas.
author: Michael M.

description: This is a terrible restaruant;  definitely would never go again.  I went with a group of six we spent close to $400.00.  The service was slow and the food at best was served warm.  I would treat the neighborhood to Chipotle before I ever return to this restauant.
author: Andre D.

description: i went here for lunch as a recommendation from a friend this past saturday, and i was thoroughly impressed with it!  the decor is beyond beautiful, and the staff extremely friendly.  the food itself...yuu-u-mm-m-yy!  i got the chicken enchiladas in red sauce, which were superb!  my girlfriend also got enchiliadas (cheese), and raved they were the best enchiladas she has ever had!  my other friend had the huevos with mole sauce, which was very good as well.  we also enjoyed the complimentary corn tortillas with the 3 different salsas, all of which we thought were really delicious.
author: Kelly T.

description: The margaritas at this place are phenomenal.  Especially the macho margarita which I didn't see on the menu but the bartender recommended.  It has jalepenos and definitely bites back.  The food, however, doesn't.  The pipian was bland.  The chile relleno had no kick whatsoever.  The tamales were also forgettable.  The best thing they serve here are the free tortillas-- those are great.  Come here for a drink or two, not a meal.
author: enid m.

description: Boo. Overpriced. For this prices I expect to be swept of my feet. The portions were small and not nearly magical enough to justify going to Union Square for dinner. Wouldn't ever go again.
author: Silent A.

description: What a treat! Friendly service and great food.Don't miss the guacamole and the warm,fresh,tiny tortillas.  The caipirinha was perfect, as were the chicken mole and fantastic corn cakes.
author: Peggy H.

description: Dropped by for Dine About Town on Friday night, but let me tell you this -it is cheaper to just order the items on the DAT menu separately from the regular menu than from the DAT menu.  And yes, I do check things like that.  I'm not made of money people!  So, Hue L., our non-yelper friend, and I decided to order off the regular menu instead.  We started with MILD guacamole, which I really liked.  It came with 3 different sauces as well.  I like that they give you little tortillas rather than chips.  It's different and I like it!  For my entree, I went for the pork carnitas.  I like carnitas, but I didn't really like it that night.  They were a little too dry for my taste.  For dessert we split the churros and the mango creme brulee.  The mango creme brulee was just so-so for me, but I really liked the churros!  It's a very small space.  The tables are really close together.  And it gets LOUD.  I don't think I'd make a special trip to Colibri in the future, but I'd drop in if I were in the area and try something else.
author: Kris L.

description: I went here last night with my family and we were extremely impressed.  I had heard about it from a friend and based on that recommendation, we decided to give it a try.  It is right in the Theatre District so if you are planning to catch a show, a reservation here would be perfect.  We were told we could possibly face an hour wait as we had just walked in, but our wait was maybe two minutes as they found a place for us to sit.  The guacamole is made fresh right by your table and then served with the homemade salsa and mini tortillas.  The torillas alone were to die for....super warm and fresh.  The restaurant serves dishes tapas style so several dishes to share is the way to go.  Every dish was delicious.  The Nopales appetizers were great too.  We also had their warm chocolate cake which too was excellent.  This is the type of restaurant where I would definitely go back just to try their other dishes.  Prices were good too.  Great date spot for all you men out there!
author: Kirsten M.

description: delicious place.  everything was great from the warm tortillas to the drinks to the dessert.  i went there over 2 years ago, and i still crave the "Negro y Blanco" - dark chocolate mousse & white chocolate confection.
author: Jennifer N.

description: just rememebr to make room for dessert!! you will fall in love the churros with ice cream. makes my mouth hurt just thinking about it
author: natassia s.

description: Have been here 3 or 4 times and very happy. The food is delicious, margaritas are very good and they have over 100 tequilas! Have had good service all but one time. The guacamole and scallops are my favorite. A little pricey but worth it.
author: Adam C.

description: besides the very sweet hostess who didn't seem to know where the restroom was, and the restroom itself....um. yucky, this is a sweet little restaurant. the food here is good...anything unpleasant i encountered was immediately balanced by something just a little bit more pleasant, hence the 3 star rating. i.e. they don't serve their guac with chips (and if you happen to love tortilla chips as much as me, that's sort of a bummer) but their salsas and warm torillas are delicious. the scallops were a bit rubbery, but the corn/potato mash they were served on was incredible. agua fresca, well that's just a plus. and the estofada, is really great too.  it's the kind of place that i could always envision giving a 3. never a 2, but then again never a 4.
author: heather m.

description: This place is amazing. Although I'll never find the Tex-Mex I long for here in San Francisco, I'll take Colibri as the next best thing.  Their tapas style dishes are to die for. In fact, I had Colibri for the first time on a Wednesday.  The very next week I had to go back for more. Their margaritta's are smooth yet strong.  And I love how they give tortillas instead of chips to munch on prior to dinner.  The only drawback is that it's across from the ACT and therefore always crowded. Get there early or eat at the bar.
author: Kelly M.

description: We walked in without a reservation and were seated right away by a beautiful hostess. I loved the atmosphere and the service started out great. The ceveche was outstanding, I am picky and it was truly fresh  and very flavorful. The strawberry margarita on the other hand (the most important part, just kidding but not really )was just OK. a bit too sweet and not very strong. We asked for the drink menu in the middle of our meal, we were planning to order another round but the server never returned and when he finally did he brought us the desert menu and the check. A bit disappointing because I did want to try a different drink, we felt like he wanted us out so we left. I am still drooling from the table next to us who ordered the chorizo and cheese. Dam I should have ordered that too, it looked sooooo gooood.Next time I will just sit at the bar. - 2 stars just for service and my margarita.
author: Dee D.

description: Aside from my own Kitchen, this is one of the few restaurants that I've consistently dined at (9 times in the past 24 months) I go here when friends are in town for a quick visit, or if friends want a place convenient for everyone to gather - Colibri has delivered great food and service every time.  What better way to end a crazy work day than a visit to Colibri for their tasty Margaritas and Table Side Guacamole & Fresh Tortillas.
author: Caryn L.

description: simply put, this place is amazing.  i've only been twice, but each time was wonderful.  this is some of the best mexican food i've ever had.  the guacamole and salsa are handmade there and they are so so good.  you get three kinds of salsa brought to your table along with small corn tortillas, instead of chips.  they have great veggie options too.  i had a margarita that was very strong and very good- they have a wide selection of margaritas, tequilas and other drinks.  the mojito i had the time before was amazing.  i want to take all of my friends here.
author: Kate W.

description: this place has one of the best guacamole i have had, esp. since they make it table side so u can request as much spicy-ness or not...for me...it's all about the cilantro n the lime...they have a appetizer that is some special mexican cheese...ask the waiter to point it out to you...put some of this cheese in a tortilla n add some salsa n some guacamole and you have the best mexican handroll.....i also recommend their fish and their beef dish with a very mild bleu cheese....and if u are in the mood for some non-alcoholic beverage..make sure you have their fresca...its delicious with fresh fruits soaked inside...but you can also go the other way and order their famous mojitos...VIVA LA MEXICO!!!!
author: Mee-stique K.

description: For the quality of the food this place is overpriced.  The margaritas we're great, but do you really have to spend $12 in SF for a good margarita?
author: Dave Y.

description: Colibri has FANTASTIC freshly made guacamole but my absolute favorite is the chocolate cake with ice cream--to die for!
author: L M.

description: I LUV Colibri.... I luv their Tequilito, the Guacamole, the fresh tortillas and the Servers/Hostess!!!! It is arguably the most genuine Mexican food i've had since leaving my momma's kitchen(and let me tell ya, my momma's cooking is famous on my block!)  I highly recommend going with a group of people and trying different dishes.  The restaurant is colorfully decorated and I love the tv at the bar that plays old classic, Mexican films!!!
author: Rosa D.

description: Start with Fresh guacamole made right infront of you, quite a treat for your eyes and tastebuds.  Move to main entree and they all are really good. But, I have a special weakness towards mole poblano, meat is tender and they add just the right amount of chocolate.  Unlike other places, Colibri  mastered the art of residing at that delicate brink of being savory and sweet. Finally you will have to have the special margaritas except the blackberry margarita. That is the only disappointing order I made in my 5 visits to this place.  It might make your wallet feel bit lighter but  you perhaps would not feel it  after enjoying the vibe, drinks and great quality food!
author: Kingshuk g.

description:
It's no secret that lots of folks love Mexican foods - I guarantee you can always name someone you know who love mexican foods and would rather go to a mexican place, than other places (they have a "thang" for it, if you know what I mean). Sadly, the love it seems has outgrown the sensibility in dining at one. The raving reviews of Colibri is one great example. 

The facts:
- $10 Guac, prep tableside - with 1.5 avos, chopped onions, tomatoes, cilantro, j'penos and TABLESALT (yep, the harsh tasting, Denny's pairing, throat thirsting, Table Salt). Tableside prep. is a gimmick for a bland tasting Guac. and that just doesn't justify a 10dollarbill. They can do better than that.
- $12.50 margaritas - This place ain't Gramercy Tavern - nor is it close to a Manhattan cocktail spot or San Francisco for that matter. They must've knew most over 21 would not go to a mex place w/out sippin 'ritas - Ca-ching!
- $14 Carnitas. 6 chunky pork nuggets on a plate. I like the simplicity of  it, but there' nothing to brag about. Tender from hrs of braising, and nicely caramel colored outside, possibly from a quick dunk at the fryer
- $18 Chicken stuffed mushroom w/ crema sauce (daily special). Taste good, but it's nothing mexican/ latin - and anyone who have had a decent al fredo sauce can nod their head when they taste this dish. $18 for a chicken entree on small plate?
- $7 Tres leches cake - it is what it is. Whether you get it at safeway or a mexican panaderia in downtown san jose, this one is no difference.
-$7 Coffee Flan w/ tequila. If only I had a camera to show it here. The edges of this flan looks as if the cooks (i doubt they have pastry chef back there - although the price suggest they're at par w/ Boulevard, Citizen cake and the like) had been having fun with his pairing-knife to get the flan out of its tinfoil mold. It's wet and soggy, on the sweeter side - which is ok. Then they put a flower-shaped carved strawberry on the side for that 80s presentation look.

It is with deep regret I must say this place lacks compassion of true latin cooking, and they priced their menus way over their game. Sure you have to make bottomline and SF ain't cheap place - but the City is full of other places with open doors, decent drinks and better fare. Total bill came to $92 before tip - for dinner for two (1 appy, 2 ritas, 2 ents and 2 desserts). This would be a 3stars, but the tab just knock off a notch in your stomach. Our waitstaff is very sincere the whole time and it appears his colleagues are too from our observation on a busy friday night.
author: Billy J.

description: Not a very experienced Mexican eater, but this was easily the best I've had.  Just back from a lovely meal with the missus and the place was buzzing at 7.30 on the second last Monday before Christmas.  Lovely atmosphere, really great tasting, simple food in which you can taste all the ingredients and friendly unobtrusive service made it a very enjoyable dining experience all round.  The live music was a bonus.  Just one thing lads, turn down the air-con; no need for it when it's 44 outside.  We'll be back.
author: Donal T.

description: Anytime we're off to a show at the Curran, we hit up Colibri before hand. As most have said, the guac is tremendous. We also love the fact that instead of chips and salsa, you get mini tortillas and salsa. Make sure to get the Carnitas too - very tender and juicy!
author: Scott B.

description: Possibly the only good thing an old friend ever did for me was to introduce me to this restaurant. I could have a great meal here with the fresh, thick and fragrant corn tortillas alone. It takes mexican cuisine seriously, as it should be (it's the best cuisine on planet earth after all!) You can order almost anything and it will be off-the charts fresh and bursting with flavor. Their salsas and guacamoles are sooo good. They have an extensive tequila collection, and an interesting and unique cocktail menu. The last time I went they were playing an old black and white lucha libre movie. All this, AND their bartenders are cute. Rar!
author: Kristina G.

description:
I had been here a year ago with my son for appetizers and a drink and had always wanted to come back.  Unfortunately, my return trip with husband and 8 year old twins was quite disappointing. The hostess was unfriendly, and seated us  in a far corner telling us we needed to finish within an hour and a half because the table was reserved. (we didn't have reservations, but it was only 5 pm) Our server was not particularly helpful either, when we asked if there were any vegetarian entrees for our daughters. I ended up ordering the shrimp for one daughter after he assured me it wasn't spicy. It WAS spicy when it arrived, and she couldn't eat it. 
     Then a table for 10 was seated next to us, and our server totally ignored us after that, leaving us waiting to have dishes cleared, waiting 15 minutes for a dessert menu, etc. while he gave all his attention to the larger table, obviously hoping for a large tip from them and figuring we were not worth as much of his time.
     I'd only give this place one star, but the tortillas and guacamole were excellent. The entrees we ordered-chicken, shrimp in mole sauce, and caesar salad were mediocre at best. The caesar had a mayonnaise-y dressing and what looked like pepperidge farm croutons. Yuck.
author: ann c.

description: Great food, margaritas and atmosphere!! A real treat!
author: L D.

description: The tortilla soup rocks!  I love the food, and the can't wait to go back.  Although, there was quite a wait on Sat. night...about 40 min at 8:00... I guess this place is no secret.
author: Eve N.

description: I had a very bad experience at this restaurant on Sunday, Dec 3rd and would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy!   We waited for almost an hour to be served, then had to wolf down our meals because we had theatre tickets.   I had ordered the chili relleno, which was so hot (seeds had not been removed) that it was inedible.  I tried two bites, but was unable to eat any more than that.  So it was sent back, and an appetizer was ordered instead.  when the bill came i was surprised to see that I had been charged for both items, and when I spoke to the person in charge, she said that I had eaten too much of it and that is why i was charged.  Not only was the service horrible, but her attitude left much to be desired.  I have never had this experience; when an item is sent back because it is inedible, I have never been charged.  This was an extremely disappointing experience, to say the least, and I won't be back.
author: Deb K.

description: the tortilla soup makes a trip to colibri worth it, as does their selection of tequilas. just be prepared to spend some money...
author: Jaakko P.

description: two words - blech and blah.  the food was mediocre and the service was painfully slow (there wasn't even a hostess at the front so - although we arrived on time for our reservations - we had to wait for 10 mins before anyone even checked us in, let alone found us a table).  the guac was the best thing on the menu - although what they billed as "spicy" barely registered as mild.  the tortilla soup arrived cold.  the quesadillas were swimming in their own grease and the pozole was flavorless.  the one redeeming element were the tortillas.  truly fabulous.  the best i've had north of LA.  but not enough to save the rest of the meal.  i'll never go back.
author: Leyla F.

description: 4.5 stars....Colibri was the first restaurant I went to when I first visited SF before I moving here. Since then, I take everyone who visits here. Last night was exceptional. The service was on point.....there was a hostess (or manager) who came to our table often to check on us and was very informative in describing dishes to my parents (who were visiting from Boston and not too familiar with Mexican cuisine). The waiter, who I have had before, was on point as always. We obviously started with the guacamole....Mole! Mole! :) My mother got the Hawaiian fish (special) which was buttery and melted in your mouth. My father and I, the Filet, which bursts wonderful flavors in  your mouth even 30 minutes after the meal. This is a Mexican BISTRO people....don't expect burritos and tortilla chips. Reasonably priced for what you get. Perfect sized portions that will leave you full but not to the point of requesting a wheelchair to roll you from the restaurant to your bed. YUM YUM
author: Diana D.

description: we stumbled on this place while wandering around for a good place to eat, this place is one of the best tapa places i have been to... very unique with its eclectic blend of food, everything there was generous, fresh and tasty, i loved their fresh salsa, my order of scallops and the order of lamb...hmmm... i salavate just thinking of their scrumpcious food... definitely one of my favorite restaurants period!... also the decor was very cozy with its rustic appeal...a must for anyone who enjoys excellent food, great service and unpretentious ambiance...
author: linda n.

description: The food was tasty.  Actually it was delicious. But I have a REAL problem with Mexican food when it is served as Tapas AND is outrageously overpriced.  $18 for a filet mignon the size of a child's fist, swimming in mash potatoes?  $16 for 3 chunks of carnitas with a few grilled green onions?  $5 for a side of rice??? $5 for a side of beans?  Come on.  That's almost a crime. I would never take my family there because it's an insult to our intelligence.  Too bad for that because the flavors were really great.  I even loved the guacamole which was so good, I overlooked the  fact that they were making it in a molcajete with a plastic bowl liner.  I don't want dramatics, I want good food.  Oh yeah, and the ambiance was very nice too.  So maybe they have high rent in Union Square.  But come on...if your food is that good, you can open a restaurant  or "bistro" anywhere in the city and people will come seek you out.  I'll stick to the Mission.
author: Desiree E.
